title: Virtual Office & Travel Operations Assistant
description:
Position Overview



Mysterious Adventures Tours (MAT) is seeking a highly organized, proactive Senior Virtual Office & Travel Operations Assistant to support executive leadership and day-to-day business operations.



This role blends business office administration with travel advisor/agent expertise, serving as a central hub for communications, scheduling, task coordination, CRM management, and itinerary support. 

The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced, detail-driven environment and understands both professional office workflows and travel logistics.



This is not a basic VA role — this position requires judgment, follow-through, and the ability to manage moving parts across teams, systems, and timelines.



Key Responsibilities



Office & Executive Support

Monitor and respond to inbound
 and phone inquiries related to MAT services



Follow up, connect and call prospects that interested in upcoming tours



Manage executive calendar scheduling, reminders, and time-blocking



Coordinate internal communications between leadership and tea
mbers



Maintain organized digital files, documents, and operational records



Team & Task Management

Track and manage tea
mbers’ tasks, duties, and deadlines



Oversee task flow within Project Management software, ensuring:

Tasks are created, assigned, followed up, and closed

Dependencies and priorities are clearly documented



Flag bottlenecks, missed deadlines, or operational risks proactively

CRM & Systems Management



Update and maintain CRM records, client notes, and inquiry pipelines

Track leads, follow-ups, bookings, and communication history



Ensure data accuracy and consistency across systems

Travel & Itinerary Support



Assist with procurement of accommodations, activities, and services for curated itineraries



Support research, availability checks, quotes, and documentation



Coordinate with suppliers, vendors, and internal stakeholders as needed



Maintain organized records of supplier details and itinerary components



General Office Operations

Support operational workflows, checklists, and SOP execution



Assist with internal reporting and tracking as requested



Provide administrative support across departments as the business scales



Required Experience & Qualifications



Proven experience in business office administration (virtual or in-office)



Travel agent or travel advisor background (required)

Strong written and verbal communication skills



High attention to detail with excellent organizational ability

Comfortable managing multiple systems, deadlines, and stakeholders



Ability to work independently while staying aligned with leadership priorities

title: IT Systems & Integrations Specialist
description:
Position Title

IT Systems & Integrations Specialist 



Role Overview

Mysterious Adventures Tours (MAT) is seeking a highly skilled Independent IT Systems & Integrations Specialist to support our growing technology ecosystem. 



This contractor will play a critical role in optimizing our digital infrastructure, improving system performance, and ensuring seamless integration between platforms used across operations, marketing, sales, and finance.



This role is project-based and execution-focused, ideal for a self-directed professional who can assess technical gaps, recommend solutions, and implement improvements with minimal supervision.



Core Responsibilities

API, CRM & Data Integrations

Configure, optimize, and maintain integrations between CRM, booking platforms, payment processors,
 marketing tools, and third-party applications.



Troubleshoot data sync issues and ensure data integrity across systems.



Assist with API connections, webhooks, and automation tools as needed.



Website & Technical Optimization

Support ongoing website optimization initiatives, including performance improvements, plugin configuration, and technical troubleshooting.



Collaborate with marketing and operations teams to implement technical enhancements that improve conversions, UX, and reliability.



Tracking, Analytics & Reporting

Assist with setup and maintenance of tracking tools (GA4, pixels, conversion tracking, dashboards).

Support reporting workflows that provide actionable insights for leadership.



Workflow & Automation Support

Build, refine, and document workflows that reduce manual effort and improve operational efficiency.



Support automation across CRM,
, forms, and internal processes.



 & Communications Optimization



Assist with technical setup and optimization of
 platforms, deliverability settings, authentication (SPF, DKIM, DMARC), and integrations.



Troubleshoot automation and campaign delivery issues.



General IT & Technical Support

Provide ad-hoc technical assistance for internal tools, interfaces, and system configurations.



Identify risks, inefficiencies, or scalability issues and proactively recommend solutions.



Deliverables & Expectations

Reliable execution of assigned technical tasks within agreed timelines.



Clear documentation of integrations, workflows, and configurations.



Proactive communication regarding risks, dependencies, and optimization opportunities.

Required Skills & Experience

Proven experience with CRM systems, APIs, and SaaS integrations.



Strong understanding of web technologies, analytics, and automation tools.



Ability to troubleshoot across platforms and work independently.

Experience supporting small to mid-sized businesses or fast-growing organizations.



Contractor Structure

Independent contractor 

Hourly

Remote Position



Flexible schedule, remote

Reports to MAT leadership and collaborates cross-functionally



Success Profile

This contractor thrives in a dynamic environment, balances technical depth with business awareness, and takes ownership of system reliability and optimization—helping MAT scale efficiently while maintaining operational clarity.

title: CEO's Executive Assistant
description:
About the Role:



This Executive Assistant role supports the CEO directly in a fast-paced, high-stakes environment. Priorities can shift multiple times in a week, and you’ll often need to make decisions independently while keeping multiple projects aligned.





Who this is for:



The EA who succeeds is confident, proactive, and adaptable. You’ll need to anticipate needs, manage competing priorities, and communicate clearly under pressure. While the role is demanding, it’s incredibly rewarding in terms of learning, impact, and exposure to executive-level decision-making.





What You’ll Be Doing:



1. Keeping the CEO’s calendar, meetings, and priorities organized, and catching conflicts before they happen.

2. Acting as the CEO’s right hand: making sure messages, updates, and follow-ups happen smoothly across teams.

3. Drafting and reviewing
s, presentations, and reports so they’re clear and professional.

4. Taking ownership of high-priority projects from start to finish, often with little direction.

5. Tracking deadlines and progress on multiple projects, flagging any potential problems early.

6. Doing research, summarizing info, and presenting solutions that make the CEO’s life easier.

7. Being the point person for internal and external partners, always professional and discreet.

8. Adapting quickly when priorities shift or last-minute requests come in—staying calm is key.

9. Finding ways to improve processes and workflows so things run more smoothly.





Must-Have:



> Proven experience supporting a senior executive, ideally a CEO or high-level leader.

> Superb organizational skills—you can juggle multiple priorities without dropping the ball.

> Excellent communication—clear, concise, and confident in both speaking and writing.

> Strong problem-solving skills—you can make decisions and figure things out independently.

> Emotional intelligence and resilience—you stay composed even when things get hectic or tricky.

> Discretion—you know how to handle sensitive info carefully.

> Tech-savvy with calendars, communication tools, and docs.





Nice-to-Have:



i. Experience in strategic projects or operations.

ii. Comfortable collaborating across multiple teams in a fast-paced environment.

iii. Ability to anticipate needs and solve problems before they become issues.





Why You’ll Love This Role:



If you like fast-paced work, making an impact, and being in the center of everything, this is a place where you can shine. You’ll learn a ton, grow quickly, and work closely with the CEO to help the company run like a well-oiled machine.





How to Apply:



Use “I can do this” as your subject line and tell us why you’d love this role.

title: Digital Operations Assistant
description:
Location

Independent Contractor

________________________________________

Position Summary

Absolute Promotional, LLC is seeking a Digital Operations Assistant to support a focused set of ongoing business activities. This role is centered on managing print on demand storefronts, monitoring public local, state and federal bid opportunities, and handling social media management tasks. The position is fully remote and requires the ability to work independently, follow instructions precisely, and maintain consistency.

Social Media Management

What We Offer

.

This role does not involve sales, cold calling, or order entry at this time. In the future, tea
mbers who excel in the position may be offered the opportunity to earn additional income by assisting with promotional product sales through our established website and social media platforms.

Work directly with the owner and regional manager, not a large corporate team

title: Remote Wix Website Builder & SEO/SEM Specialist (Part-Time Contractor)
description:
Job Title: Remote Wix Website Builder & SEO/SEM Specialist (Part-Time Contractor)

Location: 100% Remote (Philippines-based applicants preferred)

Company: California-based FMS (Focused on becoming #1 globally in attracting product inquiries through optimized digital presence)

Job Type: Independent Contractor (Hourly billing via PayPal, Wise, or similar)

Schedule: 5 hours per day, Monday through Friday (approximately 25 hours per week)



Must overlap with US Pacific Standard Time (PST) business hours (e.g., 8 AM – 5 PM PST for collaboration; night shift in PH time ideal, as 10 AM PH = 6 PM previous day PST).



Compensation: $6–$10 USD per hour (based on experience and certifications; typical for experienced PH-based talent in this role). Paid weekly or bi-weekly. Negotiable for top candidates with proven results in driving global inquiries.

About the Role

FMS is a dynamic California company dedicated to leading the market in global product inquiries. We're seeking a skilled, certified Wix specialist with expertise in SEO and search engine marketing (SEM) to build, optimize, and maintain our websites remotely on a part-time basis. Your work will directly contribute to enhancing our online visibility, attracting international traffic, and positioning FMS as the top choice for product inquiries worldwide. This role may expand if performance excels.

Key Responsibilities



Design, build, and customize responsive websites using Wix platform, ensuring user-friendly navigation, mobile optimization, and integration of e-commerce or inquiry forms.

Implement on-page and off-page SEO strategies to improve search rankings, including keyword research, content optimization, meta tags, alt text, and site speed enhancements.

Manage SEM campaigns (e.g., Google Ads, paid search) to drive targeted global traffic and product inquiries, including ad creation, bidding, A/B testing, and performance tracking.

Analyze website performance using tools like Google Analytics and Search Console to identify opportunities for increasing inquiries from diverse global markets.

Perform regular site audits, updates, and maintenance to ensure SEO/SEM best practices are applied for maximum visibility and conversion.

Collaborate remotely with the team (via Slack, Zoom,
) to align on goals, report on metrics (e.g., traffic growth, inquiry rates), and suggest improvements for global reach.

Focus on strategies that attract international audiences, such as multilingual SEO elements or region-specific targeting to make FMS #1 in product inquiries.



Requirements



3+ years of experience building and managing websites on Wix, with a portfolio of live sites demonstrating SEO/SEM integration.

Proven track record in driving traffic and inquiries through SEO and paid search for global audiences.

Strong understanding of search engine algorithms, digital marketing trends, and tools like Google Analytics, Google Search Console, SEMrush, Ahrefs, or similar.

Excellent English communication skills (written and verbal) for professional reports and team interactions.

Reliable high-speed internet, quiet workspace, and flexibility for PST hours.

Ability to work independently as a remote contractor.



Required Certifications/Training

To ensure high-quality, professional work aligned with industry standards:



Wix-Specific: Wix Certified (e.g., Wix Partner Certification, Wix Web Designer Certification, or completion of Wix's official training courses on website building and SEO via Wix Learn).

SEO: Google Analytics Certification (Google Skillshop), SEMrush SEO Fundamentals Certification, HubSpot SEO Certification, or Ahrefs SEO Training Course.

SEM (Search Engine Marketing): Google Ads Certification (Search, Display, or Performance Max tracks via Google Skillshop), Microsoft Advertising Certified Professional, or equivalent paid search training from platforms like Udemy or Coursera.

These certifications demonstrate expertise and are essential for optimizing FMS's global inquiry strategy.



Preferred (Big Plus)



Experience with additional tools (e.g., Google Tag Manager, Hotjar for user behavior, Canva for visuals, or
 marketing platforms like Mailchimp).

Background in e-commerce or lead generation sites, with examples of increasing global inquiries.

Familiarity with international SEO (e.g., hreflang tags, geo-targeting).



How to Apply

Submit:



Resume/CV with Wix/SEO/SEM experience and certifications listed.

Portfolio links to Wix sites you've built/optimized, including before-after metrics on traffic/inquiries if available.

Expected hourly rate in USD.

Brief note on your PST availability and how you've driven global product inquiries in past roles.



We'll review quickly and may include a short Wix/SEO skills test. Join us in making FMS the global leader in product inquiries!

title: Associate Product Manager – Digital Assets & Tokenization
description:
ViewTrade Technology Corporation 



About Us 



ViewTrade Technology (VTT) is building the next generation of global brokerage infrastructure — integrating tokenized securities, distributed ledger connectivity, and institutional-grade digital asset capabilities into our regulated platform across the U.S., APAC, and GIFT City (India). 



We are seeking an Associate Product Manager – Digital Assets & Tokenization to join our team. This is a hands-on execution role working directly with senior product and engineering leadership to deliver blockchain and tokenization initiatives. If you understand blockchain fundamentals and want to contribute inside a regulated broker-dealer and market infrastructure environment, this role is for you. 



  



Role Overview 

You will help translate ViewTrade’s tokenization strategy into real product delivery. Key areas of focus include: 

•  Tokenized equity initiatives 

•  Stablecoin settlement workflows 

•  Wallet and custody integrations 

•  Viking (books & records) digital asset enhancements 

•  DTCC sandbox / clearing partner integration efforts 



You will collaborate closely with Engineering, DevOps, Operations, Compliance, and external partners. 



Key Responsibilities 

1. Product Execution Support 

•  Define product requirements for digital asset features. 

•  Convert strategy documents into PRDs, user stories, acceptance criteria, and API specifications. 

•  Track sprint progress and coordinate with Engineering teams across the U.S. and India. 



2. Blockchain & Tokenization Tooling 

•  Support implementation and documentation of token standards (ERC-20, ERC-1400 concepts). 

•  Assist with smart contract interactions (read/write flows). 

•  Contribute to wallet integration logic and stablecoin settlement flows. 

•  Ensure alignment between blockchain state and internal books & records systems. 



3. Integration Coordination 

•  Work on integration efforts with clearing partners, custody providers, wallet infrastructure, and trading platforms. 

•  Document data flows, reconciliation processes, exception handling logic, and operational runbooks. 



4. Viking Enhancement Support 

•  Map current end-of-day batch workflows to future event-driven models. 

•  Support digital asset ledger entries and stablecoin cash reconciliation logic. 

•  Conduct gap analysis and assist in feature prioritization. 



5. Regulatory & Operational Readiness 

•  Collaborate with Compliance and Operations to document custody treatment models. 

•  Support audit trail design and track regulatory requirements impacting digital assets. 

•  Prepare materials for internal and external due diligence. 



What You’ll Be Working On 

•  Tokenized securities integration 

•  Stablecoin settlement models 

•  Digital wallet orchestration 

•  Smart contract execution logic 

•  Cross-border brokerage flows 

•  Institutional digital asset infrastructure 



Note: This is not a crypto trading app role — this is regulated market infrastructure.

  

Required Qualifications 

•  1–4 years of experience in product management, blockchain development, fintech engineering, or capital markets technology. 

•  Strong understanding of blockchain fundamentals, token standards (ERC-20 basics), wallet concepts, and smart contracts. 

•  Ability to write structured product documentation. 

•  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. 

•  Comfortable working across time zones. 



Preferred Qualifications 

•  Exposure to brokerage or trading platforms. 

•  Familiarity with EVM-based networks, REST APIs, and microservice architectures. 

•  Basic understanding of broker-dealer operations, clearing and settlement workflows, and regulatory considerations (AML/KYC, custody, reconciliation). 



Growth Path 

This role can evolve into: 

•  Senior Product Manager – Digital Assets 

•  Blockchain Platform Lead 

•  Tokenization Strategy Lead 

•  Cross-Border Digital Infrastructure Product Lead 



You will gain direct exposure to executive leadership, clearing partners, institutional clients, and real regulatory architecture.

title: Land Comping Specialist (Remote – Full Time/Part Time)
description:
About the Role



We are a U.S.-based land investing company that buys and sells vacant land across the United States. We are looking for a sharp, detail-oriented Land Comping Specialist to join our team. Your primary role will be to quickly and accurately evaluate comparable parcels to determine market value and identify key property characteristics that affect that value.



Speed and accuracy are critical — you should be able to comp a property in approximately 1 minute once trained on our system.



Responsibilities

 • Comp vacant land parcels using platforms including Redfin, Zillow, LandPortal, PropStream, 
, LandWatch, and county assessor/GIS websites

 • Use Google Earth / Google Maps to visually assess properties

 • Identify and flag the following property characteristics:

 • Road access — does the parcel have legal and physical access?

 • Landlocked parcels — no access to a public road

 • Flood zone status — using FEMA flood maps or PropStream

 • Paved vs. dirt/gravel road frontage

 • Topography — flat, sloped, heavily wooded, wetlands, etc.

 • Utilities availability — water, sewer, electric nearby

 • Zoning — residential, agricultural, commercial, or mixed use

 • HOA/POA — whether the parcel is in a subdivision with dues or restrictions

 • Lot size and dimensions — usability of the land

 • Nearby comparables — recent sold comps and active listings

 • Days on market of comparable listings

 • Price per acre analysis

 • Proximity to towns, cities, highways, or amenities

 • Environmental issues — wetlands, easements, mineral rights, etc.

 • In-fill lots vs. rural parcels — understanding the difference in valuation

 • Assist with outbound marketing campaigns for land wholesaling/flipping (make outbound offers via text to start)

 • Communicate findings clearly in our tracking spreadsheet or CRM

 • Flag red flags or deal-killers quickly



Requirements

 • Experience comping vacant land (not just residential homes) strongly preferred

 • Familiarity with U.S. land investing, wholesaling, or flipping is a big plus

 • Proficient with Redfin, Zillow, PropStream, LandPortal, 
, LandWatch, Google Earth

 • Comfortable navigating county assessor, GIS, and tax websites

 • Strong attention to detail and ability to work quickly

 • Reliable internet connection and computer

 • Excellent English communication (written)

 • Experience with outbound marketing campaigns (mail, cold calling lists, or data management) is a bonus



Nice to Have

 • Experience with tools like REI Conversion, Pebble, FreedomSoft, Podio, or Airtable

 • Background in real estate virtual assistance

 • Knowledge of FEMA flood map lookup (
)

 • Familiarity with land-specific comping challenges (sparse comps, large acreage adjustments, rural markets)



Compensation

 • Competitive hourly rate based on experience

 • Long-term opportunity for the right candidate

 • Performance bonuses possible



To Apply



Please send a short video or voice message introducing yourself and describing your experience with land comping or real estate data research. Include examples of tools you’ve used and your typical turnaround time per property to

title: Land Acquisition VA - Land Texting & Lead Qualificationa
description:
Land Acquisition VA – SMS/Texting Specialist (Land Wholesaling)



Position: Virtual Assistant – Land Texting & Lead Qualification

Hours: Full-time (40 hrs/week)

Location: Remote

Compensation: Competitive hourly rate (based on experience)



About the Role



We are a U.S.-based real estate investment company focused on vacant land and small acreage. We are looking for a highly experienced SMS/Texting VA to manage conversations with inbound and outbound text leads.



Your primary responsibility will be to have real conversations with landowners via SMS, filter out unqualified leads, and identify motivated sellers. You will qualify good leads, gather key information, and push strong opportunities into our CRM for further review.



This is not a copy-paste texting role. You must be comfortable thinking, responding naturally, and guiding conversations toward pricing and motivation.



Key Responsibilities

 • Handle two-way SMS conversations with landowners from text campaigns

 • Ask qualifying questions to determine:

 • Ownership confirmation

 • Motivation to sell

 • Price expectations

 • Timeline

 • Filter out unmotivated or non-serious leads

 • Move qualified seller leads into the CRM with detailed notes

 • Maintain clean and accurate CRM records (status, notes, follow-ups)

 • Escalate strong leads or pricing opportunities to acquisitions

 • Follow provided conversation frameworks while sounding natural

 • Maintain compliance with opt-out requests (“STOP”)



What We’re Looking For (REQUIRED)

 • Prior experience in real estate wholesaling (land preferred)

 • Hands-on experience texting or calling sellers

 • Comfortable discussing:

 • Vacant land

 • Acreage

 • Pricing conversations

 • Basic comps / market value

 • Strong written English (natural, conversational tone)

 • Ability to think critically, not just follow scripts

 • Organized and detail-oriented with CRM updates

 • Reliable internet and availability during U.S. business hours



Strongly Preferred (Not Required, but a BIG Plus)

 • Experience specifically in land flipping / land wholesaling

 • Familiarity with:

 • SMS platforms (Smarter Contact, Launch Control, etc.)

 • CRMs (Pebble, Airtable, Podio, FreedomSoft)

 • Understanding of:

 • Basic land comps

 • Access, zoning, or buildability discussions

 • Experience soft-making offers or discussing price ranges via text



What Success Looks Like

 • You can independently manage dozens of conversations per day

 • Bad leads are filtered quickly and efficiently

 • Good leads are well-documented and pushed into the CRM

 • Conversations feel human, not robotic

 • Acquisitions only sees qualified, motivated sellers



Application Instructions (IMPORTANT)



To apply, please include:

 1. A brief description of your real estate wholesaling experience

 2. Whether you have land-specific experience

 3. The SMS platforms and CRMs you’ve used

 4. A short example of how you would respond to this text:



“I might sell. What’s your offer?”



(We are testing for tone and qualification ability.)



Applications without these items will not be reviewed.



Why This Role Is Different

 • You are not just “sending texts”

 • You are acting as the first line of acquisitions

 • You’ll be trusted with real seller conversations

 • Opportunity for long-term work and expanded responsibility

title: Marketing Analyst (SQL/AWS)
description:
PLEASE APPLY THROUGH THIS LINK: 
/applyjob-noncaller-1



About Us:

With over 100 years of combined industry experience, the Community Minerals team specializes in the purchase of mineral or royalty rights all over the US. We have earned a stellar reputation with hundreds of satisfied customers and an “A” Rating with the Better Business Bureau. With our proven track record, we continue to serve mineral owners in several states with transparency, accountability, and a personalized experience to meet individual needs.



Job Summary:

The Marketing Performance Analyst’s core objective is to empower the Marketing team with actionable insights to drive data-driven marketing strategies and optimize campaign performance. This role requires advanced skills in querying databases (MySQL/AWS) and generating detailed analytics reports that align marketing efforts with strategic objectives, ultimately enhancing marketing performance and ROI.



Job Description:



• Develop comprehensive reports from multiple data sources (MySQL, AWS, CRM systems), providing actionable insights to track and optimize marketing campaign performance.

• Generate, update, and maintain daily, weekly, and monthly KPI reports for the marketing team, assessing performance across channels, identifying trends, and making data-driven recommendations to enhance marketing strategies.

• Create and manage reports for 3 teams within the marketing department, tailoring insights and metrics to support their specific goals and objectives.

• Coordinate with Lead Management Specialists to ensure raw data sources are maintained and up-to-date, ensuring data accuracy and consistency across all marketing datasets.

• Work closely with leadership to provide strategic data insights, helping to align marketing campaigns with overall business goals and objectives.

• Implement, maintain, and refine data processes for collection, cleansing, maintenance, analysis, and validation across marketing datasets.

• Use MySQL and AWS to create, execute, and optimize queries for efficient data retrieval, supporting rapid decision-making and automated reporting where possible.

• Collaborate with marketing and leadership teams to understand key metrics, providing data analysis that drives strategic adjustments, campaign refinements, and business insights.

• Develop and implement forecasting models to predict marketing responses and conversion metrics, supporting marketing budget and resource allocation.

• Develop and maintain process documentation for all reporting and analysis tasks, ensuring consistency, accuracy, and alignment across teams.

• Provide ongoing recommendations based on data analysis to continuously optimize campaign performance, customer segmentation, and conversion strategies.



Qualifications:

• Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Data Science, Marketing Analytics, Computer Science, or a related field.

• Experience: 3-5 years of performance analysis, specifically in a marketing team setting. Experience with MySQL and/or AWS data environments is required.



Technical Skills:

• Advanced proficiency in SQL for data manipulation and querying, with a strong preference for experience in MySQL or AWS.

• Intermediate to advanced skills in Excel and/or Google Sheets for data visualization and modeling.

• Strong familiarity with CRM platforms; knowledge of marketing automation tools is a plus.

• Analytical Skills: High-level analytical skills to identify trends, understand root causes, and make data-backed recommendations.



Additional Skills:

• Strong quantitative skills with the ability to apply statistical methods to marketing performance data.

• Ability to work independently and cross-functionally, handling multiple projects in a dynamic, deadline-driven environment.

• Excellent communication skills to present data insights effectively across various organizational levels.

• Must be willing to work during US business hours



What's in it for You:

- Competitive Compensation: Earn $4.19-$5.25 per hour, commensurate with your skills and experience.

- Work your way: Remote Work Set-Up enabling you to operate from the comfort and convenience of your own chosen workspace

- Flexible Healthcare Bonus (Philippines): A healthcare bonus you control. Use it for HMO coverage, life insurance, or set it aside as an emergency fund—whatever best supports your well-being. It’s entirely up to you.

- Success Incentives: Enjoy company bonuses and performance-driven rewards.

- Soar with Us: Opportunities for career growth and promotions await you.

- Positive Vibes Only: Experience a supportive and uplifting work culture.

- Annual Bonus: We value your dedication throughout the year, rewarding you with an annual performance bonus shared at the end of the year.

- Performance Raise: Your hard work doesn't go unnoticed. Be ready to seize opportunities for a salary increase based on your outstanding performance.

- Performance Incentives: We believe exceptional work deserves recognition. Performance incentives are awarded to individuals who demonstrate outstanding contributions, initiative, and results. It’s our way of celebrating excellence and motivating continued success.

- Discretionary Bonus: At Community Minerals, exceptional work doesn’t go unnoticed. Contractors who consistently go above and beyond may be rewarded with discretionary bonuses, a token of appreciation for outstanding contributions, impactful results, and dedication to excellence. Let your work speak, and the rewards will follow!



Other Requirements:

- Willing to work in US Business Hours (CST)

- Must have stable Internet and Power Connection

- Must have a Computer with at least 2 monitors set up, a stable Internet Connection



System Requirements:

To ensure optimal performance and functionality while using different web and application tools, please make sure that your syste
ets the following requirements:



Operating System:

- Windows: Windows 10 (64-bit) or higher

- macOS: macOS 11 (Big Sur) or higher



Processor:

- Intel: 8th Gen Core i3, i5, i7, or newer

- AMD: Ryzen 3 (2018) or newer



Memory (RAM):

- A minimum of 8 GB of RAM is required.

- Recommended: 16 GB RAM for multitasking and optimal performance



Job Type: Full-time





Application Question(s):

Have you created reports using data from MySQL, AWS, or CRM systems?

Have you maintained KPI reports for a marketing team daily, weekly, or monthly?

How many years of experience do you have as a Marketing Performance Analyst?



Work Location: Remote

title: Lead Backend Developer (Python, FastAPI, PostgreSQL, React)

crewsim (

You’ll be responsible for developing and maintaining the backend of our esim platform — including backend UI tools — and will have a key role in shaping the system’s architecture and performance.

title: Commercial-Level Video Editor & Colorist (Short-Form + Real Estate)
description:
I’m looking for a reliable and skilled video editor for long-term work. Someone who delivers consistently excellent results and communicates well.



IMPORTANT PLEASE READ:

Do not apply if you are a standard social media editor or primarily work on low-budget content.

This role is for editors experienced with multi-thousand-dollar productions, advanced LOG color grading, and commercial-level polish.



You will mainly edit 30–60 second vertical Reels for real estate and interior remodel showcases:

• 3–8 videos per week

• 5-day turnaround

• Smooth pacing, speed ramps, clean transitions

• Professional color grading (LOG, 4K 60fps footage)

• Strong sound design and clean text animation



We will also produce 1–6 horizontal commercial videos per month (3–20 minutes).



Preferred Software

• DaVinci Resolve (ideal for collaborative workflow)

• Premiere/Final Cut also acceptable if the quality is high



What matters most

• Exceptional quality every time

(color, audio, pacing, storytelling)

• Great communication

• Occasional WhatsApp check-ins if needed

• Reliable delivery and attention to detail



Workload

• Starts part-time (10–20 hrs/week)

• High potential to increase and even become full-time during busier periods as we grow together



Compensation

• $100 USD per completed Reel

• $300–$1200 USD per commercial project

• Rates will increase as workload and performance scale



How to Apply



Links to your best recent editing work (real estate preferred)



Editing software you use



Weekly availability



Short intro about yourself and your editing strengths



Screening Test

I’ll provide raw footage for a test edit to confirm quality.

It is unpaid; however, if you are hired, I will retroactively pay for the test project.



If you enjoy premium content, take pride in your work, and want a consistent long-term partnership, this will be a great fit. Rates will increase as workload and performance scale. There will be periods where this role temporarily becomes full-time as we grow.

title: NDIS Auditing and Compliance Officer
description:
Full-Time Virtual Assistant — NDIS Auditing & Compliance Officer (Remote)



38 Hours/Week | Monday–Friday | 9:00 am–5:00pm AEST (Brisbane Time)

Start ASAP | Long-Term Role | Remote -with daily team check-in and support

NDIS Registered Provider | Auditing, Compliance, Quality & Admin Support



We are an Australian NDIS Registered Provider seeking to hire a highly skilled and experienced NDIS Auditing and Compliance Officer (VA) to support our compliance systems and ensure our organisation remains audit-ready at all times.



This is NOT an entry-level VA role, and it is NOT a trainee position.

We will only consider applicants who already have proven, real experience working in the NDIS compliance and auditing sector, including knowledge of the NDIS Practice Standards and audit preparation requirements.



If you have previously worked with NDIS Registered Providers, supported audit preparation, managed compliance documentation, maintained i
 and complaints registers, and understand how audits work, we want to hear from you.



Position Overview



As our NDIS Compliance and Auditing Officer (VA), you will be responsible for:



Maintaining and updating compliance systems



Supporting internal audits and external audits (certification, surveillance)



Managing compliance registers and evidence folders



Ensuring policies and procedures are controlled and audit-ready



Supporting risk, i
, complaints, and continuous improvement processes



Providing office administration support tasks as required



Working confidently in Excel to track compliance, actions, and reporting



Key Responsibilities (NDIS Compliance + Audit Readiness)

NDIS Compliance Management



Maintain ongoing compliance aligned to the NDIS Practice Standards and Quality Indicators



Ensure documentation meets NDIS compliance expectations (quality, structure, accuracy)



Maintain compliance schedules, audit checklists, and evidence folders



Monitor compliance obligations and ensure deadlines are met



Track progress and report risks, gaps, and improvement opportunities



Audit Preparation and Audit Support



Support audit readiness and ensure the organisation is prepared at all times



Create, maintain, and organise audit evidence packs



Gather, structure and label evidence according to relevant NDIS standards



Assist during audits by preparing documentation and responding to evidence requests



Maintain internal audit processes and follow up corrective actions



Policies, Procedures & Document Control



Maintain and update policies and procedures with strong version control



Ensure review dates and approval workflows are followed



Maintain a structured quality management system (QMS-style documentation)



Apply proper naming conventions, formatting, and folder organisation



Ensure all documentation is consistent, professional, and audit-ready



I
, Complaints, Risk & Continuous Improvement (CQI)



Maintain and update registers including:



I
 register / reportable i



Complaints register



Feedback register



Risk register



Corrective actions register



Continuous improvement register



Training & compliance register



Ensure records are complete, accurate, and include follow-up evidence



Track trends and assist with compliance reporting



Workforce Compliance & Training Registers



Track staff compliance requirements (e.g. screening, training, onboarding evidence)



Follow up missing compliance items from staff



Maintain evidence folders for staff training and compliance documentation



Support onboarding compliance processes and documentation



 Office Administration Duties (Additional Duties)



This role includes office-based support tasks such as:



 follow-ups and basic inbox management



Scheduling meetings and compliance check-ins



Document formatting and creating templates



File management (Google Drive/SharePoint style systems)



Data entry and compliance tracker updates



Preparing weekly compliance summaries and reports



Supporting the leadership team with admin tasks as needed



Essential Skills & Experience (NON-NEGOTIABLE)



Only apply if you meet ALL requirements below:



 Proven experience in NDIS auditing and compliance (required)

 Strong knowledge of NDIS Practice Standards & Quality Indicators

 Experience supporting audit preparation (certification/surveillance / internal audits)

 Strong document control and compliance systems management skills

 Excellent written English and professional documentation writing ability

 Extremely high attention to detail and accuracy

 High-level Excel skills (registers, tracking, reports, formulas, filters)

 Ability to work independently and meet deadlines

 Ability to work full-time 9:00am–5:00pm AEST, Monday to Friday

 Must be available to start ASAP



Important: Applications without clear NDIS compliance/auditing experience will not be considered.



Excel Requirements



You must be confident using Excel for:



Compliance registers and trackers



Filtering, sorting, and formatting registers



Data validation and templates



Basic formulas (IF, COUNTIF, SUMIFS, VLOOKUP/XLOOKUP)



Weekly reporting and audit tracking dashboards



Work Requirements



Must have reliable internet and a professional work-from-home set-up and laptop



Must be comfortable handling confidential information



Must be available for AEST meetings and daily work hours



Must be able to follow Australian compliance expectations and professional standards



To Apply



Please include the following:



Your CV (show your NDIS compliance/audit work clearly)



A short cover letter answering:



Your experience in NDIS auditing and compliance



Which NDIS Practice Standards you have worked with



Whether you have supported audit preparation (and what type of audits)



Confirm you can work 9:00am–5:00pm AEST, Monday–Friday (38 hours/week)

(Optional but preferred) Provide an example of:



A compliance register you have maintained



An audit checklist/evidence pack you have built



A compliance report or internal audit summary



We are hiring ASAP — but only qualified and experienced candidates should apply.

title: Operations & Supplier Control Manager  (Manufacturing / Ecommerce – Process & Accountability Focus)
description:
Read this carefully before applying



This is not a customer service role.

This is not a sales role.

This is not a “follow instructions only” VA role.



This role exists because overseas factories lie, delay, avoid responsibility, and shift blame — and platforms like Alibaba do not protect buyers.



Your job is to make that behavior impossible through documentation, process, and pressure.



If you are uncomfortable pushing suppliers, documenting failures, or enforcing agreements, do not apply.



The core problem you will solve



We run a U.S.-based custom manufacturing business using overseas suppliers.



Problems we face daily:



Verbal promises with no accountability



Changing timelines



Missing specs or “misunderstandings”



Factories denying responsibility when things go wrong



Your role is to create clarity, records, and consequences so every order has:



Agreed specs



Agreed timelines



Written confirmations



Clear proof when suppliers fail



What you will actually do (this is the job)



This is operations ownership, not task execution.



Order & Supplier Control



Create and maintain a central order system (CRM / tracker)



Ensure every order has:



Final specs approved (sizes, PMS, materials, logos)



Written production timeline



Written shipping deadline



Agreed delivery expectations



Track production status and shipment progress



Follow up aggressively when suppliers stall or avoid answers



Maintain evidence (screenshots, confirmations, messages)



Process & System Building



Help design a simple but strict CRM / order tracker



Google Sheets / Airtable / Notion is acceptable



Each order must show status, risks, and responsibility



Create required checkpoints:



Spec approval



Pre-production confirmation



Production start



Ready-to-ship confirmation



Ensure nothing ships without documented approval



Client Communication



Prepare clear, honest updates when timelines slip



Prevent surprises by escalating early



Never sugarcoat or hide issues



Required experience (non-negotiable)



You must have experience with at least two of the following:



Supplier or vendor coordination



Manufacturing, sourcing, or logistics support



Ecommerce operations (Shopify, WooCommerce, Amazon, etc.)



Order processing with timelines and approvals



Working with overseas suppliers (Asia preferred)



If your background is mainly sales, lead generation, or call-center work, this role is not a fit.



Skills required



Strong written English (clear, firm, professional)



Comfortable pushing back on suppliers



Highly organized and process-driven



Able to think in systems, not just tasks



Calm and structured under pressure



REQUIRED APPLICATION TEST (DO NOT SKIP)



Applications without this will be ignored.



Scenario:



A factory agreed (in writing) to ship by December 10.

It is now December 13.

They say: “We are checking, please wait.”



Answer all three:



Write the exact message you would send to the supplier



Write the update you would send to the client



What documentation would you require before allowing shipment on future orders?



Compensation



Full-time monthly role



Pay based on ability to operate independently and build systems



Paid test task required before hiring



Final note



This role exists to restore control to the buyer.



If you prefer relaxed work, minimal conflict, or scripted tasks, this is not the job for you.

title: Product Upload & Pricing VA (WooCommerce)
description:
Responsibilities:

– Upload products using an Alibaba importer

title: Vice President, Product – Tokenization & Digital Asset Infrastructure
description:
About ViewTrade Technology 

At ViewTrade Technology (VTT), we are modernizing global brokerage and capital markets infrastructure. Our mission is to power cross-border investing through scalable trading, clearing, market data, and next-generation tokenization rails. 



We are building the future of digital asset–enabled brokerage infrastructure — integrating tokenized securities, distributed ledger connectivity, and institutional-grade custody frameworks into our global platform spanning the U.S., APAC, and GIFT City (India). 



The Opportunity 

We are seeking a Vice President of Product – Tokenization & Digital Asset Infrastructure to define and execute ViewTrade’s tokenization strategy across brokerage, post-trade, books & records, custody integrations, and regulatory frameworks. 



This senior leadership role reports directly to executive management and will shape VTT’s digital asset roadmap — including the evolution of our Viking books & records platform, DTCC sandbox participation, and integration with custodians and wallet providers. 



Role Overview 

>This leader will operate at the intersection of: 

>U.S. broker-dealer infrastructure 

>Global cross-border brokerage 

>Tokenized securities & stablecoin settlement 

>Institutional custody and regulatory compliance 

>Distributed ledger networks (public & permissioned) 



You will define how tokenized assets integrate into ViewTrade’s existing brokerage stack — ensuring operational resiliency, regulatory alignment, and institutional scalability. 



Key Responsibilities 

1. Product Strategy & Vision 

>Define and own ViewTrade’s tokenization and digital asset product strategy. 

>Establish the roadmap for tokenized U.S. equities, stablecoin settlement models, DLT-based post-trade workflows, and custody/wallet integration frameworks. 

>Identify high-impact use cases to improve cross-border distribution, capital efficiency, settlement speed, and regulatory transparency. 

>Develop investment cases, ROI models, and measurable success metrics. 



2. Viking Evolution & Platform Integration 

>Lead the transformation of Viking (ViewTrade’s books & records system) toward tokenization readiness. 

>Define ledger architecture, migration paths, reconciliation logic, and digital asset lifecycle processing. 

>Partner with Engineering to evolve Viking from end-of-day architecture toward real-time settlement capabilities. 



3. Institutional Digital Asset Architecture 

>Serve as the senior product authority on token standards, smart contract lifecycle models, custody orchestration, and stablecoin capital implications. 

>Evaluate public vs. permissioned chains, interoperability models, compliance structures, and custody segregation frameworks. 



4. Regulatory & Control Alignment 

>Collaborate with broker-dealer compliance, regulatory advisors, risk, and information security teams. 

>Ensure proper custody structures, reconciliation integrity, capital treatment analysis, and AML/KYC integration. 

>Embed control frameworks into product architecture from day one. 



5. Client & Ecosystem Engagement 

>Engage directly with institutional partners, fintech clients, and global brokers. 

>Represent ViewTrade in digital asset working groups, exchange and custody discussions, and pilot initiatives. 

>Monitor regulatory developments, tokenization initiatives, and competitive platforms. 



6. Execution Leadership 

>Lead the full product lifecycle: concept ? MVP ? pilot ? institutional scale. 

>Translate complex regulatory and market requirements into clear product specifications. 

>Drive cross-functional alignment across engineering, operations, clearing partners, and sales. 

>Communicate roadmap, risks, and milestones to executive leadership and board stakeholders. 



Required Qualifications 

>10+ years in fintech, brokerage infrastructure, or capital markets product leadership. 

>5+ years of blockchain, digital assets, or tokenization experience in regulated environments. 

>Strong knowledge of broker-dealer operations, post-trade processing, clearing models, and books & records systems. 

>Experience integrating with custodians, clearing firms, or settlement systems. 

>Proven ability to deliver regulated financial infrastructure platforms. 

>Executive presence with board-level communication skills. 

>Ability to translate technical concepts into business strategy. 



Preferred Qualifications 

>Experience in tokenization pilots or regulatory sandboxes. 

>Deep understanding of smart contracts, wallet architecture, stablecoin settlement, and custody models. 

>Familiarity with Rule 15c3-3, reconciliation frameworks, and capital considerations. 

>Experience building global or cross-border brokerage platforms. 

>Background in engineering, distributed systems, or capital markets technology. 



What Makes This Role Unique 

>At ViewTrade Technology, this is not a theoretical blockchain role. You will be building: 

>A tokenization-ready brokerage infrastructure 

>A real institutional product integrated with live clearing and custody partners 

>A global cross-border digital asset distribution platform 



This role directly shapes ViewTrade’s evolution from traditional brokerage infrastructure into next-generation tokenized market access.

title: Video and Photo Editor
description:
We’re a fast-growing media company looking for a high-level Video Editor + Photo Editor who can deliver clean, professional edits quickly—without losing excellence. We work with a variety of brands, so you must be able to adapt style and keep each client’s content feeling distinct.

THIS IS NOT AN ENTRY LEVEL JOB



What you’ll edit

 • Talking head content (must be strong here)

 • Short-form content for social (Reels/TikTok/Shorts)

 • Brand/content videos with b-roll integration

 • Client photo edits: portraits, branding, product photography

 • Bonus: Real estate reels (flashy/trendy)



Core Responsibilities



Video Editing

 • Cut and structure videos so the pacing makes sense and the story is clear

 • Add captions with proper spelling and accurate phrasing (understanding what’s being said matters)

 • Mix audio with clean EQ and levels (voice clarity is a must)

 • Color correct and grade with special attention to natural skin tones

 • Apply b-roll we provide and/or use stock footage tastefully to support the message

 • Maintain organized timelines, clean exports, and consistent delivery standards

 • Create variation in “look” so different clients don’t feel like they’re receiving the same edit style



Photo Editing

 • Clean, professional photo edits (not over-processed)

 • Confident in Photoshop: masking, cutouts, retouching, object removal when needed

 • Experienced editing product photography, portraits, and branding photography

 • Keep color and skin tones natural and consistent across sets



Required Skills

 • Strong editing instincts (pacing, story flow, cuts that feel intentional)

 • Detail-oriented captions (spelling and timing)

 • Audio EQ fundamentals for dialog

 • Color correction/grading fundamentals with accurate skin tones

 • Photoshop proficiency (required)

 • Comfortable using AI tools for editing in both photo and video (efficiency + quality)



Editing Software

 • Preferred: DaVinci Resolve

 • Also accepted: Adobe Premiere Pro or Final Cut Pro

 • Photo: Adobe Photoshop and Lightroom required



Speed + Standards



We move fast—this role requires someone who can turn projects around quickly without sacrificing quality. We care about excellence and consistency.



Great to Have (Bonus Skills)

 • Trendy/flashy real estate reels

 • Sky replacements for video

 • Speed ramps + motion blur

 • Clean color continuity across different rooms/scenes in a home



Look for us at elitemediatexas on instagram so you can see the work we do.

Familiarity with AI tools for workflow automation

Video editing skills

Experience with Shopify

Sales or SDR background



What Success Looks Like:



Funnels are built and converting within first 30 days

Automation sequences running smoothly with minimal oversight

Consistent pipeline of qualified leads from outbound efforts

Content distributed consistently without my involvement

More of my time freed up for revenue-generating activities

Measurable increase in conversion rates and passive sales

When revenue stabilizes at $7K+ monthly, your role expands to 30-40 hours/week



Work Details:



Starting: 20-25 hours per week (flexible, remote)

Growth Path: Scale to full-time (40 hrs/week) as business revenue grows

Must be comfortable working independently with weekly check-ins

Looking for long-term partnership, not a project-based contractor

Need someone who takes initiative and brings solutions, not just waits for instructions



To Apply, Submit ALL of the Following:



Brief Introduction - Explain your relevant experience with funnel building, marketing automation, and outbound outreach (focus on results you've achieved, not just tasks you've done)

Portfolio Examples - Provide links to at least 2-3 landing pages or funnels you've built. If work was for private clients and can't be shared publicly, describe the funnel structure, conversion rates, and your role in building it.

Platform Proficiency - List which marketing automation platforms you're proficient in (GoHighLevel, ActiveCampaign, Kajabi, ClickFunnels, etc.) and your skill level with each

Rate & Payment Structure - Your hourly rate or preferred payment arrangement for 20-25 hours/week (monthly retainer, hourly, etc.)

Availability - When you can start, your typical working hours/timezone, and confirm you're interested in growing with the role as it expands to full-time



Applications missing any of these 5 components will not be considered.



About Working With Me:

I'm direct, no-nonsense, and results-focused. If it doesn't make money, it doesn't make sense. I need someone who operates the same way - practical implementation over theory, revenue over busy work. I've got the vision and strategy; I need someone who can execute and optimize the systems that scale this business.



Growth Opportunity:

This isn't just a VA gig - it's a chance to grow alongside a fast-moving AI consulting business. As we build out systems that generate consistent revenue, your hours and responsibilities (and compensation) will increase. I'm looking for someone who wants to be part of the growth, not just punch a clock.

title: Ecommerce Order Fulfillment/Customer Service- Must Have Amazon MCF Experience
description:
US ecommerce business looking for someone to do the following tasks:

1) check multichannel fulfillment orders each day

2) submit orders to be fulfilled thru Amazon MCF or Walmart MCF based on where inventory resides

3) copy/paste tracking #s on the correct site

4) update on google sheet

5) answer customer service questions



. About 5 orders per day- 1 to 1.5 hours per day work time. Knowledge with google sheets, Amazon MCF order fulfillment, how to create an MCF order, place tracking #s in Etsy, Walmart, Amazon, Wayfair, Tik Tok needed.  Also experience answering customer
s and using google chat.

Please send your resume with your inquiry and title it: MCF Role



Thanks!

title: Amazon Influencer & Social Media Revenue VA
description:
OB DESCRIPTION



About the Role



We are looking for a revenue-focused Amazon Influencer & Social Media VA to manage 3 Amazon Influencer storefronts and related social media channels.



Your role is to turn filmed product videos into maximum exposure and income across Amazon and offsite platforms. You will handle everything except filming the products.



This is a long-term role with growth potential for the right person.



Key Responsibilities



Amazon Influencer Management

• Upload and optimize Amazon Influencer videos

• Create Amazon photo posts using frames from existing videos

• Track ASINs, carousel placements, and performance

• Follow Amazon compliance guidelines



Brand Outreach & Communication

• Send approximately 100 brand outreach messages per day across 3 storefronts

• Track brand responses, samples, follow-ups, and ongoing relationships

• Maintain organized tracking spreadsheets



Video Editing & Repurposing

• Light video editing using Descript

• Create short-form videos using Opus Clips

• Prepare content for Amazon, YouTube Shorts, TikTok, Instagram Reels, and
 Reels



Offsite Affiliate & Revenue Management

• Create and manage Amazon affiliate links

• Place links across social platforms correctly

• Optimize captions and pinned comments for clicks

• Track offsite link performance where possible



SEO & Evergreen Growth

• Write strong, evergreen SEO titles and descriptions

• Refresh older content with updated titles and thumbnails

• Increase clicks, followers, and subscribers over time



Opportunity Identification

• Identify high-performing products and content formats

• Suggest what products and videos to focus on next

• Provide weekly insights on revenue opportunities



Tools You Will Use

• Amazon Influencer Hub

• Amazon Affiliate links

• Descript

• Opus Clips

• Viral Vue (or willingness to learn)

• Google Sheets or Airtable

• Canva or CapCut (bonus)



Requirements

• Strong written English

• Organized and detail-oriented

• Comfortable managing systems and tracking data

• Experience with social media, affiliate marketing, or UGC content

• Reliable computer and internet connection



Who This Role Is For

• Revenue-focused

• Self-directed

• Comfortable with daily execution

• Interested in long-term growth



How to Apply



Please include the following in your application:



A short introduction about your experience



Tools you have used before



Your availability and internet speed



The word REVENUE somewhere in your application

description:

In this role, you’ll deliver exceptional service to clients through live messaging support, helping them resolve issues, answer questions, and navigate our platform. title: Chief Operating Officer (COO)
description:
Compensation

USD $5,000 – $6,000 per month, depending on experience

Work Setup: Remote

Reports To: CEO



How to Apply:

To apply, please complete this form:





We are seeking an experienced Chief Operating Officer (COO) to lead overall business operations, revenue performance, and organizational execution across client accounts and internal teams.



This role is responsible for driving operational strategy, scaling systems, improving profitability, and ensuring strong leadership across department heads. The COO will work closely with the CEO and leadership team to optimize performance, team structure, and operational efficiency.



Teams Overseen: Operations, Sales, Messaging, Support, and Department Managers



Key Responsibilities

Operations & Strategy

- Lead day-to-day company operations and ensure execution aligns with business goals

- Build scalable systems, workflows, and SOPs to improve efficiency and profitability

- Monitor key business metrics including revenue growth, operational efficiency, retention, and cost control

- Identify operational risks and implement solutions proactively

- Drive monthly and quarterly initiatives with clear KPIs and accountability



Leadership & Team Management

- Lead and mentor department heads, supervisors, and operational leaders

- Build strong accountability structures and performance management systems

- Oversee hiring strategy, leadership development, and organizational structure

- Improve cross-team collaboration and communication

- Maintain high team morale while enforcing performance standards



Performance, Quality & Reporting

- Establish dashboards and reporting systems for leadership visibility

- Ensure operational quality, compliance, and account security standards

- Oversee revenue optimization strategies and performance improvements

- Present weekly and monthly performance insights with actionable recommendations

- Support decision-making through data-driven analysis



Qualifications

Required Experience

- Minimum 4+ years of leadership experience in operations, business management, or scaling teams

- Proven experience managing managers or department leaders

- Background in digital businesses, online sales, creator platforms, or subscription-based environments is a strong advantage



Skills & Traits

- Strong strategic thinking with hands-on execution ability

- Excellent leadership, coaching, and decision-making skills

- Data-driven with strong business and revenue awareness

- Highly organized with the ability to manage multiple departments

- Clear communicator with strong accountability and ownership mindset

- Strong focus on compliance, risk management, and operational stability

title: Social Media Account Manager
description:
Start your application here: 



Compensation and Benefits

- Salary: USD $500–$700 per month (based on experience)

- Full-time position

- 2 days Paid Time Off (PTO) per month after successful completion of the 30-day trial period

- Monthly KPI-based performance bonuses

- Long-term role with career growth opportunities



Work Schedule

- Shift: 7:00 AM – 3:00 PM (Manila time)

- 8 hours per day

- 6 days per week



About the Role

- We are a digital marketing agency looking for a reliable and detail-oriented Social Media Manager to join our team.

- This role involves creating, managing, and growing multiple social media accounts across platforms such as Instagram, - TikTok, YouTube Shorts, and
/X (Threads). You will handle daily posting, follow platform best practices, track performance, and help accounts grow organically.

- This position is ideal for someone who is organized, comfortable managing multiple accounts, and able to maintain consistent daily output.

- Create and manage social media accounts across multiple platforms

- Plan and execute daily content posting schedules

- Develop platform-specific posting and growth strategies

- Monitor account performance and optimize content accordingly

- Maintain organized records of account credentials and metrics

- Ensure accounts follow natural and authentic growth patterns

- Apply best practices for account security and scaling

- Perform basic video editing using CapCut

- Personal computer dedicated for work use only (not shared during shifts)

- Ability to run time-tracking software (Gastime, DeskTime, or equivalent)

- Knowledge of proxy usage for account management

- Stable high-speed internet connection

- Backup internet connection for outages

- Basic troubleshooting skills

- Experience using social media management tools

- Basic proficiency in CapCut for video editing



Required Qualifications

- Strong English communication skills (high B to C level)

- Proven experience managing multiple social media accounts

- Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills

- Ability to work independently and meet deadlines

- Good technical skills with computers and mobile devices

- Reliable and punctual

- Experience using Apple devices (MacBooks and iPhones)



Preferred Qualifications

- Experience with social media growth strategies

- Knowledge of content curation and platform best practices

- Familiarity with social media analytics

- Ability to adapt to frequent platform updates and algorithm changes

- Experience managing multiple accounts simultaneously

- Career advancement opportunities within the agency

title: Creative Video Editor & Social Media Manager for Sailing Adventure Brand (YouTube, IG, FB)
description:
Ahoy! We are a sailing brand documenting our adventures on the open ocean. We are looking for a creative, proactive, and reliable Virtual Assistant to take ownership of our video editing and social media presence.



You will not just be "posting" content; you will be telling our story. We need someone who has a great eye for visual storytelling, understands the pacing of sailing/travel vlogs, and can take raw footage and turn it into engaging content for YouTube, Instagram (Reels), and
.



What You Will Do:



Video Editing (Priority): Edit weekly YouTube vlogs (10-15 mins) using raw sailing footage. You must know how to tell a story, use music effectively, and cut out the boring parts!



Short-Form Content: Repurpose YouTube content into engaging Reels, Shorts, and TikToks.



Social Media Management: Schedule posts, write captions that fit our "voice" (adventurous, fun, informative), and reply to comments/DMs, build and maintain website(s).



Thumbnail Design: Create high-CTR thumbnails for YouTube.



General Admin: Assist with organizing footage, researching travel destinations, or contacting sponsors.



Requirements:



Experience: Proven experience editing vlogs or travel content (Portfolio required).



Software: Proficient in Adobe Premiere Pro, DaVinci Resolve, or Final Cut Pro (plus Canva/Photoshop for graphics).



Internet: Reliable high-speed internet (minimum 20Mbps) – you will be downloading large 4K video files.



English: Excellent written English for captions and communication.



Attributes: You are organized, you don’t need to be micromanaged, and you have a "figure it out" attitude.



Brownie Points (Not required but great to have):



Experience with sailing or ocean-related content.
