title: Full Stack Developer
description:
Role

Full-stack developer to build a financial data platform.  The main feature will be an AI-powered financial chatbot. Users will be able to ask questions like, “What are Amazon’s cloud revenues for each of the last 5 years?” and the answer will show a chart and text. In addition to the chatbot, developer will build dashboards and pages showing how markets are trading through charts, tables, heatmaps, screeners, watchlists, etc. Work spans the full stack: backend (data pipelines, caching, database optimization), AI (LLM flows, RAG, prompt tuning), and frontend (js charting libraries and responsive UI). An early version of the watchlist, which will be one component of the final product, is live at 
.



Chatbot Feature - What you’ll work on



Build data pipelines: ingest financial data from APIs ? parse and transform into structured formats ? store in PostgreSQL. Data includes structured data (financials, prices, earnings, analyst ratings) and unstructured documents (SEC filings, earnings call transcripts, investor presentations, etc.).

Build LLM pipelines: documents ? Embeddings (OpenAI) ? vector retrieval via pgvector (RAG) ? prompt construction ? answer generation ? validation (catch wrong numbers, dates, hallucinations).

Prompt engineering: tune prompts to improve accuracy, reduce hallucinations, and handle edge cases.

Charts: build visualizations for chat responses using Highcharts or similar.

Scale coverage: extend to thousands of US stocks.



Why charts matter

A major differentiator is how we present data visually within the chatbot. We’ll post charts on X and other platforms to grow our audience. If you’ve made data look beautiful with JS charting libraries, that’s a big plus.



Collaboration

Developer will work directly with the founder, who handles product direction and domain expertise (finance background, 10+ years investing/trading), while dev handles the technical execution.



Current tech stack

Frontend: React, Next.js (App Router), TypeScript, Tailwind CSS

Backend: Next.js Server Actions, API Routes 

Database: Supabase (PostgreSQL + pgvector for embeddings)

AI/LLM: OpenAI API (incl. embeddings), prompt engineering, RAG patterns

Charts: Highcharts, TradingView Lightweight Charts, HTML5 Canvas

Data APIs: Financial Market API (FMP, 
, etc.), SEC EDGAR



Required

Experience with React and TypeScript

Experience with Next.js

Experience with PostgreSQL

Understanding of REST APIs and data fetching patterns

Experience with OpenAI API or similar LLM integrations

Familiarity with vector databases and RAG patterns

Knowledge of real-time data patterns (WebSockets, polling)

Clean code practices and attention to detail

Great English and communication skills



Nice to have

Experience with financial data or fintech applications

Experience with JS charting libraries (Highcharts, Chart.js, D3, Recharts, TradingView Lightweight Charts, etc.)

title: Front End Web Flow Developer
description:
Front-End Webflow Developer — Confidential Fintech Build

Contract Role | High-Security, Compartmentalized Architecture



About the Project



A private client is developing a high-security fintech interface for a proprietary multi-tier risk-architecture system known internally as The Black Sheep Protocol.

The system contains three structural tiers (Constitution-1, Constitution-2, and Constitution-3), which must be represented visually in the UI.



You are responsible only for the front-end.

All backend logic, algorithms, and mechanics remain completely isolated and are handled by a different team.



This role requires strict compliance with confidentiality, modular construction, and compartmentalized design.



Role Responsibilities



The Webflow Front-End Developer will:



Build all public-facing Webflow pages

Build a gated client dashboard

Implement visual indicators for the three Protocol tiers:



Constitution-1



Constitution-2



Constitution-3



Implement a margin-awareness UI display

Create clean, modular UI components for backend developers to integrate

Ensure zero exposure of proprietary calculations or mechanics

Use Webflow as the primary platform with optional lightweight custom code embeds



This position is purely front-end.

You will never be given backend formulas or internal logic.



What You Will Build



1. Public Website (Webflow)



Polished, luxury-grade landing pages

High-end hero sections with subtle animations

Non-technical, high-level content explaining that the system operates across three tiers

Enrollment and informational pages

Pricing overview (enrollment, access, performance tiers)

Fully responsive, mobile-friendly layout



Secure CMS structure



2. Client Dashboard (Front-End Only)



A login-gated dashboard presenting:

UI-only indicators for Constitution-1, Constitution-2, and Constitution-3

Structure status states

Efficiency-tier selectors or displays

High-level pathway visuals (non-mechanical)

Lifecycle and progression timelines



Front-end buttons for backend-triggered actions:



Activate



Pause



Update / Transition



Modular components ready for backend integration



The dashboard shows visual states — not calculations.



3. Margin-Awareness UI Module



The UI must clearly display:



Available margin



Margin utilization



Status indicators:



Healthy



Approaching Threshold



Extended



Projected impact visuals (non-numeric, non-mechanical)



The client does not make decisions.

This is purely informational to prevent operational interruption.



4. Automation UI Shell (Front-End Only)



Create the front-end interface that triggers backend processes:



Activation



Pausing



Updating



Backend logic is isolated and handled separately.



Modular Architecture (Mandatory)



All components must be:



Modular

Replaceable

Exportable

Segmented

Detached from backend logic

Built for secure integration



Designed to prevent reverse engineering



You will see only what is necessary for UI work.

This protects trade secrets and ensures long-term scalability.



Tech Stack



Webflow (primary)

HTML / CSS / JS for custom embeds

Lottie animations

Memberstack / Outseta / Webflow Memberships

Figma (layout collaboration, if needed)



Security Requirements (Mandatory)



NDA + Non-Compete must be signed before receiving details

No public posting of work, screenshots, or concepts

No reuse of design patterns or architecture

No GitHub or public repos



All deliverables must use secure transfer channels

Zero disclosure of Protocol structure or internal logic



Confidentiality is absolute.



Ideal Candidate



Expert-level Webflow skills

Strong UI/UX instincts

Experience with dashboards or financial interfaces

Able to work without backend visibility

Understands modular, compartmentalized development

Reliable, communicative, and deadline-accurate



Deliverables



Full Webflow front-end

Public-facing website

Gated client dashboard

Three-tier UI structure (Constitution-1 / 2 / 3)

Margin-awareness module

Modular component architecture

Front-end trigger controls

Secure handoff-ready system



How to Apply (Fixed Price Only — No Hourly Billing)



Please provide:



1. Your total project price

A single fixed cost for completing the entire front-end.



2. Your per-page breakdown

List how many Webflow pages you expect to build (public + dashboard + UI modules).



3. Timeline

How long the project will take.



4. Webflow portfolio

Links to past Webflow work.



5. NDA confirmation

You must confirm willingness to sign a strict NDA + Non-Compete.



6. Modular-development confirmation

comprehensive list of average worker wages

https://onlinejobs.ph/salaryguide

You must confirm you can build isolated components without backend access.

title: Front End Web Flow Developer
description:
Front-End Webflow Developer (High-Security Fintech Build)



Contract Position — Confidential Project



About the Project



A private client is building a premium, high-performance fintech interface for a proprietary trading architecture known as The Black Sheep Protocol. The system uses complex internal logic, multi-tier structural efficiencies, and automated trade-pathway orchestration. The front end must be elegant, fast, modular, and secure — without ever exposing proprietary mechanics.



This role focuses entirely on Webflow, with embedded custom code modules (HTML/CSS/JS) only where necessary.



All work requires signing an NDA + Non-Compete.



What You’ll Build



1. Marketing + Public Experience



Luxury-grade landing pages with polished hero sections



Efficiency tier explanations:



90th Percentile Efficiency



100% Structural Efficiency



Visual breakdowns of asymmetric outcome architecture (high-level only)



Clear messaging focused on transparency and client-friendly benefits



Enrollment, access-fee, and performance-fee sections



Onboarding materials and guided flow



Full mobile optimization and responsive layouts



Secure Webflow CMS structure for easy updates



2. Client Dashboard (Front-End Only)



A gated Webflow dashboard (using Webflow Memberships, Memberstack, or Outseta) that displays:



Active structures (front-end visuals only)



Status indicators for execution cycles



Visual indicators for structural efficiency “health”



Timeline and lifecycle graphics



High-level summaries of client-facing performance states



Intuitive, institutional-grade UI components



3. Margin Awareness Module (Front-End Requirement)



Clients do not need trading discipline or technical understanding, but the interface must show their margin status so they are always aware of their operational capacity.



The front-end must display:



Available margin



Margin allocated to active structures



Simple health indicators (“Healthy,” “Approaching Limit,” “Extended”)



Projected margin impact for upcoming cycles (visual only)



This ensures:



Transparency so clients always understand if their account can support the next automated structure



Continuity of the system (automation can only run with adequate margin)



Clear, user-friendly signals without revealing proprietary mechanics



Zero client decision-making or discipline required — they merely observe the status so the process never stalls



This is strictly a display-layer feature; no backend logic is exposed.



4. Automation UI (Front-End Shell Only)



Buttons and UI elements that trigger backend automation (handled by other developers):



Activate Structure



Pause



Transition / Update



These are front-end only triggers.

Backend logic is completely separated.



5. Modular Architecture



All components must be built modularly, so that:



Backend integrations can occur without exposing proprietary internals



No developer ever sees the full logic of the system



Code can be replaced, removed, or updated independently



Security and trade-secret protection remain airtight



Tech + Tools



Webflow (primary platform)



HTML/CSS/JS for embedded custom modules



Lottie animations for micro-interactions



Memberstack / Outseta / Webflow Memberships for gating



Figma for layout collaboration if needed



Secure, exportable asset workflow



Security Requirements (Non-Negotiable)



Must sign NDA + Non-Compete before receiving details



Zero reuse of client concepts or interface logic



No subcontracting or external code sharing



No GitHub repositories or public examples



All deliverables provided privately



Strict adherence to compartmentalized development



Ideal Candidate



Expert-level Webflow experience



Proven track record building secure, high-end dashboards



Strong UX/UI instincts



Comfortable building sophisticated interfaces without backend visibility



Understands modular development and trade-secret security



Professional communication and deadline consistency



Deliverables



Fully built Webflow front-end system



Marketing pages + gated dashboard



Responsive design across all device classes



Margin-awareness module



Clean UI animations



Exportable modular front-end components



Integration-ready architecture



How to Apply



Please send:



Webflow portfolio links



Hourly or fixed-cost estimate



Confirmation you can sign NDA + Non-Compete



Confirmation you can deliver modular, isolated front-end structures

title: Creative Systems & Operations Virtual Assistant (Founder Support, Long-Term)
description:
Job Overview



I’m a founder and creative director working across multiple projects in marketing, content, influencer campaigns, and AI-enabled workflows. I’m looking for a highly organized, systems-minded Virtual Assistant to support me long-term.



This role is best suited for someone who does not think in one-off tasks, but instead looks for patterns, efficiencies, and better ways to work. You’ll help turn repetitive work into clear systems and improve how projects are executed over time.



This is not a basic admin role. It’s a growth-oriented position for someone who enjoys structure, problem-solving, and ownership.



Key Responsibilities

Systems & Operations (Primary Focus)



Identify repetitive tasks and help turn them into efficient systems



Build and maintain Google Sheets (trackers, dashboards, workflows)



Create templates, checklists, and simple SOPs



Organize Google Drive folders and file structures



Improve project organization and execution processes



AI & Workflow Support



Use ChatGPT and other AI tools to support daily work



Follow and refine prompt frameworks



Help document workflows so they are reusable and scalable



Creative & Content Support



Assist with content organization and scheduling



Support basic to intermediate video editing tasks



Perform basic image editing (thumbnails, simple layouts)



Organize captions, scripts, creative briefs, and assets



Executive Assistance



Take ownership of assigned tasks and follow through independently



Help manage multiple projects without losing context



Communicate clearly and flag issues early when needed



Required Skills & Qualifications

Systems Thinking



Naturally notices patterns and inefficiencies



Thinks in processes, not single tasks



Proactive about suggesting improvements



Enjoys building structure and documentation



Technical Skills



Experience using ChatGPT or other AI tools



Strong proficiency in Google Workspace (especially Sheets)



Basic to intermediate video editing skills



Basic image editing skills



Strong digital organization habits



Work Style



Excellent time management and prioritization



Able to handle multiple projects at once



Reliable, detail-oriented, and self-directed



Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment



Communication



Strong written and spoken English



Clear, concise communication



Comfortable working directly with a founder



Values & Culture Fit



I’m a Christian and value working with people who share similar principles around integrity, responsibility, and respect. You don’t need to be perfect — just aligned and comfortable working in that environment.



Hours: Flexible, long-term



Availability: Consistent and responsive



This role has potential for increased responsibility over time.



Application Instructions (Important)



Please read carefully. Applications that do not follow these steps may not be considered.



Step 1 — Attention to Detail



Start your application with the keyword:



STEWARD



Step 2 — Written Application



Include:

Relevant experience (systems, ops, marketing, content, AI, etc.)



Tools you regularly use



Your desired hourly rate

“Describe a repetitive task you noticed in a previous role and how you improved or systemized it.”



Step 3 — Video Introduction (Optional but Preferred)



Please include a 1–2 minute video where you:



Introduce yourself



Explain why you’re a good fit for a systems-focused role



Share a bit about your experience



This does not need to be professionally edited — clarity and communication matter most.

title: Business Development Manager
description:
We’re hiring a results-driven Business Development Manager (BDM) to support multiple businesses in Australia by creating growth strategies, generating business leads, and following up until opportunities convert into sales/contracts/students.



This is not a “research-only” role. You must take action daily—building prospect lists, making calls, sending outreach, booking meetings, and managing follow-ups consistently.



You will work across:



Grocery Store (Retail) – increase margins + growth through research and execution



Global FM (Facilities Management) – create B2B opportunities, calls, lead generation



Training College (First Aid) – increase student enrollments and corporate bookings



Cleaning Company (Sydney + Melbourne) – generate leads and close contracts



Other businesses as required



Key Responsibilities (What You’ll Do Daily)

1) Lead Generation + Outreach (Core Responsibility)



Build targeted lead lists for Sydney & Melbourne (decision-makers,
s, phone numbers).



Execute outreach through cold calling,
, LinkedIn messages, and follow-up campaigns.



Book appointments for business owners and keep a structured pipeline with next actions.



Maintain a follow-up cadence (same day + 48 hours + 7 days + 14 days) until closed.



2) Sales Pipeline & CRM Management



Set up and manage a CRM tracker (HubSpot/Trello/Sheets/Monday—whichever we use).



Track every lead: source, status, notes, next step, date contacted, outcome.



Provide weekly pipeline reports (leads created, calls made, meetings booked, conversions).



3) Australia Market Research ? Strategy ? Execution



Research competitors, pricing, customer expectations, and service gaps in Australia.



Propose and implement growth actions each week (not just suggestions).



Build outreach scripts,
 templates, pitch decks/one-pagers, and basic proposals.



Business-Specific Responsibilities

A) Grocery Store – Margin & Growth Strategy (Retail)



Goal: Increase margins and sales through research + execution.



Research competitor pricing/promotions in the local area (weekly).



Identify high-margin product opportunities, bundles, seasonal demand, and supplier alternatives.



Recommend and implement actions: price adjustments, promo calendar, bundle offers, upsell items.



Identify B2B opportunities (cafes, restaurants, small caterers) for bulk supply deals.



Track margin improvement ideas and results (before/after reporting).



Expected actions: product research, promotion planning, supplier comparisons, bulk customer targeting, weekly action plan + outcomes.



B) Global FM – Facilities Management (Sydney)



Goal: Generate recurring B2B contracts and service opportunities.



Build lead lists targeting: strata managers, property managers, building owners, warehouses, commercial sites, retail chains.



Contact prospects and pitch services (maintenance coordination, facilities support, security/cleaning integration where relevant).



Find and monitor tender opportunities and send proposals/EOIs where suitable.



Maintain a pipeline and ensure the owner has meetings booked each week.



Expected actions: cold calls +
 outreach, strata/property manager targeting, tender monitoring, meeting bookings, proposal support.



C) Training College – First Aid Student Growth (Sydney)



Goal: Increase student enrolments + corporate group bookings.



Create partnerships with businesses that require first aid certifications:

construction, childcare, aged care, hospitality, security companies, gyms, schools, community groups.



Generate and close corporate group bookings (e.g., “10–50 staff training”).



Build a simple strategy for lead sources: Google Business, local directories, LinkedIn, partnerships, referral programs.



Follow up leads until enrolled and confirm attendance.



Expected actions: partner outreach, corporate booking outreach, student lead follow-ups, directory listing improvements suggestions, enrollment tracking.



D) Cleaning Company – Leads + Contracts (Sydney & Melbourne)



Goal: Generate leads and convert them into signed contracts.



Identify and target customers: offices, warehouses, medical clinics, gyms, childcare, strata/commercial buildings.



Build lead lists and execute outreach campaigns.



Prepare quotes/proposal templates and coordinate site inspections (owner attends; you manage scheduling).



Drive opportunities to closure by follow-up and negotiation support.



Expected actions: pipeline creation, outreach, appointment scheduling, quote follow-up, contract finalisation support.



Required Skills & Experience



3+ years experience as a BDM / Sales / Lead Generation / Appointment Setter (B2B preferred).



Strong English communication (phone + written).



Proven ability to generate leads and manage follow-ups with discipline.



Comfortable calling Australia-based businesses (confidence matters).



Strong organisational skills + reporting (Sheets/Excel/CRM).



Ability to create strategies AND execute them.



Nice to Have (Bonus)



Experience selling to strata/property managers or commercial services in Australia.



Familiarity with LinkedIn Sales Navigator, HubSpot, Apollo, or similar tools.



Experience in education lead generation (RTO/short courses) or service-based contracts.



KPIs (How You’ll Be Measured)



Leads generated per week (quality matters)



Calls/emails/messages sent per day



Meetings booked per week



Proposal/quote follow-ups completed



Conversions: contracts signed / student enrolments / corporate bookings



Weekly reporting accuracy + pipeline cleanliness



Tools You’ll Use



Google Sheets/Excel,
, Phone/VoIP



LinkedIn outreach



CRM (HubSpot/Trello/Monday/Sheets)



Basic proposal templates and pitch scripts (we provide core info; you improve and implement)



How to Apply (Important)



Please reply with:



Your CV/Resume



A short summary of your BDM experience (B2B preferred)



Your internet speed + headset availability



Your availability to overlap with Sydney time



Write a sample cold
 for:



(a) Cleaning contract to a property manager



(b) First aid corporate booking to an HR manager



Answer: “How will you generate 30 qualified leads in Sydney in 7 days?” (step-by-step)

title: Virtual Administrator (Immediate Action Taker) – Multi-Business Operations & Growth Tracking
description:
We are hiring a highly proactive Virtual Administrator who takes immediate action on tasks assigned and supports multiple businesses. You will be the go-to person directly supporting the business owners, ensuring tasks are completed fast, documents are filed correctly, and follow-ups are done until closure.



You will work across:



Training College (Documentation & Compliance)



Grocery Store (Supplier & Operational Documents)



Security Services (Contracts & Client Documents)



Cleaning Contracts Business (Service Agreements & Compliance)



Key Responsibilities

1) Immediate Action & Task Ownership



Take action as soon as tasks are assigned—no delays, no reminders needed.



Break tasks into steps, set priorities, and provide progress updates.



Close tasks end-to-end and escalate urgent matters quickly.



2) Tracking & Business Growth Support



Maintain a master tracker (Excel/Google Sheets) for all businesses: tasks, owners, due dates, status, notes.



Provide daily/weekly updates to business owners on progress and next steps.



Track growth-related actions like client follow-ups, contract renewals, document submissions, and deadlines.



3) Templates, Dashboards & Registers



Create and maintain templates for repeatable tasks (checklists, registers, trackers, logs).



Build basic dashboards/reports to summarise performance (e.g., outstanding documents, contract status, reconciliation progress).



Ensure templates are accurately completed using data from
s, photos, invoices, and receipts.



4) Training College Documentation & Compliance



Monitor and follow up on completion of training college documents: student files, trainer files, policies, registers, evidence packs.



Maintain clean filing and version control.



Track deadlines and ensure all documentation is audit-ready.



5) Grocery Store Admin Follow-Up



Follow up supplier invoices, delivery paperwork, stock-related documents, and operational records.



Organise documents and maintain a document log.



6) Security & Cleaning Contracts Support



Track contracts, variations, renewals, insurance certificates, compliance docs, inductions, and service schedules.



Follow up clients/contractors for missing documents and confirmations.



Maintain a contract register with key dates and deliverables.



7) Communication & Follow-Ups



Draft professional
s/messages for business owners.



Liaise with suppliers, clients, contractors, trainers, and internal staff.



Follow up persistently until tasks are completed and confirmed.



Requirements



Strong English communication (written + verbal)



Very strong Excel / Google Sheets skills (formulas, trackers, pivot tables preferred)



Experience creating templates, registers, and dashboards



Highly organised with strong attention to detail



Confident with follow-ups and managing multiple stakeholders



Reliable internet + computer



Preferred (Bonus)



Experience supporting accounting/admin tasks (reconciliation support, invoice tracking)



Experience with compliance documentation (training/education, contracts, audits)



Familiarity with tools like Trello, 
, ClickUp, or Microsoft 365



How to Apply (Important)



Please reply with:



Your resume/CV



A short summary of your Excel skills (macros if any, dashboards you’ve built)



Answer this question:



“If I assign you 10 tasks at once with deadlines, how will you organise and execute them?”

title: Senior Full Stack Developer
description:
We’re Acore Technology, a business technology and ERP solutions firm helping product-oriented companies scale smoothly, reduce operational friction, and unlock growth without unnecessary complexity.



Our work spans:

- Custom ERP systems/integrations

- Workflow automation

- Cloud-native solutions

- Data modeling and real-time reporting

- Bespoke applications that replace spreadsheets and manual toil



We deliver real operational value — not templates or boilerplate, but systems built exactly the way a business needs them.



We’re building a small, highly capable technology team. We care about intelligence, judgment, and results — not titles or busywork. We provide modern AI development tooling (including Claude Code, Codex, and similar tools) and expect AI-assisted development to be core to how we design, build, and ship software. We use AI as leverage — not a shortcut.



About the Role

We’re looking for a Senior Full Stack Developer who can think systemically, take initiative, and run projects end-to-end with minimal oversight. You’ll contribute directly to client engagements and internal tooling, shaping how software supports real-world operations.



This isn’t about “writing tickets.” It’s about solving hard problems, architecting systems responsibly, and owning outcomes.



What You’ll Do

- Architect and build end-to-end web applications that extend or replace ERP and operational workflows

- Integrate ERPs, e-commerce platforms, inventory systems, and external data sources into cohesive processes

- Build reliable backends and clean, responsive UIs

- Design secure, scalable APIs and data models

- Automate manual workflows that create operational friction

- Use AI development tools (Claude Code, Codex, or similar) daily to accelerate development while applying strong engineering judgment

- Translate business requirements into thoughtful technical solutions

- Operate autonomously — leading workstreams, not just executing tasks



What We’re Looking For

You are a senior engineer who:

- Has strong backend and frontend fundamentals

- Uses AI-assisted development tools effectively in real workflows

- Can take real user issues and create features/fixes

- Has experience building system integrations (APIs, webhooks, data sync)

- Communicates clearly with both technical and non-technical stakeholders

- Works independently and makes sound decisions without constant direction

- We care more about depth of reasoning and judgment than years of experience.



Who Thrives Here

You’ll succeed if you:

- Enjoy owning complex problems end-to-end

- Prefer autonomy over micromanagement

- Want your work to materially improve how businesses operate

- See AI as a multiplier for strong engineers

- Value well-crafted systems over quick hacks



Hiring Process

- Application review

- Technical assessment (real-world problem solving)

- Discussion of your approach and reasoning

- Final team interview

- We’re interested in how you think and build — not trivia.



Compensation & Growth

- Competitive salary and performance-linked growth

- High ownership and influence over architecture

- A team where contribution defines opportunity



If you want to build meaningful systems with a smart, AI-native team, we’d love to talk.

title: German-Speaking Virtual Assistant (Customer Support + Web QA)

?

You will play an important role in making sure everything that goes live in German is accurate, natural, and customer-friendly.



?



Key Responsibilities



German Customer Support

 • Answer customer
s and messages in German using SOPs and templates

 • Handle common inquiries related to orders, shipping, returns, and refunds

 • Maintain a professional, helpful, and brand-consistent tone

Pre-Launch Website and Ad Review

General Virtual Assistant Tasks

?



Requirements

 • Strong attention to detail and ability to follow structured processes

 • Comfortable using Google Docs, Sheets,
 platforms, and task tools

?



Working Hours

?



Compensation and Benefits

 • Competitive monthly salary based on experience and German proficiency

 • Long-term role with stable workload

 • Clear SOPs and training provided

 • Performance-based salary reviews



?



How To Apply

To be considered, please include:

 1. A short introduction about yourself

 2. Your experience with customer support or virtual assistance

 3. Your German language level (native, fluent, C1, B2, etc.)

 4. A short German-written reply to the following customer message:

“Hello, I placed an order last week but have not received any update. Can you please help?”



Applications without the German sample will not be considered. Please do not apply if you dont have any german language proficiency.

title: Google Shopping & Product Feed Specialist (Full-Time)
description:

As a trusted Australian supplier of capital equipment with a strong e-commerce presence, our team works closely across Australia and internationally on product data, pricing, feeds, advertising performance, and conversion optimisation.

This role is hands-on and performance-focused, suited to someone who deeply understands Google Merchant Center, Shopping feeds, and how industrial / B2B products behave in paid search.



Responsibilities

Manage and optimise Google Shopping campaigns (Standard & Performance Max)

Build, maintain, and optimise Google Merchant Center product feeds



- Improve product titles, descriptions, attributes, and taxonomy for high-intent searches

- Troubleshoot feed disapprovals, policy issues, and diagnostics

- Coordinate with our marketing and operations teams on pricing, availability, and promotions

- Monitor performance metrics (ROAS, CPC, impression share, conversions) and make data-driven improvements

- Stay up to date with Google Shopping best practices and platform changes



Requirements

- Proven experience managing Google Shopping campaigns at scale

- Strong understanding of Google Merchant Center, feed rules, and diagnostics

- Experience with product feed tools (e.g. DataFeedWatch, Feedonomics, or similar)



Ability to optimise B2B / industrial product listings (high-ticket, long sales cycle)

Strong analytical skills and attention to detail

Ability to work independently and deliver consistent, measurable results



The Benefits

- Work with an established Australian company

- Monday–Friday, 6:00am – 3:00pm Philippines business hours (no shift work)

- Competitive salary ?40,000 – ?65,000 PHP per month, based on experience

- 13th-month pay and additional performance bonuses

- Paid vacation and holidays

- - Strong growth potential, including pay rises and bonus opportunities

- Great work–life balance with flexible working conditions

- Job security with a business established for over 20 years



Please Note

This is a full-time (38 hours per week) position

This role must be your only employment

If you wish to continue working for other clients, please do not apply



Application Questions

Please share examples of how you’ve demonstrated reliability in previous roles.

Why do you believe you are well-suited to managing Google Shopping and product feeds for an industrial / B2B business?

title: Detail-Obsessed QA engineer for World Class Shopify Builds
description:
BTF — Premium Ecommerce CRO & Design Agency



This is not a standard QA role.



You are not here to check if everything works.

You are not here to say “looks fine.”

You are here to make sure everything that ships is world-class.



QA at BTF is standards control. Our standards are the business.



If something goes live and it isn’t at the level we expect, QA failed.

Not dev. Not design. QA.



If you approve a build, you are personally vouching that it meets our standard.

If it doesn’t feel like something a top-tier brand would ship, it does not go live.



You are the final gate before launch.



About Us



We’re a high-end ecommerce CRO and design agency building and optimizing Shopify stores for serious brands.

We focus on premium execution; tight design, strong copy, clean dev, and obsessive attention to detail.



We’re not trying to be average.

We’re trying to ship some of the cleanest ecommerce experiences in the space.



This role exists to protect that.



You’ll be involved in shipping high-standard builds and iterations for growing ecommerce brands; and you’ll have real authority over what goes live.



Core Mandate



Your job is to find imperfections.



Not obvious ones.

Small ones.

Microscopic ones.



The kind most people would ignore.



You are expected to notice:



1px spacing inconsistencies



alignment that feels slightly off



hover states that aren’t fully polished



animation timing that feels cheap



responsiveness issues at edge breakpoints



cross-browser rendering differences



small UX friction points



These are not nitpicks here.

This is the job.



If a detail feels almost ridiculous to flag, that’s usually exactly the level of attention we expect.



If you cannot find issues, you are not looking hard enough.



“All good” is not an acceptable QA outcome.



What You’ll Be Doing



You’ll be QA’ing:



Shopify storefronts



landing pages and PDPs



new features and site iterations



CRO tests and experiments



design/dev handoffs before launch



You will:



compare builds against Figma



check responsiveness across devices



test interactions and states



identify visual inconsistencies



catch regressions when new features are added



document issues clearly with screenshots or Looms



hold builds until everything is resolved



Often we are adding new features to existing live stores.

That means your job isn’t just checking what’s new; it’s ensuring nothing else broke in the process.



If something regresses anywhere on the site, you catch it.



How You Work



You naturally:



zoom in on everything



resize constantly



test edge cases



check across browsers



question polish



assume something is wrong until proven otherwise



You’re comfortable being the person who says:

“Not ready yet.”



You don’t approve builds lightly.

You take ownership seriously.



Who This Role Is For



Someone who:



is extremely detail-oriented



has high taste for design and polish



notices tiny inconsistencies instantly



enjoys spotting what others miss



takes pride in precision



wants to be part of shipping top-tier work



You don’t need to come from a big agency.

But you do need a sharp eye and high standards.



Experience with Shopify or ecommerce QA is a plus; but obsessive attention to detail matters more.



Who This Is Not For



This will not work if you:



rush checks



only look for obvious bugs



are comfortable shipping “mostly fine”



don’t care about micro-details



want a passive checklist role



This is an ownership role.



Authority



QA has final sign-off before launch.



If you flag issues and they aren’t resolved, the build does not ship.

You are trusted to protect the standard.



To Apply



Send:



A short intro



Any relevant QA or review experience



A Loom where you QA any e-commerce site and list every issue you can find



We’re looking for someone who naturally sees what others miss and wants to be part of shipping very high-quality work.



If that’s you, apply.

title: Full-Time CRO Ecommerce Copywriter
description:
Remote | Full-Time | Long-term role



We’re hiring a full-time ecommerce copywriter to join our team.



This is not an
 marketing role.

This is conversion-focused website copy for high-end ecommerce brands.



We care about clarity, judgment, and thinking, not hype or fluff.



How this role works



This role starts with a paid trial.



If you pass the trial:



we’ll do a short interview



then move you into a full-time role



We don’t hire based on CVs alone.

We hire based on how you think and how you work inside a system.



What you’ll be doing (day to day)



Writing ecommerce product page (PDP) copy



Working section-by-section (hero, benefits, proof, reviews, risk reversal, etc.)



Using AI (Gemini) as a brainstorming tool, not a replacement



Generating multiple ideas, selecting the best ones, and refining them



Iterating based on feedback and improving drafts quickly



Working inside a clear, structured copy system with high standards



You are not expected to invent everything from scratch.

You are expected to exercise judgment.



What we actually care about



We care more about:



clarity over clever wording



judgment over volume



recognising weak copy over writing flashy lines



customer understanding over marketing buzzwords



If you rely on:



generic marketing language



feature dumping



templates without thinking



“sounds good” copy



This role is not for you.



Who this role is for



This is a good fit if you:



have written ecommerce website copy before



understand the difference between PDP copy and
 copy



can explain why a line works (or doesn’t)



are comfortable iterating and killing your own ideas



like working with structure, feedback, and high standards



Experience level:



Junior to mid-level copywriters welcome



You do not need to be elite



You do need to be thoughtful, coachable, and detail-oriented



The trial



If shortlisted, you’ll receive:



a clear copy system



customer research



section-by-section tutorials and prompts



guidance on how to use AI properly



You’ll be asked to:



write copy for specific PDP sections



select and refine ideas



show your thinking, not just output



The trial tests:



how you think



how you select



how you iterate



Not how fast you type.



Pay & structure



Full-time role



Trial: paid



Monthly pay to be discussed



Long-term position with room to grow



How to apply



Please include:



A short paragraph about your ecommerce copy experience



One example of ecommerce website copy you’re proud of (link or doc)



A brief answer to this question:



What makes good ecommerce website copy different from
 copy?



Applications without this answer will be ignored.



Final note



This is not a “write words all day” job.



It’s a thinking role inside a strong system.



If you like structure, clear standards, and getting better at your craft, you’ll enjoy this role.

title: Virtual Litigation Paralegal
description:
Job Title: Remote Litigation Paralegal 



Company: Wright Gray Personal Injury Law Firm



**********Location: Remote/ Virtual - In Office Position in Manila***********



About Wright Gray:



Wright Gray Personal Injury Law Firm specializes in fighting for the rights of victims who have sustained physical or emotional damages due to the negligence of others. We are seeking to bolster our dedicated team with the appointment of a seasoned Litigation Paralegal. 



Job Description:



We are on the lookout for a highly professional, detail-oriented, virtual Litigation Paralegal. The successful candidate will have a proven track record of providing litigation support to attorneys, handling discovery, drafting documents, maintaining client communication, scheduling and coordinating hearings and medical appointments as well as managing medical record requests. 



Responsibilities:



1. Answer discovery promptly and accurately.

2. Draft discovery, demands, and other legal documents.

3. Communication with clients to update on case progress.

4. Conduct case file investigations.

5. Schedule hearings and medical appointments.

6. Proactively manage requests for medical records.

7. Perform all tasks in strict compliance with professional and legal standards for confidentiality and ethics.



Qualifications:



1. Must possess at least a vocational diploma, Bachelor’s degree in Law, or certification in Paralegal studies.

2. Minimum of 4 years of United States litigation experience required.

3. Excellent organizational skills with high-level attention to detail.

4. Strong written and verbal communication skills.

5. Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines.

6. Proficiency in using legal research software and legal communication platforms.

7. Availability to work remotely with occasional travel to our office in Manila, if needed.



Required Documentation:

2. Identification verifying age (must be 18 or older).

3. Proof of relevant education/certification.

4. Proof of four years of job experience.

5. Several professional references within the legal community.



Wright Gray Personal Injury Law Firm is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.



To apply for this position, please submit your resume, cover letter, a video record of what you are the right person, and list of references to 
 encourage all who meet the qualifications to apply.



Application Deadline: September 30, 2023. 



Please note that only candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job Title: Law Firm Accountant

DG Legal Services, an established and highly respected law firm, is seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Law Firm Accountant to join our team. - Ensure confidentiality and security of sensitive financial information.





Qualifications:

- A minimum of 5 years of experience in accounting, preferably within a law firm or legal setting.



- Strong understanding of financial principles, including general ledger accounting, financial statements, and reconciliation.



- Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, including Word, Excel, and Outlook; experience with legal billing software is a plus.



- Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.



- Strong interpersonal and communication skills; ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.



- Attention to detail and ability to prioritize and manage multiple deadlines.





What We Offer:





- Competitive salary commensurate with experience with discretionary bonuses. 



- A friendly and supportive work environment that fosters professional growth and development.





If you are a motivated and experienced accountant with a strong understanding of financial management within a legal setting, we encourage you to apply for this role. Please submit your resume, cover letter, and any relevant documentation showcasing your qualifications and experience to 
 look forward to reviewing your application.



In addition to your resume and cover letter please provide a Video or a Vocaroo recording telling us why you would be a good fit for the position at DG legal services.



DG Legal Services is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or any other legally protected status.

title: SEO Content & Social Media VA – WordPress, AI Content & Scheduling
description:
We are looking for an experienced SEO Content & Social Media VA to join our legal services team. You will be responsible for preparing and publishing approved web content, generating social media content using AI tools, and scheduling posts across platforms.



This role suits someone who is highly organised, process-driven, and comfortable working within a professional legal environment where tone, accuracy, and compliance matter.



Content Publishing – WordPress (SEO):

- Receive QA-approved content and prepare it for publication on WordPress

- Add internal links based on site structure and topic relevance

- Source and add appropriate images to content (AI-generated or stock)

- Add schema markup using Rank MathFAQ, Article, LocalBusiness etc.)

- Perform pre-publish technical SEO checks (meta title, meta description, canonical, headings)

- Brief and coordinate with the developer for final publishing



Social Media Content Creation & Scheduling:

- Use AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude, or similar) with provided prompts to generate social media content

- Generate social media images using AI image tools (Canva AI, ChatGPT image generation, or similar)

- Ensure all content maintains a professional and compliant tone appropriate for a legal services brand

- Schedule content across platforms using our existing scheduling tools

- Monitor post performance and report on basic engagement metrics



What We're Looking For:

- Proven experience with WordPress content management and on-page SEO

- Comfortable using AI tools for content and image generation (training on our prompts provided)

- Experience with social media scheduling tools

- Strong attention to detail and ability to follow processes and brand guidelines

- Prior experience in professional services, legal, or finance industries is highly regarded

- Self-starter who can manage tasks independently with minimal supervision

- Good written English and ability to spot errors or tone inconsistencies



This is a process-driven execution role. Strategy, content briefs, and QA are handled in-house. We need someone reliable who follows systems, communicates clearly, and takes ownership of their tasks.



If this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you.

title: Medical Records Retrieval Specialist/Data Entry
description:

DO NOT apply to this job if you can not follow all of the application instructions.

title: Technical SEO & Performance Audit
description:
Overview



We’re looking for a detail-oriented SEO Virtual Assistant to perform a Technical SEO and Website Performance Audit for a small business website.

This is a test project, and if the work is completed successfully, it could turn into ongoing part-time SEO and website management work.



???? Task Description



Your main goal is to identify all existing technical and performance issues on our WordPress website before we begin any redesign or content expansion.



You’ll need to:



Run a complete website audit using one or more of the following tools:

SiteChecker, Ahrefs Webmaster Tools, or Google Lighthouse.



Record all problems such as:



Missing or duplicate meta titles / descriptions



Oversized images or slow-loading assets



Missing alt tags on images



Broken links or redirect errors



Mobile usability issues



Any other technical SEO or structure problems



Summarize everything neatly in a Google Sheet or Excel file with clear notes and recommendations.



???? Deliverables



A spreadsheet (Google Sheet or Excel) listing each issue, the page URL, the type of problem, and your suggested fix or next action.



Screenshot proof of the audit report(s) generated from your chosen tools (SiteChecker, Ahrefs, or Lighthouse).



A brief summary paragraph (3-5 sentences) describing the overall health of the website and key priorities to fix first.



???? Payment Milestone



Payment will be released once the full report and summary sheet are delivered, reviewed, and approved.



???? Time & Workload



Estimated Time: 3–5 hours total



Deadline: 3 days after assignment



This could lead to ongoing part-time work (5–10 hours per week) for the right candidate, assisting with SEO updates, page optimization, and blog publishing.



? Ideal Skills



Experience with WordPress websites



Familiarity with technical SEO audits and tools like SiteChecker, Ahrefs, or Lighthouse



Basic understanding of page speed optimization and on-page SEO



Ability to organize findings clearly in Google Sheets or Excel



Good written English and attention to detail



???? To Apply



Please include the following when applying:



A short note about your SEO experience and tools you’ve used.



One example of a technical SEO audit report or spreadsheet you’ve created.



Your hourly rate or fixed price for this project.

title: Copywriter / Content Creator - AI and Crypto (X-First)
description:
We’re looking for an AI & Crypto Copywriter/Content creator who can turn raw research, market noise, and half-formed ideas into clear, high-signal content.



This is not a “write threads all day and chase likes” role. This is about building credibility, network, and inbound opportunities through smart content.



If you live on 
, understand narratives before they trend, and can write without sounding like a bot or a shill, keep reading.



You should also have strong AI capabilities. That means you can use AI tools to speed up research, extract key takeaways, and iterate quickly, while keeping the final output sharp, human, and on-brand. You know when to lean on AI and when to ignore it.



What you’ll be doing:

- Turn daily crypto research into concise, engaging X posts and threads

- Find angles, hooks, and second-order insights (not just summarizing news)

- Write content that attracts founders, builders, and serious operators

- Help shape and maintain a consistent voice across posts

- Collaborate closely with the partnerships and research side

- Occasionally adapt content into summaries, notes, or outbound-friendly snippets



What we’re looking for:

- Deep familiarity with crypto narratives (DeFi, infra, AI, markets, cycles)

- Highly skilled content writer: Crypto, AI and more.

- Strong intuition for what works on X (hooks, pacing, formatting)

- Ability to write fast without sacrificing quality

- Comfortable working from rough notes, voice memos, or bullet points

- Self-directed and organized (we run lean systems, not bureaucracy)



Core requirements (non-negotiable):

- Minimum 4 years experience in crypto and content creation / copywriting

- Proof of experience required (published work, accounts, threads, or portfolios)

- Crypto-native: Actively follows markets, narratives, and CT culture

- Proven X experience: Prior copywriting or content creation on X

- Strong AI proficiency: Comfortable using AI tools daily for research, drafting, and iteration

- Ability to write fast without sacrificing quality

- Can work from rough notes, bullets, or voice memos

- High-signal, low-hype writing style

- Prior work that clearly drove engagement or inbound interest



If you don’t understand crypto deeply and can’t use AI effectively, this role won’t be a fit.



Nice to have (not required):

- Experience writing for creators, founders, or crypto brands

- Understanding of partnerships and/or BD content

- Ability to flex between crypto, AI, and business themes



Where this role can expand:

This role is X-first, but not X-only forever. Over time, content may expand into:

-
 (community-facing summaries and insights)

- Potentially YouTube (faceless channel scripting)



What this role is not

- Not a 
 page

- Not corporate marketing copy

- Not low-effort AI rewrites

- Not a role that needs constant hand-holding



How to apply

Send:

- 2–5 examples proofs of crypto content you’ve written (X posts or threads)

- A short summary of your relevant experience in similar roles

- A brief note on why you’re a strong fit for this role

- (Optional) One original X post you’d write today based on current market conditions



We care far more about thinking, taste, initiative, and dedication than titles or unrelated experience.

Proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro, After Effects, Final Cut Pro, or CapCut Desktop.



Understanding of paid social creative strategy and data-driven iteration.



Ability to match tone, pacing, and messaging to brand and audience.



Highly organized with the ability to manage multiple projects at once.



Bonus: Experience with sound design, color grading, or motion graphics.



KPIs



Volume of high-quality ad edits produced weekly.



CTR, thumb-stop ratio, and ROAS performance of edited videos.



Iteration speed and creative testing turnaround.



Why Join Us

title: Klaviyo Email Marketing Manager - Ecommerce
description:
We are looking for an experienced Klaviyo
 Marketing Manager to own our
 and SMS channel strategy from end to end.



If you’re data-driven, creative, and passionate about lifecycle marketing, this role is for you.



Role Overview



The Klaviyo
 Marketing Manager will be responsible for growing and optimizing our
 and SMS revenue through effective campaign strategy, design, automation, and continuous performance testing. You’ll manage everything from creative design to segmentation, flows, deliverability, and conversion tracking—ensuring every message maximizes revenue while strengthening customer relationships.



Key Responsibilities



 & SMS Strategy: Develop and execute data-driven lifecycle strategies across campaigns, flows, and automations to drive revenue growth, retention, and engagement.



Campaign Management: Plan, design, and deploy weekly/monthly campaigns, product launches, and seasonal promotions.



Flow Creation & Optimization: Build and continuously improve automated flows (welcome series, abandon cart, browse abandonment, post-purchase, win-back, etc.).



Design & Copy Execution: Collaborate with the creative team or independently design on-brand, mobile-optimized
s using Klaviyo’s builder or custom HTML when needed.



Segmentation & Personalization: Utilize behavioral and demographic data to target segments effectively and improve open, click, and conversion rates.



Pop-Up & Signup Form Optimization: Create and A/B test pop-ups, landing forms, and opt-in incentives to grow high-quality subscribers.



Performance Analysis: Track key KPIs (open rate, CTR, CVR, revenue per send, list growth, deliverability) and report actionable insights weekly.



Deliverability & List Health: Maintain high sender reputation by managing list hygiene, re-engagement campaigns, and compliance (GDPR/CAN-SPAM).



Revenue Growth: Continuously identify opportunities to increase average order value (AOV), customer lifetime value (LTV), and overall
/SMS contribution to total revenue.



Qualifications



2+ years of experience managing Klaviyo for a DTC e-commerce brand (agency or brand-side).



Strong understanding of
 marketing best practices, segmentation, and automation.



Proficiency in design tools (Klaviyo Editor, Canva, Figma, or Photoshop).



Experience with A/B testing, analytics, and conversion optimization.



Strong copywriting or copy-editing skills a plus.



Basic understanding of Shopify or other e-commerce platforms.



Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills.



Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, results-driven environment.



KPIs



 revenue contribution (% of total store revenue)



List growth rate & engagement rate



Conversion rate from key flows



Campaign performance (open, click, conversion)



Deliverability and unsubscribe rate



Why Join Us



Work directly with a results-driven team passionate about growth and creativity.



Full ownership of one of our most profitable marketing channels.



Flexible schedule and growth potential within our expanding e-commerce portfolio.

title: Proactive Virtual Assistant
description:
Full-Time Virtual Assistant (Long-Term) – Organized, Reliable, and Proactive



Are you a self-starter who loves staying organized, being helpful, and solving problems before they even appear? I’m looking for a friendly, detail-loving Virtual Assistant to become my right hand across both my businesses and personal life.



This is a full-time, long-term role with plenty of variety. You’ll support everything from scheduling to content creation to general online tasks that keep things running smoothly.



What You’ll Help With



General Admin & Personal Support

 • Keep my calendar organized and appointments updated

 • Manage
s, reminders, and small daily tasks

 • Coordinate travel, place online orders, and assist with errands



Business Support

 • Assist with maintaining and updating information inside online systems

 • Double-check details for accuracy and consistency

 • Help with research, basic data entry, and organizing digital information

 • Support simple backend tasks using clear SOPs



Content & Community Tasks

 • Create basic social media graphics using Canva

 • Post in
 groups and help engage in online communities

 • Assist with light content organization



Availability & Communication Matter



I juggle a lot, so I need someone I can rely on. That means:

 • Being available and responsive throughout the day, including weekends

 • Staying connected via WhatsApp and project tools

 • Comfortable with flexible hours — some days lighter, others busier



Who You Are

 Excellent English — both spoken and written (C2 level preferred)

 • At least 1 year of experience as a VA, EA, or similar role

 • Organized, dependable, and proactive

 • Tech-savvy: Google Workspace, Canva, ClickUp/Notion

 • Positive, solution-oriented, and easy to work with

 • Someone who enjoys helping and takes initiative naturally





Compensation

 • Hourly with performance based bonus. Monthly guarantee to follow. 

 • Stable, long-term position with room to grow. 



?



Work Expectations

 • Around 40 hours/week

 • Must have US availability 

 • Weekend availability required

 • Daily communication 





To Apply





1. Short Video Introduction (1–2 minutes)

Speak naturally (no reading) and cover:

 • Who you are

 • Your past experience as a VA or assistant

 • A brief explanation of why you’re a great fit

(C2-level English preferred.)



2. Written Paragraph

In 5–7 sentences, explain the difference between being “busy” and being “productive.”

(This helps assess your written clarity and English level.)



3. Business Lookup Task

Choose ONE of the following businesses and look it up online:

 • Archway Hypnosis

 • The Good Business Witch

 • Ship Shape Houston Home Solutions



Then, in your own words, write 2–3 sentences explaining what the business does.

(I’m looking for comprehension, accuracy, and clean English.)



4. Links to any relevant work

Optional but helpful (Canva samples, admin work, organization tools, etc.).



5. Your weekly availability (including weekends)

And include your current internet speed.



6. Use this subject line exactly:

DETAILS – Assistant Application

title: Customer Experience Manager
description:
Department:  Customer Experience

Reports To:  Chief Operating Officer (COO)

Location:  Remote – Philippines (HKT business hours, 9AM–5PM)

Type:  Full-Time Contractor

Compensation:  $1,500–$3,000 USD/month (commensurate with experience)



About SAN Sound

SAN Sound is a Hong Kong-based audio technology company specializing in premium gaming audio products. With nearly two decades of expertise and an expanding global footprint across Asia and beyond, we’re scaling from product-market fit into aggressive growth. Our products—including the Hardwire gaming earbuds and SANWEAR-GT wireless earbuds—are built for gamers who demand exceptional audio quality and comfort. We’re a lean, fast-moving team that punches well above its weight.

The Role

We’re looking for a Customer Experience Manager to take full, end-to-end ownership of customer support at SAN Sound. This is not a ticket-answering role—this is a department-building role. You will be the first dedicated hire in this function and will be responsible for architecting, executing, and scaling our entire customer experience operation from the ground up.

In the early days, you’ll be hands-on—handling all inbound customer inquiries, building AI-powered response systems, creating templates, and establishing the processes and data infrastructure that will allow us to scale. As the business grows, you’ll hire and manage a team beneath you. You’ll work closely with our AI system developers and communications team (copywriting and product tech) to build intelligent, seamless support across
, website, and potentially voice channels.

The right person for this role has built a CS department before, thinks strategically about customer experience as a competitive advantage, and is energized by the challenge of building infrastructure that can handle 10x growth.

Key Responsibilities

Department Strategy & Build-Out

• Own the full customer experience function from day one—strategy, execution, and continuous improvement

• Design and implement the CS department architecture working with our developers: workflows, escalation paths, SLAs, and KPIs

• Develop a scalable support model leveraging AI-first principles with human oversight

• Propose and get approval for builds, tooling, and team expansion from the COO

• Create a roadmap to move from one-person operation to a fully staffed, scalable department

AI-Powered Support Operations

• Collaborate with AI system developers to architect and optimize automated
 responses, website AI chat support, and future AI voice/call support

• Work with the communications team (copywriting and product tech) to ensure AI responses reflect brand voice, product accuracy, and customer empathy

• Build, maintain, and continuously refine response templates and AI training data

• Monitor AI performance and identify gaps where human intervention improves outcomes

Hands-On Customer Support

• Handle all customer inquiries across channels during the initial build phase

• Monitor and respond to customer issues via Zendesk,
, and Shopify

• Ensure timely, high-quality resolutions that reflect SAN Sound’s premium brand standards

• Manage returns, exchanges, warranty claims, and order-related issues

Data, Reporting & Continuous Improvement

• Build and maintain a data tracking and reporting framework for CS operations

• Record, analyze, and report on customer inquiries, resolution times, satisfaction scores, and recurring issues

• Use data insights to drive improvements in AI responses, templates, processes, and product feedback loops

• Provide regular performance reports and strategic recommendations to the COO

Social Media Comment Support

• Monitor and respond to customer queries, comments, and feedback across SAN Sound’s social media channels

• Ensure timely, on-brand responses to product questions, support issues, and general engagement on platforms such as Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, and

• Triage and escalate complex issues from social media to the appropriate internal teams or support channels

• Collaborate with the Social Media Manager to maintain a consistent, helpful brand voice in public-facing interactions

Community Management (Secondary)

• Monitor SAN Sound’s 
 community for customer issues, product feedback, and engagement opportunities

• Provide a consistent, helpful brand presence in community channels

• Escalate community-surfaced issues to the appropriate internal teams

• Note: This responsibility is secondary to core CS operations and assumes AI is handling the heavy lifting on support volume

Requirements

• 4+ years of experience managing customer service end-to-end, with demonstrated experience building out a CS department or function from scratch

• Strong understanding of ecommerce customer experience for DTC brands; gaming or audio industry experience is a significant plus

• Proficiency with Zendesk (required), Shopify, and modern CS tooling

• Comfort working with AI tools and a forward-thinking mindset on AI’s role in customer support—you don’t need to build AI systems, but you need to drive buildouts alongside developers

• Fluent in English (written and verbal)—communication clarity is essential even when leveraging AI

• Experience with ClickUp, Google Workspace (GSuite), and 

• Highly organized, self-motivated, and capable of working autonomously in a remote, distributed team environment

• Strong analytical skills—comfortable building reporting frameworks and using data to drive decisions

• Excellent judgment on when to escalate, when to act independently, and when to propose new initiatives

Nice to Have

• Experience in gaming, esports, or audio/consumer electronics industries

• Experience with AI chatbot implementation or conversational AI platforms

• Background in community management or building brand communities

• Familiarity with international ecommerce operations and cross-border customer support

Why SAN Sound?

• Build from scratch: You’ll own and shape an entire department—not inherit someone else’s system

• AI-forward culture: We embrace AI as a force multiplier, not a threat—you’ll be at the forefront of how support is evolving

• Growth trajectory: We’re scaling aggressively across Asian markets with strong funding and ambitious targets

• Premium brand: Work with products that people genuinely love in a passionate gaming community

• Lean team, real impact: Your work directly shapes the customer experience and the company’s growth

How to Apply

Send your resume along with a cover letter on your experience building CS operations and how you’d approach building an AI-powered support department from scratch. We value clear thinking over long cover letters. Loom videos are a big bonus and will be prioritized.

title: Senior Accountant - Real Estate
description:
About Us

Tristone Partners Inc. is a Toronto-based real estate development and construction firm specializing in purpose-built rental multi-residential projects. Our operations span the full lifecycle of real estate development—from land acquisition and financing through construction and long-term ownership/ management. We work with an external accounting firm for corporate filings and tax returns, while maintaining in-house control of day-to-day accounting, HST, and project-level reporting.



Role Overview

We’re seeking an experienced Senior Accountant to lead the setup and ongoing management of our QuickBooks Online system across multiple entities. The ideal candidate will establish proper accounting structures, manage daily bookkeeping, and ensure accurate financial reporting for each project. This role also includes responsibility for ongoing HST filings, budget vs. actual tracking, and coordination with cost consultants and lenders for draw submissions, cost reviews, and project expense monitoring.



Key Responsibilities

Set up and manage QuickBooks Online for multiple related companies (DevCo, BuildCo, and ProjectCos)

Create and maintain a consistent chart of accounts, class structure, and project-based cost tracking

Record and reconcile bank, credit card, and loan transactions on a regular basis

Track inter-company loans, reimbursements, and equity contributions

Prepare and file HST returns for all active entities and projects

Coordinate with cost consultants and lenders for expense tracking, draw submissions, and budget monitoring

Support partners in maintaining accurate cash flow forecasts and upcoming funding needs

Generate monthly financial summaries (P&L, balance sheet, cash flow, project cost reports)

Maintain vendor and subcontractor records, and manage invoice/payment schedules

Collaborate with the external accounting firm for year-end reviews and filings



Qualifications

Diploma or degree in Accounting

5+ years’ experience in bookkeeping or accounting (real estate or construction preferred)

Proven experience setting up and managing QuickBooks Online for multi-entity businesses

Strong understanding of inter-company accounting and project cost tracking

Proficiency in Excel and reconciliation reporting

Exceptional attention to detail, organization, and follow-through



Preferred Skills

Experience with construction draw reporting and holdback accounting

Familiarity with cost consultant coordination and lender reporting

Knowledge of HST and CRA compliance

Ability to collaborate effectively with partners, consultants, and external accountants

title: Accountant
description:
About Us:

Tristone Partners Inc. is a dynamic real estate development and construction firm specializing in property research, acquisitions, zoning development, architectural design, construction, and financing. We manage multiple entities, bank accounts, and financial operations, requiring meticulous accounting and financial oversight.



Role Overview:

We are seeking an Accountant to manage financial reporting, cash flow, accounts payable/receivable, banking operations, compliance, and general accounting functions. The ideal candidate will have experience in real estate development or construction finance, be proficient in QuickBooks, and thrive in a remote work environment. Strong communication skills, self-motivation, and the ability to work independently are key to success in this role.



Key Responsibilities:



Financial Reporting & Compliance

Banking & Cash Flow Management

Manage cash flow across all entities and provide regular financial forecasts.



Accounts Payable & Receivable



Handle accounts payable for Tristone Partners Inc. and ensure timely vendor payments.



Process utility payments for multiple properties and resolve any discrepancies.



Track and collect tenant payments and utility reimbursements.



Corporate & Administrative Support



Maintain company records and minutes book for compliance and governance.



Coordinate with external auditors, accountants, and tax consultants.



Support in financial planning and forecasting as required.



Act as a back-up to the Project Coordinator, as required.



Qualifications & Experience:



Accounting designation (or working towards it) is preferred.



3–5 years of experience in accounting, preferably in real estate development or construction.



Proficiency in QuickBooks and Microsoft Excel.



Strong understanding of financial reporting, compliance, and tax regulations.



Experience managing multi-entity financial structures and bank reconciliations.



Excellent communication and interpersonal skills



Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines.



What We Offer:



Competitive salary



Opportunity to work in a growing real estate development firm



Exposure to complex financial structures and investment reporting



A collaborative and dynamic work environment

title: Operations Coordinator
description:
Remote Operations Coordinator (E-Commerce / Data & Process Support)

Work From Home | Full-Time | Long-Term Role

Timezone: Toronto, Canada (EST overlap required)



We are a fast-growing E-commerce operations company in Canada managing multiple online stores across Amazon, Walmart, BestBuy, and other marketplaces. We’re looking for a Remote Operations Coordinator who’s detail-oriented, analytical, and highly organized — someone who loves solving problems, working with data, and helping improve workflows.





Main Responsibilities

• Support daily operational tasks — updating trackers, reports, and SharePoint/Asana boards.

• Perform data entry and verification for shipments, returns (RMA), and reimbursement reports.

• Help prepare performance dashboards and summary sheets in Excel/Google Sheets.

• Maintain process documentation and assist in SOP updates.

• Identify inconsistencies or data issues and communicate them clearly.

• Collaborate with remote tea
mbers across departments (Listing, Logistics, Finance).





Qualifications

• Minimum 2 years experience in operations, admin, or data-related role.

• Advanced Excel/Google Sheets skills (formulas, pivots, data cleaning).

• Strong analytical and problem-solving ability.

• Excellent English communication (written & spoken).

• Highly organized, with great attention to detail and accuracy.

• Experience with Power BI, Power Automate, or SharePoint is a plus.

What We Offer
