title: Warranty & RMA Support Specialist
description:
Warranty & RMA Support Specialist (Remote, Philippines) — Toronto HQ

Title: Warranty & RMA Support Specialist (Remote, Philippines)

Reports to: Operations Manager (Toronto)

Schedule: Full-time, Toronto hours (EST)  (Mon–Fri)

Engagement: Contractor / Remote (based in the Philippines)



We are hiring a detail-obsessed Warranty & RMA Support Specialist to manage customer warranty submissions and RMAs for laptops/gaming devices. You’ll own intake, documentation, coordination with manufacturers, and weekly status updates—working Toronto hours from the Philippines.

You’ll: verify eligibility, issue RMA #s, guide packing/shipping, submit claims to manufacturers, track cases to closure, and maintain SLAs.



You are: an excellent English communicator, process-driven, great with spreadsheets/ticketing tools, and comfortable working the EST time zone.



Apply: Send your CV + 2–3 paragraph cover note + answers to the screening questions below with subject “Warranty & RMA – PH Remote – ”.



We are a Toronto-based technology company handling returns and warranty coordination across major marketplaces and brands. We value clarity, speed, and customer fairness—balanced with clean processes and data discipline.



What you’ll do (key responsibilities)

• RMA Intake & Eligibility: Review customer forms, proof of purchase, serial/IMEI, photos/video; confirm manufacturer warranty window and our service terms.

• RMA # & Instructions: Issue RMA numbers, send packing/shipping guidance, ensure the RMA # is on the carton, and collect tracking details.

• Submission Service: Prepare and submit manufacturer warranty claims (service only), attach diagnostics, photos, and required documentation.

• Case Management: Maintain a live tracker (RMA #, Manufacturer Case ID, SLA timestamps), and send weekly status updates to customers.

• Logistics Coordination: Hand off to/coordinate with Toronto logistics for inbound receipts and outbound returns (FOB BSC warehouse).

• SLA Compliance: Hit response, triage, and submission SLAs; escalate blockers early.

• Customer Communications: Use approved templates; set correct expectations 

• Documentation & QA: Keep clean notes, audit trails, and improve templates/SOPs as edge cases arise.



You’ll thrive if you have

• Excellent written English (C1+) and professional tone; confident on calls/chat/email.

• Process mindset: follow SOPs, spot gaps, suggest improvements.

• Tools: Comfort with ticketing (e.g., Zendesk/Freshdesk), spreadsheets (Excel/Google Sheets), SharePoint/Asana, and basic PDF tools.

• Tech literacy: Familiarity with laptops/consoles (common issues, basic troubleshooting terminology).

• Detail discipline: Zero-defect data entry; consistent file naming and case logs.

• Time-zone reliability: Able to work ET daytime reliably from the Philippines.



Nice to have

• Experience with manufacturer warranty processes, RMA workflows, or consumer electronics.

• Light QA/diagnostic background or service desk experience.

• Experience with e-commerce channels (Amazon/Walmart/BestBuy) is a plus.



Equipment & connectivity (required)

• Laptop/desktop (i5/Ryzen 5+, 8–16 GB RAM), dual monitors preferred.

• Stable internet 25 Mbps+ with a backup option; headset for calls.

• Backup power or plan for outages is a plus.



What we offer

• Clear SOPs, templates, and supportive management in Toronto.

• Training on our tools and scripts.

• A culture that values accuracy, transparency, and respectful customer care.



How to apply

Apply on Onlinejobs.ph with the following:

1. Resume (PDF)

2. A brief cover note (2–3 paragraphs) on your relevant experience

3. Your working hours in PH time that align with 9:00–6:00 EST

4. Answers to Screening Questions (below)



Screening Questions

1. In 5–7 sentences, explain how you would explain the warranty process to a customer.

2. A customer’s device shows damage and the tamper seal is broken. Draft a 5–7 sentence
 setting expectations about eligibility and next steps.

3. List the SLA checkpoints you would track from intake to closure.

4. Share a screenshot or description of a tracker you’ve maintained (columns/fields you would use for RMA).

5. Describe how you’d ensure the RMA # appears correctly on shipments and in internal logs.

title: Amazon Seller Central Specialist
description:
Do you love working in a fast pace environment, where you constantly make meaningful contributions daily?



We are a dynamic and growing e-commerce business looking for a talented Amazon Virtual Assistant (VA) to join our team. We are dedicated to providing exceptional customer experiences on the Amazon platform. We value innovation, efficiency, and teamwork, and we're committed to helping our tea
mbers thrive and grow in their roles.



DETAILED ROLE OVERVIEW



As an Amazon Virtual Assistant specializing in FBA (Fulfillment by Amazon) Inventory Management, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the smooth operation of our Amazon store. Your responsibilities will include:



Inventory Management & Reconciliation

- Inbound Shipping Management: Coordinate and oversee the inbound shipping process, ensuring that inventory arrives at Amazon fulfillment centers in a timely and cost-effective manner.

- Inventory Reconciliation: Regularly reconcile Amazon FBA inventory to detect and resolve discrepancies. Keep a close eye on inventory levels to prevent stockouts and overstock situations.

- Stranded and Reserved Inventory Resolution: Identify and resolve issues related to stranded and reserved inventory status, ensuring that products are available for sale and not held up by Amazon restrictions.

- Removal Orders: Create removal orders when necessary, managing the process of returning or disposing of unsellable inventory.

- Inventory Reimbursement Claims: File and track inventory reimbursement claims with Amazon to recover funds for lost or damaged inventory.

- Case Management: Monitor and manage cases and inquiries with Amazon Seller Support, responding promptly and professionally to resolve any issues or escalations.



Account Health & Performance Management

Continuously assess and optimize the overall health of our Amazon store, including performance metrics, account health, and compliance with Amazon's policies and guidelines.

- Substantial knowledge of and expertise with dealing with and resolving all types of performance notifications and policy compliance issues

- Documenting and keeping track of all account health issues and performance notifications

- Looping in and coordinating with other departments where their action is required to resolve or optimize sales and performance on Amazon

- Keep track of removed listings and warnings and ensure timely action is executed to prevent unnecessary loss of inventory

- Ensure and maintain all established KPIs are maintained including 0% Order defect rate on all orders, “Good” Account Health Rating, 0% on Shipping Performance metrics,

- Proficiency in creating, submitting, and following up on cases with Amazon to dispute inaccurate feedbacks and or other performance notifications



Amazon Listing Creation & Optimization

- Skilled in creating, managing, and perfecting product listings on Amazon, including planning, and creating paid search campaigns

- Conduct competitor analysis and come up with strategies to drive e-commerce sales on Amazon

- Validating Accuracy of all products listings and images with SKU/ ASIN of the product

- Optimizing listings on Amazon as necessary to boost visibility and sales

- Remove and list product inventory when required to do so

- Utilize analytics to monitor Amazon ASIN level Prime status, high moving ASIN's and competitor trends

- Implement strategies to boost and maintain product rankings

- Knowhow to elevate and optimize product management processes

- Ensure products are accurately described, priced, and marketed while increasing brand awareness and visibility

- Manage the day-to-day responsibilities for all aspects of marketing for Amazon FBA



Reporting & Optimizations

- Monitor, analyze and report on Amazon FBA performance metrics, sales, competitive listings, and pricing

- Present ideas and work closely with executives and other tea
mbers to efficiently integrate sales optimization strategies.

- Gather and analyze reports from marketplaces, translate findings into insights and actionable growth tactics

- Keep up to date on all of Amazon updates and ensure compliance across all processes



REQUIREMENTS

Minimum 7+ years of relevant experience in online marketing and managing Amazon Storefronts



PREFERRED COMPETENCIES

• Proven experience in Amazon FBA inventory management, with a track record of successful results.

• Previous work experience with managing and navigating Amazon Seller Central and its various features.

• Dynamic and proactive approach to problem solving and workflow optimizations

• People-centric – Ability to promote customer satisfaction while working with cross-functional teams to drive deliverables

• Adequate knowledge of tier 1 and 2 consumer electronic products and troubleshooting

• Ability to work with ambiguity and meeting multiple deadlines

• Experience in managing hundreds of SKUs and revenues over $2M.

• Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel, including .csv & .txt files, filtering, conditional formatting, macros, pivot tables, etc.

• Ability to meet project deadlines, multitask and manage multiple accounts at same time

• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

• Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.

• Detail-oriented and highly organized.

• Ability to work independently, meet deadlines, and adapt to changes in a fast-paced environment.



How to Apply:

If you're passionate about e-commerce, Amazon, and have the skills and experience required for this role, we'd love to hear from you. Please submit your resume along with a cover letter outlining your relevant experience and explaining why you're the ideal candidate for this position to this job post.  In your cover letter, if you provide an explanation of what "FC-Processing" status means, you are guaranteed to go to the next step in the hiring process.



Note: This is a remote position, and candidates from all locations are welcome to apply. We offer flexible working hours and opportunities for professional growth within our organization. Join us in our mission to excel on the Amazon platform and provide exceptional customer experiences!

title: Listings/Citations Implementaton
description:
We currently manage approximately 35 client business listings that are set up through BrightLocal. To improve visibility and consistency across these accounts, we are expanding efforts to identify additional listing opportunities, resolve ongoing issues, and streamline communication between listing platforms and the internal team.



Each client’s existing listings will be reviewed to uncover missing, duplicate, or incomplete profiles, as well as additional directories where the business should be represented. This includes managing common challenges such as claiming profiles, requesting access, handling verification requirements, and documenting platform-specific barriers that prevent listings from being completed.



A dedicated file will be created and maintained for each client to serve as a single source of truth. This file will include all relevant login credentials, current listing statuses, known issues, completed resolutions, and required next steps. Verification requirements—such as phone calls,
s, or documentation—will be clearly documented so progress can continue without delays.



Listings will be organized by website and platform to allow the internal team to quickly understand what action is needed at any given time. When client involvement is required, the exact steps needed will be clearly outlined, enabling efficient coordination and faster completion of outstanding items.



This process is designed to centralize listing management, reduce friction in claiming and verification workflows, and ensure consistent follow-through across all client accounts.

title: Documentary Film Editor
description:
We are looking for a skilled Documentary Film Editor to assist in producing a video-based presentation for a family custody case. This production does not follow the format of a traditional documentary; instead, it is a carefully organized, narrative-based visual record created for formal review in a legal proceeding.



The goal is to help the court understand the context and chronology of events through carefully organized storytelling using real-life footage, recordings, and digital communications.



Responsibilities:

-Edit and organize raw media files (e.g., pictures, videos, audio recording, screenshots and screen recordings) into a coherent and legally appropriate video presentation.

-Collaborate closely with the client and legal team to ensure sensitive material is handled appropriately.

-Create visual transitions, on-screen text, and other supporting elements to enhance clarity and impact.

-Maintain a neutral, factual tone while also capturing the emotional nuances necessary for context.

-Ensure the final product is appropriate for submission to legal professionals or court

-Handle all content with discretion and professionalism



Qualifications:

-Have 3 or more years of Video editing experience 

-Proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro

-Have a documentary mindset and can craft emotional clarity from complex, real-life material.

-Understand the seriousness of legal matters and can approach content with professionalism.

-Are reliable, organized, can work independently and able to deliver under tight deadlines.

-Believe in the power of video to inform and support truth.



Salary and working hours will be discussed during the interview.

title: Documentary Film Editor
description:
We are looking for a Documentary Film Editor to assist in creating a video-based presentation for a family custody case. This project is not a traditional film but rather a structured visual record of personal, legal, and interpersonal issues that are being submitted for review in a legal context.



The editor will work with existing footage—primarily phone videos, recorded conversations,  and supporting materials such as text messages,
s, and documents—to produce a clear and emotionally grounded narrative. The purpose is to help the court understand the history and context of the situation through carefully organized and respectful visual storytelling.



Responsibilities:

-Edit raw footage into a coherent narrative, organized by topic or timeline

-Incorporate supporting materials (e.g., documents, screenshots, captions) to clarify issues

-Maintain tone and pacing that supports clarity, empathy, and respect

-Ensure the final product is appropriate for submission to legal professionals or court

-Handle all content with discretion and professionalism



Requirements:

- Strong experience editing documentary or factual content

- Proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro 

- Ability to work independently and manage sensitive or confidential materials

- Experience working on personal or legal-related projects is a plus

- Strong sense of narrative structure and attention to detail

title: Marketing Product Manager
description:
Marketing Product Manager

Remote - Rhode Island, USA



At Baby Delight, Inc., we create innovative baby products that make parenting easier, safer, and more joyful. We’re looking for a Marketing Product Manager to lead the strategy and execution of product initiatives from concept through launch.



In this role, you’ll blend creativity and data—conducting market and competitive analyses, identifying white space opportunities, and partnering with product development to bring innovative ideas to life. You’ll craft go-to-market plans, shape product positioning, and ensure every launch connects with parents and stands out in the marketplace.



What You’ll Bring:



• 5-8 years in product marketing or brand management (CPG or baby category a plus)



• Strong analytical, strategic, and storytelling skills



• Experience collaborating cross-functionally from concept to commercialization



Join a passionate, fast-growing team where your insights will help shape the future of baby products.



Apply with your resume, a short note about why you’d love to work with us, and add "SERIOUS INQUIRY" to the subject line of your response. Thank you for your interest!

title: Marketing & Insights Specialist/Product Manager
description:
Job Title: Marketing & Insights Specialist – Baby Products



Location: Remote



About Us:

At Macari Brands (Baby Delight, Go With Me, and joovy), we create innovative, parent-loved baby products that make family life easier, safer, and more joyful. We’re passionate about finding new ways to stand out in a competitive marketplace and deliver solutions that truly matter to families.



Position Overview:

We are looking for a detail-oriented, insights-driven Marketing & Insights Specialist/Product Manager to join our team. This role will focus on market research, competitive analysis, and brand insights to uncover white space opportunities for product innovation. The ideal candidate has a strong grasp of the U.S. baby products market, would appreciate if they have had previous experience in the juvenile product industry and/or US product market (Amazon, Target, Walmart, Babylist, etc.), a love for digging into data and trends, and the ability to turn findings into actionable strategies that guide product development and marketing.



Key Responsibilities:



• Conduct and synthesize market research, consumer insights, and trend tracking specific to the baby products industry.



• Build detailed competitive analyses to understand strengths, weaknesses, positioning, and pricing of key players.



• Evaluate our brand performance and identify areas for improvement or differentiation.



• Translate findings into clear insights, identifying “white space” opportunities where our brands can lead with innovation.



• Partner with product development and marketing teams to inform new product concepts and positioning strategies.



• Present research and recommendations in compelling, easy-to-understand reports and presentations.



Qualifications:



• Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Consumer Insights, or related field.



• 3+ years of experience in market research, consumer insights, or competitive analysis (CPG or baby products industry a plus).



• Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and identify actionable insights.



• Excellent written and verbal communication skills; able to translate complex findings into clear narratives.



• Creative thinker with a passion for spotting trends and finding new opportunities.



• Comfortable working cross-functionally with product, brand, and leadership teams.



What We Offer:



• Opportunity to shape the future of baby products in the U.S. market.



• Collaborative, creative, and growth-minded team culture.



• Competitive salary and benefits package.



• The chance to make an impact on families’ lives through meaningful innovation.



How to Apply:

Send your resume, write in the title of your message "Would Like to Interview ASAP", along with a brief cover letter highlighting relevant experience.

title: Social Media, Marketing & SEO Specialist
description:
About Us

We are a trusted Private Duty Nursing agency providing care for medically fragile children and individuals with intellectual or developmental disabilities (IDD) across Alabama. With a dedicated team of nurses, therapists, and clinical leaders, we ensure families receive compassionate, high-quality care in the comfort of their homes.

As we continue to grow, we are looking for a dynamic Offshore Marketing & Social Media Manager to help us build deeper community relationships, expand awareness, and generate qualified leads among healthcare entities, case managers, and families.



Role Overview

You will lead all website maintenance, digital marketing, social media, and SEO initiatives for our Alabama-based operations. Your role is both strategic and hands-on—creating engaging content, managing campaigns, designing marketing assets, and helping drive inbound referrals. You’ll also help coordinate in-person engagement opportunities for our US-based clinical and management teams.

Manage and grow our social media presence 
, Instagram, LinkedIn, etc.)

Create and manage
 marketing campaigns via Mailchimp or comparable platforms

Track campaign performance and ROI; provide monthly reporting and recommendations

Wordpress

/Instagram Ads Manager

Microsoft Outlook, Excel, Word

Excellent written English and strong understanding of US tone, culture, and healthcare messaging

Detail-oriented, responsive, and collaborative with cross-functional teams

title: Healthcare Recruiter
description:
Job Summary

Sunbridge Home Health Care is a trusted provider of private duty nursing services committed to delivering exceptional care to medically complex children and their families across Alabama. We strive to serve each family with excellence, compassion, and the highest level of clinical support in the home setting. As our demand for skilled nurses grows, we are expanding our recruitment efforts globally. We are hiring an Offshore Healthcare Recruiter to join our Philippines-based team and support full-cycle recruitment efforts for Sunbridge Home Health Care. This position will play a vital role in sourcing, screening, and onboarding U.S.-based nurses and healthcare professionals, ensuring every Sunbridge Home Health Care family is supported by highly qualified clinical staff.

Responsibilities

Talent Sourcing & Attraction



Source qualified candidates via job boards, social media, LinkedIn, ATS systems, and referral channels

Build and nurture talent pipelines for recurring and future hiring needs

Collaborate with U.S.-based stakeholders to define ideal candidate profiles



Screening & Selection



Conduct pre-screening calls using culturally appropriate, U.S.-style communication

Evaluate candidate experience, communication skills, and cultural fit

Coordinate interviews and background checks, and maintain consistent follow-up



Interview & Offer Management



Liaise with U.S. teams to facilitate interviews and ensure a seamless candidate experience

Ensure all hires comply with Federal and State credentialing requirements



Candidate Experience & Onboarding



Maintain candidate engagement from acceptance through onboarding

Assist with document collection, licensing, and onboarding procedures

Monitor new hire satisfaction to reduce early turnover



Reporting & Process Optimization

Maintain accurate records in the applicant tracking system (Bullhorn ATS platform) and internal databases

Track key recruitment metrics (e.g., time-to-fill, cost-per-hire, source effectiveness)

Recommend and implement recruitment process improvements



Additional Support Functions



Assist Sunbridge Home Health Care with creating and adjusting schedules within their EMR system

Monitor Electronic Visit Verification (EVV) compliance across all field healthcare staff

Support the transition of healthcare personnel files to a paperless, electronic documentation system

Migrate historical candidate records and data into the applicant tracking software



Qualifications & Skills



2+ years of experience in healthcare recruitment, preferably serving U.S.-based clients

Strong communication skills in English, with comfort in U.S. business culture

Experience with applicant tracking systems (Bullhorn preferred)

Proven ability to manage multiple open roles with speed and precision

High attention to detail, professionalism, and accountability in a remote work setting

Stable internet and home office setup required

title: Senior Medical Coder
description:
Senior Medical Coder

Primary Care / General Medicine

Remote — Philippines | US Business Hours | Full-Time





Role Summary

We are looking for an experienced medical coder to handle the full range of encounter types for a US-based primary care practice. This includes routine E/M visits, Medicare-specific coding (AWV, CCM, preventive), and encounters requiring modifier usage and clinical judgment. You will be responsible for maintaining coding accuracy and compliance across Medicare, Medi-Cal, and commercial PPO payers. Depending on team structure, you may also provide quality assurance review for other coding staff.

Responsibilities

• Code all encounter types for a primary care / general medicine practice, including E/M visits (99201–99215), preventive medicine, chronic care management, and Annual Wellness Visits

• Apply correct ICD-10-CM diagnosis codes and CPT codes based on provider documentation

• Handle Medicare, Medi-Cal, and commercial PPO coding distinctions, including AWV vs. preventive vs. E/M billing

• Apply modifiers accurately, particularly Modifier 25 and Modifier 59

• Complete superbills in the EHR and ensure clean data transfer to billing software for claim submission

• Identify and flag documentation gaps that prevent compliant coding, and communicate these to the US-based team

• Review encounters coded by other tea
mbers when applicable, and flag recurring error patterns

• Assist with backlog clearance of historical encounters as needed

• Communicate directly with the US-based team lead on coding questions, volume updates, and escalations

Required Qualifications

• Minimum 3 years of medical coding experience for US healthcare providers

• Demonstrated experience with Medicare, Medicaid, and commercial PPO coding in a primary care or internal medicine setting

• Strong working knowledge of E/M leveling (2021 MDM-based guidelines), ICD-10-CM, and CPT

• Experience with modifier usage and understanding of common audit risk areas

• Familiarity with US payer denial patterns and how coding errors lead to claim rejections

• Ability to work independently and exercise judgment on complex or ambiguous encounters

• Fluent in English (written and verbal)

Preferred Qualifications

• CPC, CCS, or equivalent coding certification

• Experience working for a US-facing BPO, billing company, or RCM firm

• Experience mentoring or QA-reviewing other coders

• Familiarity with California Medi-Cal managed care and IPA capitation structures

• Experience with Practice Fusion, Practice Suite, or similar US EHR/billing platforms

title: Registered Nurse (RN) who is fluent in Spanish and English
description:
Position Summary



We are seeking a compassionate and skilled Registered Nurse (RN) who is fluent in Spanish and English to assist with patient intake, questionnaires and screening to assist the on-site doctors with their consultation patient work flow. 



You will be part of a Team that provides high-quality patient care through effective communication with both Spanish and English speaking patients and their families. The ideal candidate combines strong clinical expertise with cultural sensitivity and exceptional communication skills.



Key Responsibilities



Patient Care



Perform comprehensive patient questionnaires and document in detail in patient file for Doctor consult guidance.



Screen patient health status and record accurate, timely information for consult.



Collaborate with physicians as needed to guide any follow ups.



Language & Communication



Communicate with Spanish-speaking patients and families to gather pre appointment screening information.



Translate or interpret patient feedback to English patient file notes for physician consult.



Patient Advocacy



Ensure patients’ cultural, linguistic, and emotional needs are respected.



Support patients and families in navigating the arrival and onboarding process. 



Compliance & Safety



Follow all nursing standards, policies, and regulatory guidelines.



Maintain patient confidentiality and adhere to HIPAA requirements.



Participate in training, quality improvement initiatives, and continuing education.

title: Account manager
description:
We are looking for an Account Manager to build and maintain strong relationships with our high-value players, ensuring they receive an exceptional gaming experience while driving engagement, retention, and revenue. This role requires a customer-centric, sales-savvy professional who excels at personalized communication, player engagement, and soft-selling strategies.



-Manage and engage VIP players through messaging.

-Provide exclusive offers, promotions, and personalized support.

-Upsell and re-engage inactive players using a soft sales approach.

- Analyze player behavior to anticipate needs and maximize retention.

- Collaborate with marketing, CRM, and customer support teams.



What We’re Looking For:

-Gaming/iGaming experience preferred.

-Strong communication & relationship-building skills.

-Soft sales & upselling experience in a B2C environment.

-Data-driven mindset with a proactive approach.



Working hours would be: 2am-12pm PH time.

title: Meal Planning & Entertaining Assistant
description:
Job Description: Meal Planning & Entertaining Assistant

Location: Remote 

Hours: Part-time, flexible. 5 hrs per week // 20 hrs per month (note: hours are flexible, i.e. could be half a day/week, or 1 full day per fortnight, etc.)

Rate: NZD $5-6/hr (NZD$
/month) - approx PHP
/month



Role Overview:

We are looking for a creative and health-focused menu planner to design fortnightly meal plans for our family. The role is perfect for someone who enjoys food, is interested in cooking and entertaining, enjoys researching recipes from top chefs, and can turn them into practical, nutritious menus with clear grocery lists.



Responsibilities:

Create a fortnightly menu (every 2 weeks) including breakfast, lunch, dinner, and snacks.

- Ensure all meals are healthy, weight-loss friendly, but still delicious.

- Research and include new, exciting recipes (favourite chefs will be provided for inspiration).

- Prepare weekly grocery lists based on menu items, clearly organized by category.

Assist with special entertaining menus:

- Develop special menus entertaining groups of 15-25 guests. Menu's consisting of 2-3 entree dishes/platters, 4-5 dishes/platters to be served as part of the main meal, 1 dessert, plus a selection of sweet foods to be served with hot drinks at the end. Some menu's will be cuisine-themed. 

- Identify recipes that can be prepared ahead of time and frozen.

- Outline what needs to be cooked fresh on the day.

- Provide complete shopping lists for entertaining menus.

- Include food presentation ideas

- Incorporate any new recipes of interest into the weekly family menus so they can be trialled before serving to guests.

Manage all favourite/trusted/tried recipes for future reference. 



Skills & Qualities

- Strong background in nutrition, meal planning, or culinary research.

- Ability to adapt recipes to be healthier without losing flavour.

- Organized, detail-oriented, and creative.

- Able to present menus in a clear format



If you are interested in this job, I'd love to hear from you! 

Please let me know: 

- why you think you'd be the perfect person for this role

- any experience you've had related to this role 

- CV



Note - I am wanting to hire ASAP for this role. I look forward to hearing from you! :)

title: Part-Time Virtual Wardrobe & Styling Assistant
description:
We’re looking for a fashion-forward virtual assistant to manage and curate seasonal wardrobes for a woman, her husband, and their baby daughter. This role involves sourcing stylish, practical pieces online and creating cohesive outfit ideas for each season, occasion, and lifestyle need.



Your tasks will include:

• Finding affordable and stylish clothing online (NZ & Int’l shipping)

• Creating outfit combinations and mood boards

• Organising seasonal wardrobe plans for each family member

• Reselling past wardrobe items 



Ideal candidate:

• Strong eye for style, fit, and colour coordination

• Up-to-date with fashion trends

• Experience in fashion, styling, or online sourcing

• Familiar with tools like Pinterest or Canva, and  wardrobe apps

• Great written English and attention to detail



Hours:

• 5-10 hours/month (flexible)



To Apply:

Please include the following in your application:

- A short introduction and why you believe you’d be a great fit for this role

- A message requesting the application task — this will help us assess your styling and sourcing skills



Once you message us, we’ll send you a simple exercise: you’ll be asked to recreate an outfit based on a specific image reference, sourcing similar items from different brands (not the original ones shown). This will help us see your eye for detail, trend awareness, and ability to bring a look together from scratch.



Only applicants who complete the task will be considered for an interview.

title: Personal/Executive Assistant in Household & Business
description:
Are you an organized, driven, and proactive professional with a knack for helping others achieve their goals? Do you have a passion for creating order from chaos, and a talent for managing multiple responsibilities seamlessly? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!



I am a young female entrepreneur with big dreams and an even bigger to-do list! I run a dynamic furniture and homewares interior design business, while also managing the day-to-day tasks of our small but mighty team. With our first child on the way, I need someone who can help me juggle both my business and personal responsibilities efficiently and effectively.



What You’ll Do:



- Serve as my right-hand person, managing both business and personal tasks

- Help me to prioritize and organize my daily, weekly, and monthly schedule

- Set large goals, and break them down into achievable daily tasks

- Manage
s, correspondence, appointments, and calendars

- Assist with business operations, including team coordination, project management, and client communications

- Organize and manage personal tasks, family schedules, and household responsibilities

- Provide coaching and accountability to keep me focused and productive

- Act as a trusted advisor, offering creative solutions and new ideas

- Maintain the highest level of confidentiality and trust in all matters



What You’ll Bring:



- Proven experience as a personal or executive assistant, or similar role

- Exceptional organizational and multitasking skills

- Strong communication skills, both written and verbal

- A proactive, “can-do” attitude and the ability to say no when necessary

- High energy, creativity, and initiative to anticipate needs and solve problems

- Strong sense of confidentiality and trustworthiness

- Ability to manage both business and personal tasks with equal efficiency



Why Join Us:



- Be part of a creative and dynamic environment

- Flexibility to work from home

- Opportunity to grow with a rapidly evolving business

- Grow together - and achieve more together!



Requirements:

- Equipment: Laptop, Fast internet, Clear mic, Camera, Smartphone

- Time commitment: Initially part-time while developing this role, then potentially upwards of 40+ hours per week. Mainly Monday - Friday. I am based in New Zealand, therefore some cross-over will be required with NZ hours, however I run a very flexible schedule, and happy to look at all options here.

- Fluency in written and spoken English



If you think you are the perfect person for this role, please message/email me the following :

- A cover letter

- Resume

- Your personality test results from 

- Record a loom video explaining why you think you are the best person for this role

- And.. I'm also interested to hear what *your* life goals and dreams are - please share in your video.



I look forward to hearing from you!

title: Senior Amazon Marketplace Strategist
description:
Company Vision

At Lucky 21, we help top apparel brands thrive on Amazon through data-driven insights, advanced tools, and innovative strategies. With a strong support system and a passionate team, we’re looking for a seasoned Amazon expert to lead optimization and drive results across our storefronts. Join us as we push the boundaries of Amazon selling.



Loom Introduction

Hear directly from our founder: 



Company Culture

Lucky 21 thrives in a collaborative and innovative environment that empowers every tea
mber to contribute meaningfully. We value transparency, open communication, continuous learning, and a relentless drive to improve. Our team feels like a close-knit family, staying connected daily through face-to-face video collaboration via Microsoft Teams.



Role Overview

We’re hiring a Senior Amazon Marketplace Strategist with at least 5 years of advanced Seller Central experience to serve as our in-house expert. You'll lead the way on listing optimization, advertising, product launches, inventory management, and new growth strategies—while mentoring brand managers and staying ahead of the latest Amazon updates and tools, including AI innovations. You’ll report directly to executive leadership.



Key Responsibilities

-Own and guide all aspects of Seller Central strategy, from SEO to advertising and analytics

-Lead advanced listing optimization using Helium 10 and other top tools

-Oversee advertising campaigns with innovative, performance-driven PPC strategies

-Spearhead new product launches, review acquisition, and ranking acceleration

-Coach and train our internal brand team on Amazon best practices and tools

-Monitor trends, software updates, and AI breakthroughs—and bring back what matters

-Analyze sales, profitability, and inventory to improve turn rates and account health



Success Looks Like

-Measurable gains in organic ranking, conversion rates, and ad performance

-Brand managers operating at a higher skill level through your guidance

-Smart inventory decisions that improve cash flow and sales velocity

-Continuous innovation that keeps Lucky 21 on the cutting edge of marketplace growth



Requirements

-5+ years of hands-on, high-level experience with Amazon Seller Central

-Deep expertise in Helium 10 (all key tools) and other optimization software

-Proven results in advertising strategy, product launches, and listing growth

-Agency or big-brand experience preferred

-Strong awareness of emerging Amazon strategies, software, and AI applications



Technology Stack

You’ll work within Lucky 21’s custom Amazon operations stack: Helium 10, internal reporting tools, ERP integrations, and advanced data platforms.



Work Environment & Hours

This is a fully remote role, but highly collaborative. We meet face-to-face on Microsoft Teams throughout the day, working closely across departments in real time.



Work hours

Monday–Thursday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM EST

Friday: 9:00 AM – 2:30 PM EST



**How to Apply**

ALL applications must be submitted through this link:


=



If you're an Amazon pro who’s always ahead of the curve, thrives in a fast-paced team, and knows how to turn strategy into sales—we want to hear from you.

title: Multifamily Development Underwriter
description:
This role can range between Analyst to VP/Director-level depending upon the experience level of the applicant. 



The candidate will be the sourcing, reviewing, and underwriting of existing multifamily/build-to-rent assets and potential development opportunities. The development opportunities will include multifamily, build-to-rent, low income housing tax credits, and single family lot development. 



The candidate will also be responsible for creating investment presentations and asset management reports.



The ideal candidate has experience in some or all of these fields, with a strong work ethic and attention to detail.



Experience Summary:



The right candidate will likely have at least 3 years in real estate, with a preference for candidates who have previously specialized in multifamily and/or development underwriting. He or she will have a familiarity with T12s, rent rolls, OMs, PSAs, loan commitments, and market comp analyses. A strong grasp of NOI, IRR, MOIC, NPV, cash-on-cash, and run sensitivity analyses will be important. Exposure to LIHTC at any level, GP-LP waterfall structures, and preferred equity are a bonus.

title: Ecommerce Graphic Designer (Image Ads) – DTC eCom (Meta/Facebook)

 & Instagram) Ads. The ideal candidate knows how to blend speed, creativity, and performance—and can consistently turn around eye-catching visuals using templates, AI, and tools like StaticFlow and Canva.



Portfolio required when applying. Applications without portfolios will not be considered.



Responsibilities:



* Use templates, frameworks (e.g., StaticFlow), and AI tools to create high-converting static image ads

* Understand and follow creative briefs, hooks, and offer angles provided by our marketing team

* Produce scroll-stopping designs that align with our target audience and platform best practices

* Iterate quickly and deliver creatives in a fast-paced, test-heavy environment

* Stay on top of visual trends in the pet niche and Meta ad space



Requirements:



* Proven experience designing static ad creatives for eCommerce/dropshipping brands (Meta ads)

* Familiar with tools like Canva, Photoshop, Figma, or ad-focused platforms like StaticFlow

* Uses AI tools (e.g., Midjourney, ChatGPT, etc.) to streamline and enhance workflow

* Strong grasp of direct-response design principles, visual hierarchy, and offer communication

* Knowledge of the pet niche or a passion for it is a strong plus

* Reliable, fast turnaround, and able to manage multiple ad variations at once



What We’re Looking For:



You understand what makes a static ad work. You know how to combine engaging copy with the right image, how to test formats quickly, and how to make thumb-stopping visuals with minimal direction. If you’ve created winning ads before—we want to see them!



To apply:

title: Expert Amazon Listing Designer for Pet Brand
description:
Expert Amazon Listing Designer for Pet Brand 



We are seeking a talented graphic designer with extensive experience creating Amazon listing images to join our growing pet brand team. In this role, you will create high-converting A+ content, main listing images, and infographic carousels that meet Amazon's guidelines while maximizing conversion rates.



Examples of Desired Results:


/products/pawtrimpro


/products/anti-bark-collar


/products/krallen-zauber-der-bestseller-2024





To elaborate: Our company specializes in pet products and sells primarily through Amazon. Experience with Amazon listing image creation is mandatory, including knowledge of Amazon's image requirements and best practices for marketplace success. Photoshop skills are considered a significant advantage.



If you have experience designing Amazon listings in the pet industry or other high-performing Amazon stores, it's a bonus. When you apply, include the word "A-PLUS" and provide examples of Amazon listings you've designed, including their performance metrics if possible. We will only review applications that meet these criteria.



Job Description and Examples:

Your responsibilities will include creating compelling Ecommerce listing images, A+ content, and infographics that drive conversions. You'll work with our product and marketing teams to showcase product benefits effectively while maintaining full compliance with Amazon's image requirements.

Please complete this design task:

Create a 7-image carousel for an orthopedic dog bed Amazon listing. Include:



Main image meeting Amazon's requirements (pure white background + Packaging, )

Infographic highlighting key features (memory foam, waterproof cover, non-slip bottom)

Size chart with dog breed recommendations

Lifestyle image showing the product in use

title: Data Acquisition Specialist
description:
About Us:



Starbridge.ai is at the forefront of transforming public data into actionable insights for commercial applications. We help organizations harness the power of public records to drive business success. Our team specializes in acquiring and processing data from government agencies, delivering valuable insights across industries. As we continue to grow, we are looking for motivated professionals to join our dynamic team and play a key role in shaping the future of data-driven decision-making.



Role Overview:



We are seeking a Data Acquisition Specialist to lead the process of acquiring public records and managing data collection from various sources. This role will involve overseeing the entire lifecycle of data acquisition—from submitting requests to tracking responses and integrating data into our systems. You will collaborate with government agencies and internal teams to ensure that all data is accurately gathered, processed, and made available for use by clients and internal stakeholders.



Key Responsibilities:



• Draft, submit, and manage data requests to government agencies, focusing on the acquisition of key public records such as vendor lists, purchase orders, and employee contacts.

• Work closely with procurement, finance, human resources, and other departments to collect critical data from public sources.

• Utilize Salesforce to track, manage, and categorize all data requests and responses, ensuring efficient data acquisition processes.

• Review and process incoming data responses, ensuring accuracy, completeness, and proper tagging (e.g., Bounced, Citizenship, Linked Form, Processing, Success, Declined, Paywall).

• Liaise with government agencies to clarify data requests, follow up on inquiries, and ensure compliance with public records regulations.

• Collaborate with internal teams, including engineers, to ensure data is correctly processed, stored, and made accessible for commercial use.

• Support adherence to data acquisition policies and contribute to streamlining processes for improved efficiency.

• Recommend best practices to continuously improve data collection and management workflows.



Qualifications:



• Strong understanding of public records laws, including state-level transparency regulations

• Experience with data acquisition and public records management in a commercial context.

• Proficiency in CRM systems such as Salesforce for tracking and managing the lifecycle of data acquisition processes.

• High attention to detail and organizational skills to manage multiple data requests and responses effectively.

• Excellent communication skills, with the ability to interact with government agencies and internal teams effectively.

• Prior experience working with public data or in a government-related environment is highly desirable.

• Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment, manage multiple priorities, and meet deadlines.



What We Offer:



• Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package (including 13th-month pay and paid leaves).

• Opportunities to work with cutting-edge data technology alongside a talented and dynamic team.

• Flexibility with remote work options.

• Continuous professional development and growth opportunities.



How to Apply:



Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your experience in data acquisition and public records management.

title: FULL-TIME SOCIAL MEDIA AD VIDEO EDITOR & SOCIAL-MEDIA HELPER
description:
We own several online E-commerce brands in the outdoor/hiking/camping, beauty, and clothing niches. Every day we get new raw clips from customers, ambassadors and our own content team. We need a highly-skilled and talented video editor who can turn those clips into short ads for social media advertising that SELL.



YOUR MAIN JOBS:

- Edit short videos (about 20 seconds to 3 minutes duration) for
 and Instagram ads and posts.

- Add text, music, and simple effects in CapCut-Desktop, Camtasia or Adobe Premier Pro.

- Use ChatGPT or Claude to help write scripts, catchy hooks and captions (we teach you this).

- Break long videos into short reels, and join many short clips into 20 second - 3 minute ads.

- Social media moderation: Check our
 & Instagram ads every day- hide spam, reply to good comments.

- Post quick photos and reels on our brands Social Media accounts.

- Keep all files tidy in Google Drive.



You’ll have 6-8 working hours per day, 5–7 days each week. Weekends are lighter.





MUST-HAVE SKILLS:

- Great with CapCut Desktop, Camtasia (cutting, adding text, basic motion, fixing sound).

- Use Canva Pro for thumbnails and simple graphics.

- Comfortable using ChatGPT / Claude to write copy/scripts for ads and social media content.

- Can make voice-overs with ElevenLabs (we’ll teach if needed).

- Exceptional English- both writing and speaking.

- Show us a portfolio (at least 5 ads you edited for online products).



Start your application with the answer to 26 - 8 so we know you read this.



NICE-TO-HAVE

- Have handled comment sections on
 or Instagram ads.

- Basic Photoshop or Affinity skills.

- Love hiking, fashion, or beauty gear- always a plus!



PAY & PERKS

- USD $1,400 – $1,800 per month (?80k-95k), based on skill and speed.

- Performance bonus for every ad that scales profitably.

- 13th-month pay and Philippine holidays.

- Long-term job; all software accounts provided.

- We’ll teach you our winning ad formula.



INCLUDE IN YOUR APPLICATON:

- Link to your portfolio (Google Drive / Dropbox).

- Two sentences on the fastest time you finished an ad edit.

- Screenshot of your internet speed.

- Your start date and salary request.

title: Estimator & CAD Drafter – Structured Cabling & AV Projects
description:
Capital Techies, a fast-growing Managed Service Provider (MSP) specializing in IT infrastructure and audiovisual solutions, is seeking a detail-driven Estimator with CAD drafting capabilities. This is a full-time role (40 hours/week) focused on reviewing and updating construction drawings, interpreting specs, and producing quotes for Cat6 cabling and conference room AV installations.



About the Role

You’ll be the technical brain behind every proposal—reading and updating CAD drawings, marking up prints for project bids, and collaborating with sales and operations to finalize accurate, profitable estimates. Your day-to-day is driven by precision, deadlines, and the satisfaction of quoting work that gets built.



Key Responsibilities

Read and update CAD drawings to reflect low-voltage layouts, cable runs, AV placements, and revisions from field surveys.



Interpret construction drawings, riser diagrams, and spec sheets to scope structured cabling and audiovisual systems.



Produce and maintain accurate BOMs and labor estimates for Cat6/Cat6A cabling projects.



Annotate floor plans with device locations (WAPs, wall plates, cameras, mics, etc.) and pathways.



Coordinate with the operations team to ensure site conditions and estimates align.



Build repeatable templates and pricing models for fast-turnaround proposals.



Requirements

1+ years experience in low-voltage or AV estimating with CAD drafting responsibilities.



Proficiency in AutoCAD, Bluebeam, and construction plan reading.



Proven experience updating drawings with network drops, device placements, and pathway routing.



Strong familiarity with Cat6 infrastructure, racks, patch panels, and AV solutions.



Ability to manage multiple estimates at once under fast-paced timelines.





Why Capital Techies?

You’ll work on real projects with direct client impact—not buried in bureaucracy.



A nimble, entrepreneurial team that values execution and accountability.



Remote flexibility and potential for advancement as we grow our design-build department.

title: Client Care Executive
description:
Client Care Executive



Company: Neovara (on behalf of Cru Wine) Location: Remote (UAE Business Hours) Reports to: Head of Customer Success





About Neovara and Cru Wine



Neovara is a trusted back-office and operational partner supporting international businesses across operations, finance, customer service, data, and digital systems.



This role supports Cru Wine, a leading fine wine merchant serving collectors and investors globally. Cru Wine operates a premium digital platform and eShop, delivering rare wines and exceptional service to clients across multiple markets.



As part of Neovara’s Client Care function, you will play a key role in protecting and enhancing the client experience across customer service and digital touchpoints.





About the Role



We are seeking a proactive and detail-driven Client Care Executive to join our team.



This role combines:



· Customer service excellence



· CRM & invoicing accuracy



· eShop & website operational management



You will be responsible for ensuring a seamless, premium experience across phone,
, CRM, and online ordering.



This is ideal for someone who takes ownership, enjoys digital systems, and wants to grow within a structured and performance-driven organisation.





Key Responsibilities



1?? Client Care & Communication



• Act as the first point of contact for incoming phone calls and
s. • Provide prompt, accurate, and professional responses to all client queries. • Route complex queries to the appropriate internal teams when necessary. • Ensure response time SLAs are maintained. • Proactively follow up with satisfied clients to request reviews and testimonials.





2?? Order Processing & Invoicing



• Process client invoices accurately and efficiently. • Coordinate with sales, logistics, and finance teams to ensure smooth order execution. • Monitor open orders and ensure clients are updated when required. • Maintain high accuracy in billing and documentation.





3?? CRM & Data Accuracy (HubSpot)



• Maintain and clean client data within HubSpot CRM. • Ensure correct client categorisation and lifecycle stages. • Monitor duplicate records and data inconsistencies. • Assist in preparing weekly client care performance reports.





4?? Website & eShop Management



• Monitor and process all incoming eShop orders. • Track and review abandoned carts, escalating potential sales opportunities to the sales team. • Update homepage banners, featured products, and promotional content when required. • Update product pricing and ensure correct display across the eShop. • Work closely with the Data Team to review pricing accuracy and margin alignment. • Regularly check that all product listings, stock levels, and pricing are correctly displayed. • Identify and report any UX issues or friction points affecting customer experience.





5?? Continuous Improvement



• Track recurring customer issues and propose solutions. • Suggest improvements to workflows and digital experience. • Collaborate across sales, marketing, logistics, finance, and data teams to enhance overall performance









Requirements



Experience



• Minimum 2–3 years in customer service, operations, e-commerce, or client-facing role. • Experience in a premium or luxury environment is an advantage.





Communication



• Exceptional spoken and written English. • Professional and confident phone manner. • Comfortable handling high-value international clients.





Technical Skills



• Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel essential). • Experience using HubSpot or similar CRM systems. • Familiarity with e-commerce platforms or website content management systems. • Comfortable reviewing pricing data and working with structured datasets. • Experience with invoicing or ERP systems is advantageous.





Personal Attributes



• Highly organised and detail-oriented. • Takes ownership and follows through. • Structured thinker with strong problem-solving skills. • Calm and professional under pressure. • Growth-driven and interested in long-term development.





What We Offer



• Fully remote role (UAE business hours). • Annual performance-based bonus linked to company results. • Paid holidays (including official Philippine bank holidays). • Additional unpaid leave for top-performing tea
mbers. • Anniversary recognition and annual Christmas gift. • Clear opportunity for career progression within Neovara and the broader group.

title: Ticket Broker Assistant - Ticket Pricer/Fulfiller
description:
We are an expanding ticketing agency looking to recruit an enthusiastic and well-organised virtual assistant with proficient computer skills to help execute on ticket sales, fulfilment, inventory management and basic customer support. There is plenty of room for advancement as well as long term employment if you’re competent, hardworking and efficient.



Someone who is looking to develop and learn new skills in a fast paced business and exciting industry would be perfect for this role. Training will be provided upon hire to ensure you are equipped with everything you need, as well as ongoing support, however previous experience of pricing tickets and monitoring changes daily is essential.



Flexible working offered with a core 40 hours a week, which includes working every weekend on Saturday & Sunday. Work schedule would ideally be 9:00 - 17:00 CET. Payment made monthly directly to your bank account in PHP or USD depending on your preference.



Personal requirements:

- Excellent English is a MUST (both written and spoken)

- High level of attention to detail and ability to work under pressure

- Knowledge of Google & Microsoft suites

- Comfortable dealing with customers via WhatsApp

- Flexibility with working time and hours

- Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks efficiently.

- Experience purchasing tickets for events on Ticketmaster or Premier League clubs is highly desirable

- Background in listing, pricing, and fulfilling orders on popular online platforms such as but not limited to: StubHub, Viagogo, and Ticombo is crucial for this role.

- Understanding of using proxies and/or a multi-session web browsers such as Session Box, Jancy, Multi Login, NST etc.



Technical requirements:

- Laptop/desktop with minimum 8GB of RAM (windows or mac)

- Secondary monitor

- Fast and reliable internet connection



Job roles include but are not limited to…

- Creating ticket listings and accurately pricing against appropriate secondary market websites. With frequent daily monitoring.

- Manage inventory of purchased tickets across a number of different marketplaces.

- Account creation for the ticket platforms and event sign ups.

- Manage
 correspondence with ticket providers and customers.

- Delivering tickets to customers promptly and accurately through uploading to online portals, or through direct contact via our business’ WhatsApp, adhering to deadlines.

- Please include your favourite sports team in your application, and anything you know about the Premier League so we know you've taken the time to read this description.

- Address any issues or discrepancies with orders in a timely manner.

- Providing support to customers to ensure they have a great experience.



Questions:

- What attracted you to this role?

- What experience do you have in listing and pricing tickets on online resale platforms?

- Have you ever used proxies or multi-session web browsers before? If yes, please explain how and when you’ve used them.

- This job will require up to 8 hours of work per day, as well as working every Saturday & Sunday. Would this suit your lifestyle, and which 2 days would be your preferred off-days?

- Do you have a fast and reliable internet connection? And what device do you intend to work on (please provide make and model).



Please include a tailored cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you are a good fit for the role, as well as a PDF copy of your CV.

title: B2B Digital Marketing Specialist (US-Focused)
description:
We are looking for a results-driven B2B Digital Marketing Specialist to support paid acquisition,
 automation, and campaign optimization efforts across three business units targeting US-based clients.



This is a growth-focused execution role. You will work closely with leadership and Business Development Managers to generate qualified leads, optimize campaigns, and improve overall marketing performance.



If you understand B2B funnels, performance marketing, and data-driven decision-making, we’d love to meet you.



What You’ll Be Doing



Paid Media Management



- Manage and optimize Google Ads, Meta Ads, and LinkedIn Ads

- Monitor cost per lead (CPL), customer acquisition cost (CAC), and return on investment (ROI)

- Continuously test creatives, audiences, and campaign structures



 Marketing & Automation



- Build and manage
 campaigns and automation workflows

- Support lead nurturing sequences to improve engagement

- Maintain list segmentation and optimize open and click rates



CRM & Sales Support



- Support Business Development Managers by delivering marketing-qualified leads

- Track campaign performance and pipeline metrics

- Maintain CRM data accuracy and reporting visibility



Reporting & Optimization



- Provide weekly and monthly performance reports

- Analyze campaign data and recommend improvements

- Optimize campaigns based on data insights and performance trends



What We’re Looking For



2–5+ years of B2B digital marketing experience

Experience managing paid ads (Google and Meta required, LinkedIn preferred)

Strong understanding of
 marketing platforms and automation

Familiarity with CRM systems (HubSpot, GoHighLevel, or similar)

Strong analytical skills and comfort working with numbers

Clear and professional written English

Experience generating qualified leads for US-based clients



How to Apply:



If you have experience in the responsibilities above and a strong background in generating qualified leads, please apply by sending your CV along with a brief summary of your relevant experience.

title: Quantity Surveyor / Office Engineer - Remote (Experience in JobTread/Buildertrend)
description:
Application instructions below:



About PropFix.ie



PropFix.ie is Ireland's trusted property maintenance specialist, offering comprehensive solutions with years of expertise across the construction and renovation sectors. We transform spaces through our diverse range of services, from handyman solutions and office fit-outs to complete renovations, house extensions, and specialized installations including doors, floors, and partitions.



Our commitment to delivering the best value property maintenance has established us as a reliable partner for residential and commercial clients nationwide. With decades of experience, including 50 years of expertise in garage conversions, we pride ourselves on impeccable craftsmanship, turning our clients' visions into reality while ensuring their properties remain in top condition.



Role Overview

We are seeking a detail-oriented Quantity Surveyor/Office Engineer to join our dynamic team. This multifaceted role combines quantity surveying expertise with office engineering and financial administration, focusing on accurate cost estimation, project budgeting, and comprehensive project support. The successful candidate will work closely with our project managers, site teams, and clients to ensure precise cost control and seamless project delivery from concept to completion.



Key Responsibilities

Cost Estimation & Quantity Surveying



Project Estimating: Calculate materials, labor costs, and overall project budgets with precision

BOQ & BOM Preparation: Develop comprehensive Bills of Quantities and Bills of Materials for all projects

Job Pricing: Analyze construction plans and prepare detailed quantity requirements and pricing structures

Contract Analysis: Scrutinize maintenance costs, material expenses, and contracts to secure optimal deals

Tender Management: Analyze tenders and manage procurement processes for construction and design projects

Prepare accurate brickwork and blockwork quantity take-offs, including bricks, blocks, mortar, lintels, insulation, and related masonry components

Analyze brickwork labor and material rates to ensure competitive and accurate pricing

Estimating Tools: Utilize software including Simpro, JobTread, Bluebeam, PlanSwift, CostX, Measure Square, Stone Pro, and Microsoft Office to support estimating, budgeting, and project documentation.



Project Coordination & Client Management



Stakeholder Liaison: Coordinate with site managers, clients, contractors, and subcontractors to ensure smooth project execution

Reporting: Prepare comprehensive reports, analyses, contracts, budgets, and risk assessments

Strategic Advisory: Advise managers and clients on cost improvements, new strategies, and savings opportunities

Change Management: Document design changes and update budgets accordingly

Material Management: Track materials inventory and coordinate ordering when required



Financial Administration & Office Support



Invoice Management: Handle invoicing processes and perform data entry for financial documentation

Administrative Support: Assist staff accountants and handle various office and financial tasks

Client Administration: Manage administrative tasks delegated by clients with efficiency and accuracy



Required Skills & Experience

Technical Requirements



Quantity Surveying: Proven experience in cost estimation, BOQ preparation, and quantity surveying methodologies

Construction Knowledge: Strong understanding of construction processes, materials, and industry standards

Financial Acumen: Experience with budget management, financial reporting, and cost control

Contract Management: Knowledge of construction contracts, procurement, and tender analysis

Simpro Experience: Hands-on experience using Simpro for job costing, project budgeting, invoicing, and workflow management



Professional Skills



Analytical Skills: Strong problem-solving abilities with exceptional attention to detail

Software Proficiency: Competency in quantity surveying software, spreadsheet applications, and financial systems

Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills for client and contractor liaison

Organization: Outstanding organizational skills with ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously

Adaptability: Flexibility to handle diverse administrative and technical tasks



What We Offer



Competitive salary package

Opportunity to work with self-builders across Ireland and the UK

Professional development and training opportunities

Collaborative and supportive remote work environment

Career growth potential within an expanding company

Involvement in diverse construction and visualization projects

Remote working flexibility with comprehensive project support systems

Experience working on international projects with diverse clients.



Instructions:

Please complete the attached application form and submit it along with your CV:
