title: Urgent Hiring: Virtual Executive Assistant — Executive Support for B2B eCommerce Consultant Founder
description:
Urgent Hiring: Virtual Executive Assistant — Executive Support for B2B eCommerce Consultant Founder (FEMALE)



Job Code: AJH-VEA01

Location: Remote

Type: Part-Time (4 hours per day, Monday to Friday)

Schedule: U.S. Morning Hours (Pacific Time) — 7:00 AM – 11:00 AM (PT) | 10:00 PM – 2:00 AM (Manila time)



Monthly Rate: $560 / $7 per hour



About the Role:

We are seeking a proactive, detail-oriented Virtual Executive Assistant to support a seasoned B2B eCommerce consultant and founder.

This is a high-trust, high-impact role focused on helping the founder stay organized, maintain follow-up discipline, and bring structure to daily operations.

We are looking for someone who can think ahead, learn quickly, and operate comfortably in a fast-moving, founder-led environment.



Key Responsibilities:



1. Inbox & Communication Management

 • Monitor and triage multiple inboxes

 • Flag priority messages

 • Draft professional replies

 • Maintain follow-up discipline so nothing slips



2. Calendar & Meeting Coordination

 • Manage calendar flow and scheduling

 • Protect focus time

 • Coordinate meetings across time zones

 • Prepare basic meeting briefs when needed



3. HubSpot & Pipeline Support

 • Maintain contact and deal hygiene

 • Log activities consistently

 • Help maintain consistency in lead flow



4. Follow-Up & Execution Support

 • Track action items fro
etings

 • Nudge stakeholders when needed

 • Maintain simple task visibility



5. Research & Briefing Support

 • Conduct B2B research

 • Prepare short summaries or briefs



Minimum Qualifications:

 • Minimum 2 years experience supporting founders or executives

 • Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or related field preferred

 • Excellent English communication (C2 level required)

 • Strong organizational and follow-through skills

 • Experience with inbox and calendar management

 • Comfortable learning new tools and systems quickly

 • High level of professionalism and discretion



Preferred Experience

 • HubSpot or CRM experience

 • Experience supporting consultants or B2B teams

 • Sales Navigator familiarity (a plus)

 • Strong AI tool familiarity (ChatGPT or similar)



Required Skills

 • Strong written business communication

 • Excellent attention to detail

 • Calendar and inbox management

 • Task tracking and follow-through

 • Research and information synthesis

 • Tech comfortable and systems oriented



Key Traits We Value

 • Fast learner with high curiosity

 • Proactive communicator

 • Systems thinker

 • Highly reliable and responsive



Tech Requirements

 • Minimum 8GB RAM (16GB preferred)

 • Intel i5 10th gen or newer (or equivalent Ryzen)

 • Reliable high-speed internet

 • Backup internet and power bank strongly preferred

 • Noise-cancelling headset preferred

 • Stable internet and quiet work environment required



What We Offer

 • Long-term, stable client placement

 • Ongoing coaching and support from Vera Outsourcing

 • Structured onboarding and guidance

 • Supportive and professional team environment

 • Potential to transition to full-time as the business grows



How to Apply:

If you meet the qualifications, please submit:

 • Updated resume

 • 1-minute introduction video



Send to: 

Application Deadline: Wednesday, March 4, 2026



Subject line:

Virtual Executive Assistant for B2B eCommerce Consultant Founder — Job Code: AJH-VEA01



Why Join Vera Outsourcing:



At Vera Outsourcing, you are not just another assistant, you become part of a high-caliber team supporting serious founders doing meaningful work.



We invest in our VEAs through structured onboarding, ongoing coaching, and real growth opportunities so you can sharpen your skills and build a long-term career in executive support.



If you are someone who takes ownership, thinks ahead, and wants to grow alongside high-performing leaders, we would love to meet you!



*Due to the volume of applications, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Thank you sincerely for your time and interest in joining Vera Outsourcing.



VERA OUTSOURCING

title: Salesforce Developer/Administrator
description:
About Us:

Codeless Platforms (
) is a dynamic and growing organization committed to delivering innovative solutions to our clients. We are seeking a talented and experienced Salesforce Developer/Administrator to join our team and help us leverage the full potential of the Salesforce platform. This role will play a key part in optimizing our Salesforce environment, ensuring seamless integration with other systems, and supporting our Sales and Service Cloud operations.

Job Description:



As a Salesforce Developer/Administrator, you will be responsible for the ongoing development, administration, and optimization of our Salesforce platform. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, design, and implement custom solutions, and ensure our Salesforce environment supports our business objectives. Your role will include managing system integrations, automating processes, and providing technical support to end-users.

Key Responsibilities:

Salesforce Development:

o Design, develop, test, and deploy custom Salesforce solutions using Apex, Visualforce, Lightning components, and other Salesforce technologies.

o Create and maintain custom objects, workflows, validation rules, triggers, and dashboards.

o Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and analyze requirements, and translate them into technical specifications.



Salesforce Administration:

o Manage day-to-day Salesforce administration tasks, including user management, security settings, data backups, and system maintenance.

o Customize and configure Sales and Service Cloud to meet business needs, including setting up reports, dashboards, and automated processes.

o Ensure data integrity and perform regular data hygiene tasks, such as deduplication and data cleansing.

o Provide technical support to end-users, resolving issues related to Salesforce functionality and performance.

o Conduct training sessions and create documentation to empower users and promote best practices in Salesforce usage.

o Proactively identify opportunities for system improvements and process optimization.

 

System Integration:

o Previous experience in designing and implement integrations between Salesforce and other business systems, ensuring seamless data flow and process automation.

o Experience in  REST/SOAP APIs, and third-party applications to enable system integrations.

o Troubleshoot and resolve integration issues, working closely with IT and external vendors as needed.



Essential Skills and Qualifications:

Experience:

o 3+ years of experience as a Salesforce Developer/Administrator.

o Proven experience with Salesforce Sales Cloud and Service Cloud.

o Strong understanding of Salesforce platform features, including Apex, Visualforce, Lightning components, and declarative tools.

o Experience with integrating Salesforce with other systems using REST/SOAP APIs. 

Technical Skills:

o Proficiency in Salesforce development and customization (Apex, Visualforce, Lightning).

o Strong understanding of Salesforce data model, security, and access management.

o Experience with Salesforce integrations and data migration.

Analytical Skills:

o Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to analyze complex requirements and propose effective solutions.

o Excellent attention to detail and ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.

• Communication Skills:

o Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to interact effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders.

o Ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions and clearly communicate progress and challenges.



Education and Certifications:

• Educated to degree level in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.

• Salesforce Administrator Certification (required).

• Salesforce Platform Developer I or II Certification (preferred).

• Salesforce Service Cloud Consultant Certification (preferred).

title: Purchasing Manager
description:
About Us:

House of Cameras is an award winning UK based e-commerce business specialising in buying, refurbishing and selling used cameras, lenses, and photographic accessories. We are expanding our operations and looking for a long-term Purchasing Manager to join our team.



Our Store: www. houseofcameras. com

About me, the founder: www. linkedin. com /in/lucas-cannon (please do not contact outside of onlinejobs.ph)



This role is ideal for someone methodical, reliable, and comfortable with repetitive but important daily research and sourcing tasks. You will play a key part in how we source inventory and maintain our reputation for quality and value for money.





Responsibilities:

- Research used camera equipment across various online marketplaces (eBay, Yahoo Japan, etc.)

- Analyse the UK second-hand market to set accurate product pricing and set bidding limits.

- Place bids on auctions and track performance against sourcing goals.

- Update records, spreadsheets, and sourcing databases with high accuracy.

- Support additional administrative, research and other tasks as assigned.





Requirements:

- Fluent/advanced written and spoken English proficiency (essential)

- Consistent, high-speed internet connection and dependable computer setup

- Comfortable working independently from home

- Reliable, loyal, and committed to long-term employment

- Great attention to detail and accuracy

- Willingness to ask questions

- Fast learner, able to follow systems and procedures efficiently

- Must not be employed by multiple companies or actively work for other companies, clients or projects.





Bonus (not required but advantageous):

- Good understanding of Microsoft Excel

- Knowledge of cameras, lenses, or used markets

- Transferable skills such as web design, graphic design, or any other skills that could help a business like mine succeed.





Working Hours & Compensation

- Full-time, work from home remote position (40 hours per week)

- Relatively flexible working hours

- $1125 USD / PHP 65k per month pay





How to Apply

Please provide a resume, relevant work experience or education and why you think you’d be a great fit for House of Cameras. Please include “HOC” in the title of your application so we know you’ve read the description. I look forward to reading your application

title: AI Content Creator
description:
We are hiring an AI Content Creator to join our team part-time (20h/week), with strong potential to scale to full-time based on performance and output volume.



Our brands operate in the emotional gifting and premiu
n's transformation niches, and are expanding rapidly across the U.S., U.K., Australia, and European markets.



Your role: leverage cutting-edge AI tools (Nano Banana Pro, Higgsfield, Midjourney, Runway, Kling, Flux, ElevenLabs, and emerging platforms) to produce high-quality visual content for our Meta and TikTok ad campaigns, including static images, B-roll video, product visuals, and lifestyle scenes. Your goal is to generate ad-ready assets that look and feel indistinguishable from traditional production, at scale and speed.



You will be responsible for:



- Producing a consistent flow of AI-generated creative assets (images, video B-roll, visual concepts) aligned with our brand universes

- Mastering and refining prompt engineering to deliver ultra-authentic outputs, no generic "AI look"

- Building and maintaining prompt libraries and visual style guides for each brand

- Integrating AI-generated content into our existing ad creative pipeline alongside editors and creative strategists

- Conducting ongoing research and testing of new AI tools, workflows, and techniques, staying ahead of the curve is part of the job

- Delivering a monthly summary of tools tested, results, and creative opportunities



We are looking for someone who:



- Has hands-on experience with AI image and video generation tools (Nano Banana Pro, Gemini, Midjourney, Runway, Kling, Stable Diffusion, Flux, or similar)

- Has a strong visual eye, you understand composition, lighting, color grading, and what makes an ad scroll-stopping

- Adapts fast, you're already experimenting with new tools before anyone tells you to

- Is detail-oriented and quality-obsessed, you'd rather redo something 10 times than ship something that looks "AI-generated"

- Understands direct-response advertising and what makes a visual convert (not just look pretty)

- Can work autonomously, manage their own workflow, and hit deadlines consistently



Nice to have:



- Experience with post-production / retouching to refine AI outputs

- Familiarity with Meta and TikTok ad formats and specs

- Background in e-commerce or DTC brands

- Experience with AI voice-over tools (ElevenLabs, etc.)



What we offer:



- A dedicated budget for AI tools and subscriptions

- Access to ongoing training and resources to develop your skills

- Time allocated specifically for R&D and experimentation with new tools

- Growth opportunities, both in scope and compensation as we scale

- A fast-moving, results-driven environment where your work directly impacts revenue



---



???? Please fill out this form carefully: 



If your profile matches what we're looking for, we will contact you shortly to explain the next steps of the hiring process.

title: Accounts Assistant
description:
Accounts Assistant

Reports to: Accounts and Operation



About Us

We are a multinational skin and hair care company headquartered in Sydney, Australia, supplying products to more than 20 countries—and expanding rapidly. We are a growing skincare company specialising in functional, science-driven skincare products promoted through dermatologists and skin clinics.



About the Role

We are looking for a detail-oriented and proactive Accounts Assistant & Customer Service specialist to join our remote team. You will work closely with our Finance and Operations team, supporting day-to-day bookkeeping, data entry, sales reporting, and customer service tasks. This is an excellent opportunity for someone who enjoys working across multiple systems and wants to grow their skills in accounting and e-commerce operations.



Duties & Responsibilities



Bookkeeping & Accounts Payable

• Process supplier bills and invoices in Reckon

• Create and maintain due date payment schedules

• Set up and process payments via CommBiz and credit cards

• Reconcile multiple bank and payment accounts including CBA (AUD/USD), PayPal (AUD/USD), Amazon (AUD/USD), Afterpay, MyDeal, Shopify, World First, and others

• Assist with BAS preparation for multiple entities

• Reconcile Profit & Loss and Balance Sheet statements



Payroll

• Process payroll for Australian and Philippines-based staff

• Manage superannuation payments and STP lodgments

• Prepare and distribute payslips

• Process international payments via Wise



Ostendo & Order Management

• Set up new customers and enter Shopify, Amazon, and distributor orders into Ostendo

• Verify invoices for correct GST treatment (GST, GST-free, or export)

• Enter and process accounts payable for supplier bills

• Generate reports and data extracts from Ostendo as required



Sales & Distribution Reporting

• Compile and maintain distributor sales reports

• Prepare stock and sales reports for management review

• Support the sales team with data analysis and ad hoc reporting



Customer Service & Administration

• Handle customer enquiries via Amazon and direct channels

• Coordinate courier bookings for documents and product samples to international destinations

• Carry out various administrative and ad hoc tasks as assigned



Required Skills & Abilities

• Strong bookkeeping and data entry skills with high attention to detail

• Proficiency in accounting software (Reckon, MYOB, or similar)

• Experience reconciling multiple bank accounts and payment platforms

• Solid understanding of GST, payroll processes, and BAS requirements

• Comfortable working with spreadsheets and generating reports

• Clear written communication skills in English for customer-facing tasks

• Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines independently



Preferred Qualifications

• Experience with Ostendo ERP system

• Background in e-commerce account management (Amazon, Shopify, or similar platforms)

• Familiarity with Australian payroll legislation and STP reporting

• Experience working with international payments (Wise, PayPal, World First)

• Prior experience in a similar remote role supporting an Australian business



Candidate Criteria

• Full-time (40 hours/week), remote.

• Must be able to work AEST office hours.

• Minimum 3 years of relevant experience similar accounts or bookkeeping role

• Highly organised, self-driven, and effective in a remote-working environment.

• Ability to work effectively across multiple time zones, collaborating with global stakeholders, partners, and teams.



How to Apply



To apply, please send the following: (Non-negotiable requirements)



• Your updated RESUME/CV LINK

• A brief cover letter explaining your experience with bookkeeping, customer service and any accounting software you have used

• Your availability to join the company



We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Operations Manager
description:
Operations Manager 



*** Please include your resume with the number 1901 as the subject header, along with outlining your relevant experience and qualifications to be considered for an interview. *** 



 



About the Role 



We are hiring an Operations Manager to lead execution and scale business & technology solutions at PTOE Global Solutions, a fast-growing solutions company helping entrepreneurs and businesses run and scale with clarity, structure, and systems. 



This is not a corporate role. 



This is for a builder and operator who wants to take ownership of execution and help scale a global, remote-first business. 



You will work directly with the founder (Chief Stewardship Officer) to turn vision into systems, structure, and measurable results. 



 



Core Mission 



Build and operate scalable solutions that support global clients with excellence. 



   



What You’ll Be Responsible For 



Operations & Delivery 



-Own end-to-end client delivery (coaching, consulting, managed services) 

-Build scalable service delivery systems 

-Ensure consistent, high-quality execution 



 



Systems & Process

mbers   



Who You Are 



5–10+ years in operations, technology businesses, or leadership roles

-Strong systems thinker (you think in workflows, not tasks) 

-Proven ability to build structure in fast-moving environments

What Makes You a Great Fit

 Location

Compensation 



-Competitive (based on experience) 



  



Why Join

-Take full ownership of operations 

-Build systems that impact businesses worldwide 



   



How to Apply 



Please apply with:

*** Important: Please include 1901 in the subject line of your
 and outline your relevant experience and qualifications to be considered for an interview.***

title: Customer Support Performance Lead
description:
Remote | Full-Time | Healthcare Telehealth Business



About the Role



We are seeking a structured and performance-focused Customer Support Lead to oversee the daily performance, quality standards, and KPI management of our customer support team.

This is not a general admin role.

This is a hands-on performance leadership role.



You will be responsible for ensuring that:



• Calls are handled professionally and efficiently

• Sales opportunities are maximised

• Satisfaction targets are achieved

• Quality standards are maintained

• Coaching and feedback loops are consistent



This role reports directly to the CEO.



Core Responsibilities

1. Performance & KPI Ownership

• Own weekly and monthly CS KPI reporting

• Track call volumes, conversion rates, response times and satisfaction scores

• Identify trends and performance gaps

• Present structured performance summaries to leadership



2. Quality Assurance & Call Coaching



• Review recorded calls using AI tool

• Score calls against a defined QA framework

• Provide structured coaching feedback to tea
mbers

• Identify training needs and recurring skill gaps

• Maintain a coaching cadence (1:1 sessions weekly)



3. Escalations & Service Standards



• Oversee complaint handling and ensure professional resolution

• Ensure service tone, communication standards and documentation quality are maintained

• Monitor adherence to scripts, FAQ's, Product training, policies and workflows



4. Process Discipline



• Ensure IVR workflows and support processes are followed

• Work closely with Admin to flag operational friction points

• Recommend small process improvements where needed

Keep SOP's up to date



Leadership Expectations



• Provide calm, structured leadership

• Hold tea
mbers accountable respectfully

• Maintain high communication standards (phone &
)

• Be visible and consistent with feedback

• Model professionalism and composure



This role requires someone comfortable guiding offshore teams and maintaining standards without micromanaging.



Experience Required

• 3+ years in Customer Support leadership or performance management

• Experience managing KPIs and QA frameworks

• Experience coaching sales or support teams

• Comfortable reviewing recorded calls and providing structured feedback

• Strong written and spoken English (neutral, clear communication essential)

• Experience with CRM systems and call platforms 



Healthcare experience is a bonus, not essential.



Who You Are

• Structured and analytical

• Emotionally steady

• Direct but respectful

• Comfortable with metrics

• Not reactive or defensive

• Strong on accountability



To apply



Pleas send you CV

Short 2-3 minute video on why you think the role fits well for you

Internet speed and conform private, quiet place to work from.

title: GoHighLevel & Marketing Automation Specialist
description:
We are looking for a highly experienced Automation & GoHighLevel (GHL) Specialist with a proven track record of success in building and managing advanced marketing automation systems for fast-paced businesses.



You will be supporting a legal services firm, so experience working in a professional services or lead-driven environment is a plus. You will be handling sensitive client intake data and workflows, so reliability and discretion are essential.



This is not an entry-level role. We require someone who can hit the ground running and deliver results from day one.



Automation Requirements:

- Proven hands-on experience with Pabbly Connect, Zapier, Make (Integromat), and N8N

- Demonstrated ability to design, build, and troubleshoot complex multi-step automation workflows

- Strong understanding of webhooks, APIs, and data mapping

- Familiarity with form builders such as WPForms or Fluent Forms (WordPress-based) is a plus

- Experience integrating with
 platforms such as Brevo or Vbout is advantageous

- Comfortable working with Google Sheets for data handling and reporting outputs

- Track record of successfully automating business processes that drive measurable outcomes



GoHighLevel (GHL) Requirements:

- Full GHL admin experience is essential

- Expert-level knowledge of GHL workflows, pipelines, and automation triggers

- Proven experience with GHL
 marketing, campaigns, and contact management

- Experience with GHL sub-accounts, snapshots, and funnel/landing page management

- Ability to configure and manage GHL forms, calendars, and reporting

- Experience using GHL for client lead intake and nurturing pipelines is highly regarded



What We're Looking For:

- Self-starter who takes initiative and requires minimal supervision

- Strong problem-solving skills with attention to detail

- Excellent communication skills and ability to document processes clearly

- Portfolio or examples of past automation/GHL work highly regarded



If you have the experience and the results to back it up, we want to hear from you.

title: Sr. eCommerce Associate – CS & Ops
description:
About iRESTORE Laser

At iRESTORE, our mission is to restore confidence by providing safe and effective solutions for improving health and beauty. We are at an inflection point in our growth curve and are searching for a Senior Amazon Customer Service and Operations Associate to join us on our journey to become a major global beauty brand.



About The Position

We are seeking a motivated and customer-focused individual to join our team as a Senior Amazon Customer Service and Operations Associate. In this role, you will not only manage customer inquiries and reviews but also own the strategy, process improvements, and team guidance that drive customer satisfaction and operational excellence. You will work cross-functionally with marketing, operations, and product teams to ensure that iRestore delivers world-class customer experiences across Amazon and beyond.



What you’ll do:

Customer Experience Leadership: Oversee Amazon customer service operations with an emphasis on scalable processes, automation, and efficiency improvements.

Escalation & Complex Case Handling: Take ownership of high-stakes or escalated cases, providing expert judgment to resolve sensitive issues and protect brand reputation.

Review Strategy & Reputation Management: Develop and execute a comprehensive review management strategy (beyond day-to-day outreach), including proactive engagement, sentiment

analysis, and long-term reputation building on Amazon and other platforms.

Negative Feedback Mitigation: Lead initiatives to systematically reduce negative feedback, collaborating with product, quality, and operations teams to address root causes.

Amazon Policy & Compliance Oversight: Stay current with Amazon policy updates and enforce compliance in review management, return handling, and competitor takedown strategies.

Team Guidance & Training: Mentor junior tea
mbers (e.g., CS associates), provide SOPs, and implement training to elevate the team’s capabilities.

Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner with marketing, product, and operations teams to align customer insights with business decisions, contributing to strategy beyond customer service.

Reporting & Insights: Build advanced dashboards and trackers to measure CSAT, review velocity, return reasons, and operational KPIs. Present insights regularly to leadership.

Competitor Takedown: Identify and report competitors using black hat techniques in the hair growth device and LED face mask device categories through Amazon support cases, ensuring fair competition in the Best Sellers Rank (BSR).



The ideal candidate has:

Experience with Amazon Seller Central, Gorgias, Google Suite, or similar customer service platforms.

Strong organizational skills with the ability to handle multiple tasks and maintain accurate records.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

A proactive, customer-first mindset focused on resolution and creating positive experiences.

Experience with review management and case submission processes.

Prior experience in e-commerce operations or customer service roles preferred



Our Core Values and what we built our culture around:

WE THINK BIG: We have a forward-thinking, growth mindset and always consider the big picture in our decisions

PROACTIVE PROBLEM SOLVER: We use our problem-solving and analytical skills to make data-informed decisions

WE ARE COMFORTABLE BEING UNCOMFORTABLE: We work together to iron out improvements or changes to achieve goals

OPEN & HONEST COMMUNICATION/FEEDBACK: We communicate and share feedback with each other with radical candor and transparency

CONTINUOUS LEARNING & IMPROVEMENT: We are always improving the way we work and challenging each other to bring new ways of thinking to the table

 PASSIONATE ABOUT WHAT WE DO: We strive to motivate and empower each other to contribute to a positive team culture



Competitive Compensation and Benefits:

Medical and dental benefits after 6 months of tenure

Paid Time Off (PTO) for all full-time tea
mbers

High growth trajectory with quarterly/annual reviews

Quarterly Internet Reimbursement

Gy
mbership credit – your physical and mental health is super important

Work from anywhere - this is a remote opportunity

Annual Team Bonding Event



To apply, please submit your application through our official careers page:





Kindly note: Only applications submitted via our career website will be considered.

title: CPA
description:
Small company looking for someone with accounting knowledge to do our books daily and also act as an administrative assistant by doing
s and other tasks as assigned. Position will be part time to start with full time available for the right candidate





Overview



We are seeking a highly organized, detail-oriented, and experienced Certified Public Accountant (CPA) based in the Philippines to manage the full accounting cycle for three small, growing businesses . This role is critical and requires proficiency in US accounting standards and compliance.



Key Requirements and Qualifications



Education/Certification:



Required: Bachelor of Science in Accountancy (BSA) and a valid Philippine CPA license.



Highly Preferred: Current or previous pursuit of the US CPA or Certified Management Accountant (CMA) credentials.



Experience:



Minimum of 3-5 years of professional accounting or bookkeeping experience working primarily with US-based small businesses (SMEs).



Proven experience managing financial records for multiple clients/businesses simultaneously.



Technical Expertise (Hard Skills):



Expert Proficiency in Accounting Software: Mastery of QuickBooks Online (QBO) is mandatory. Experience with Xero or other cloud-based platforms is a plus.



Advanced Data Skills: Expert level use of Microsoft Excel and Google Sheets for financial modeling, budgeting, and variance analysis.



US Tax Knowledge: Solid understanding of fundamental US GAAP and experience with basic US tax preparation/documentation (e.g., preparing records for 1099s, gathering data for corporate/LLC tax filings).



Payroll & Compliance: Direct experience processing or supporting US payroll (e.g., via Gusto, ADP) and managing sales tax compliance across various US states.



Core Responsibilities



The successful candidate will be responsible for all daily, monthly, and quarterly financial operations for all entities:



1. Full-Cycle Bookkeeping & Reporting



Perform timely and accurate monthly and quarterly financial closes.



Conduct daily bank and credit card reconciliations for all accounts.



Manage Accounts Payable (AP) and Accounts Receivable (AR).



Generate accurate Financial Statements (Income Statement, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow) and executive summaries.



2. Financial Analysis & Strategy



Develop and monitor annual budgets and cash flow forecasts.



Analyze financial data to identify trends, cost-saving opportunities, and key performance indicators (KPIs) relevant to small business growth.



Provide proactive financial advice and strategic recommendations to the business owner.



3. Compliance & Administration



Ensure all transactions comply with US GAAP.



Organize and prepare all necessary documentation for annual tax filings (coordinating with the US CPA firm).



Maintain a clear and organized digital filing system for all financial records.



Essential Soft Skills and Remote Work Attributes



Exceptional English Communication: Must possess excellent written and verbal English skills. Ability to clearly articulate complex financial matters to non-financial stakeholders is crucial.



Time Management & Autonomy: Must be a highly organized, self-starter capable of meeting deadlines and managing the competing priorities of multiple small businesses without constant supervision.



High Integrity: Absolute trustworthiness and a commitment to professional ethics when handling sensitive financial data.



Reliable Remote Setup: Must have a dedicated, professional workspace, a reliable high-speed internet connection, and the necessary hardware/software for secure remote work.

title: Finance Specialist with QuickBooks Expertise #4883
description:
Are you organized, reliable, and ready to work directly with US-based operations while leveraging your financial background? If so, we want to meet you!



About Us:

We connect talented Virtual Assistants like you with meaningful, long-term opportunities where you can make an impact and grow your career. Our community values professional development, collaboration, and empowering each VA to thrive in their role. When you join us, you’re not just landing a job—you’re becoming part of a supportive network that’s invested in your success.



Job Description:

We are looking for a Virtual Assistant with strong financial, administrative, and operational skills to support a US-based business. The ideal candidate will excel at managing payroll, budgets, and accounts while also tackling inbox management, research, and special projects. This role is perfect for someone who loves organizing chaos, finding solutions, and thinking outside the box.



Key Responsibilities:

Manage bi-weekly payroll using Gusto.

Oversee Accounts Receivable & Payable, sending payment reminders and follow-ups, and keeping QuickBooks updated.

File royalties monthly and quarterly using provided dashboards.

Manage and filter the executive’s inbox, ensuring only relevant
s reach them.

Create and maintain a weekly cash flow report.

Review and manage credit card statements for discrepancies and erroneous charges.

Build budgets and set financial quotas.

Research and find the best travel deals, arranging travel via points or cash.

Take on ad hoc projects to reduce the executive’s workload.

Draft and write proposals as needed.

Utilize AI tools like ChatGPT to improve writing efficiency.



Qualifications:

Proven experience as a Virtual Assistant or similar role, with a focus on finance, accounting, or operations.

Strong financial skills, including budgeting and cash flow management.

Excellent written English communication skills (should be able to match or mimic the executive’s voice when writing).

Experience using QuickBooks and Gusto.

Highly organized, reliable, and solutions-oriented.

Ability to think creatively and find efficient solutions to challenges.

Comfortable working in US hours and making calls to US numbers.

Tech-savvy and able to quickly learn and use new tools, including AI tools like ChatGPT.



Tools You Will Use:

QuickBooks

Gusto

Excel (for budgeting)

 Management Systems

ChatGPT (to assist with writing tasks)

Basecamp

Google Drive

Royalty reporting dashboard



Working Hours:

Part-time: Morning shift (8 AM - 12 PM MT or 1 PM - 5 PM MT)



Preferred Traits:

Proactive and takes ownership of tasks without constant oversight.

Detail-oriented and highly organized.

Excellent problem-solving skills.

Sharp, professional written and verbal English communication.

Ability to quickly adapt and learn new processes.

Strong finance background with a focus on accuracy.



Non-Negotiables:

Screenshot and productivity tracker required.



Benefits:

Work-from-home opportunity.

Access to training resources.

Collaborate with an excellent community of VAs.

Weekly payment.



How to Apply:

If you’re ready to be part of a dynamic and supportive community while working with an innovative client, we’d love to hear from you!

Also, please answer the following questions to help us determine if you’re a good fit for the role:

Do you have good communication skills?

Are you a certified QuickBooks expert?

Are you creative in writing?

Are you familiar with the tools?



Why Join Us?

We believe in helping Virtual Assistants grow both personally and professionally. We provide ongoing support, training, and a collaborative environment where your voice matters. Be part of a team that values your skills and helps you thrive!

.

title: Australian GST Bookkeeper – Xero Reconciliation Project (Partnership + Company)
description:
I'm an Australian business owner looking for an experienced Xero bookkeeper with strong knowledge of the Australian tax system to reconcile 18 months of transactions across two separate entities — a partnership (tied to a personal ABN) and a Pty Ltd company. Both entities are GST registered and operate in professional services.

This is a project-based role with a clear path to regular ongoing work if you do a great job.



The Scope

The company generates roughly 5–10 transactions per day. The partnership generates 1–3 per day. Neither entity has been reconciled — we're starting from scratch across approximately 18 months. In total you're likely looking at 3,000–5,000+ transactions across both files.

Your job is to get both Xero files clean, correctly categorised, and ready for my BAS agent to review and lodge. You do not need to lodge anything yourself.



Specifically you will:



Reconcile all bank transactions across both Xero entities from the start

Categorise expenses to the correct accounts using the right Australian chart of accounts

Apply correct GST tax codes (GST, GST-free, BAS excluded, input-taxed) to all transactions

Proactively identify and flag legitimate business expenses that can be claimed — I want to make sure nothing is missed

Flag any transactions you're unsure about so I can clarify — I'm available for questions throughout

Deliver both files in a state where my BAS agent can go straight to lodgement without cleaning up behind you



What I'm Looking For



Minimum 3 years experience bookkeeping for Australian clients or working within an Australian accounting firm or BPO

Deep understanding of Australian GST — not just how to apply codes, but knowing what's claimable and what isn't for a professional services business

Xero proficient — bank reconciliation, tax codes, chart of accounts, and working across multiple separate organisations

Someone who works independently but communicates clearly when they have questions

Detail-oriented — I'd rather you ask than guess



Screening Question — Required

Applications without this will not be considered.

In your own words, explain: what is GST, how does it apply to a registered Australian business, and what is a BAS? Also briefly describe how you would approach reconciling a Xero file that has had no reconciliation done from the start.



To Apply Include:



Your CV with specific Australian clients or firms you've worked with

Your answer to the screening question above

Your proposed project rate (fixed fee preferred, or hourly with an estimated total)

Your availability and how quickly you could start





What Happens After You Apply

Shortlisted candidates will be given a small paid test task — approximately 20–30 sample transactions to categorise. This is paid and takes around 30–60 minutes. It's the fastest way for both of us to know if it's a good fit before committing to the full project.

Strong performers on this project will be offered regular ongoing bookkeeping work.

description:

title: Assistant Deal Execution Manager
description:
We help US citizens acquire profitable, cash-flowing businesses. We’re rapidly growing and always looking for high-performing operators to support our deal pipeline.



As an Assistant Deal Execution  Manager, you’ll oversee deal structuring, review Letters of Intent, and ensure deals are execution-ready. You’ll be the senior checkpoint in the process, ensuring structures are sound, risks are addressed, and transactions move smoothly from model to signed LOI.



At our firm, we hold ourselves to high standards of precision, clarity, and fast execution. Our core values, Team-First Performance, Perfect Professionalism, and Mastery Through Feedback, shape how we work and how we interact with partners, analysts, and lenders. As a Deal Execution Assistant Manager, you’ll reflect these values by reviewing work thoroughly, guiding your team, and ensuring every deal is structured to close.



This role is about more than reviewing numbers, it’s about making deals happen. If you’re driven to build transactions that fund and close, mentor others, and have a direct impact on the business, we’d love to see what you can bring to the team.



About the Role

We are looking for an Assistant Deal Execution Manager to lead deal execution and closing oversight across a high-volume acquisition pipeline. You’ll approve deal structures, manage LOI execution, ensure packages are lender-ready and deals are successfully closed.



Targets & Performance

-Ensure all deal structures meet DSCR, lender, and buyer requirements

-Approve LOIs before submission with accurate, enforceable terms

-Maintain speed and accuracy in deal execution across the pipeline

-Mentor analysts and ensure quality control across models and offers

-Identify and mitigate risks before deals move forward

-Keep deal tracking systems up-to-date and organized





Key Responsibilities

-Review and approve acquisition structures created by analysts (SBA, seller notes, equity rolls, earnouts)

-Approve and redline LOIs to reflect clean, enforceable terms

-Oversee LOI video walkthroughs and ensure clarity of deal logic

-Review SOPs and KPIs ensuring targets are met, risks are mitigated and issues are solved

-Conduct senior-level review of financials, assumptions, and risk flags

-Collaborate with the deal team, partners, and lenders to ensure deals are fully execution-ready

-Mentor and guide analysts on deal structuring and execution

-Continuously improve deal processes to accelerate closing rates



Qualifications

-2+  years in M&A, private equity, corporate development, or transaction advisory

-Strong financial modeling and deal structuring skills

-Experience with SBA lending, seller financing, and LOI terms

-Familiarity with deal execution processes, lender requirements, and DSCR mechanics

-Experience mentoring junior deal tea
mbers



Nice to Have

-Background in investment banking, Big 4, PE, or SMB acquisitions

-Familiarity with high-volume deal pipelines

-Experience with tools like Notion, Slack, Google Sheets

-Fast-paced, remote work experience



Why Join Us

-Fully remote work setup

-Collaborative and supportive team environment

-Opportunity to grow with a rapidly scaling organization

-Direct impact on deals that close and drive business growth



If you’re passionate about making deals happen and enjoy working in a dynamic environment, we would love to hear from you.

title: Deal Structuring Analyst
description:
We help Americans unlock wealth and free themselves from the corporate day-to-day grind through acquisition. As a rapidly growing firm, we're looking for a Deal Analyst to join our lean, remote team.



This role is critical in ensuring the smooth and efficient execution of deals after an LOI has been signed. You'll serve as the key facilitator between all stakeholders—our buying partners, brokers, lenders, due diligence providers, and internal teams—to push deals forward from LOI to Closing.



What You'll Do

-Own the deal execution process – Ensure all aspects of a deal move smoothly, keeping communication clear and documentation precise.

-Support LOI Stage – Support in collecting, preparing, and reviewing key deal documents such as LOIs, IOIs, and financial models.

-Ensure process adherence – Follow and enforce Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) to maintain efficiency and accuracy in deal execution.

-Support deal closing – Work alongside the Deal Execution Manager to drive deals through lender approvals, underwriting, purchase agreements, and closing.



You Must Have

-Experience managing M&A transactions or working in a deal execution role (Investment Banking, PE, M&A, Lending, etc.).

-Strong ability to organize and track multiple deals simultaneously.

-Excellent written and verbal communication skills for managing stakeholders.

-A problem-solving mindset and ability to troubleshoot bottlenecks in deal flow.

-Ability to work independently in a remote, fast-paced environment.



You Should Have

-2+ years of experience in a relevant role (M&A, investment banking, accounting, private equity, lending, etc.).

-Familiarity with SBA lending, deal structuring, or financial modeling.

-Excellent verbal and written skills

-A self-starter mindset—always looking to improve efficiency and processes.

-Excellent attention to detail and quality control in documentation.



What We Offer

-A critical role in a fast-growing firm with career growth potential.

-The opportunity to take part in equity and profit sharing as we scale.

-Work remotely from anywhere.



If you’re looking for a dynamic, high-impact role in M&A, we’d love to chat. Apply today!

 and Slack reviews to ensure no communication gaps.

s to ensure response times meet SLAs:

s to confirm required follow-ups are completed.

title: Loan Processor / Junior Underwriter (Real Estate Lending)
description:
Location: Remote (U.S.-based preferred)

Schedule: Monday–Friday | 9:00am–5:00pm EST

Company: Alpha Capital Lending



About Alpha Capital Lending



Alpha Capital Lending is a fast-growing real estate lending platform providing financing solutions to real estate investors nationwide. We specialize in DSCR loans, bridge loans, fix-and-flip financing, and rental property loans for experienced investors.



Our mission is to build a best-in-class lending operation where originators focus on relationships and growth — and execution is handled with precision, speed, and professionalism.



?



Role Overview



We are hiring a Loan Processor / Junior Underwriter to manage loans from initial quote through closing. This role is critical to our ability to scale.



You will act as the operational backbone of the lending team — owning document collection, underwriting preparation, lender submissions, and closing coordination — allowing loan originators to focus exclusively on originating new business.



This is a high-accountability, high-impact role ideal for someone who thrives in a fast-paced lending environment and takes pride in clean execution.



?



Key Responsibilities



Loan Processing & Deal Management

    •    Manage loans end-to-end from initial quote through closing

    •    Collect, organize, and review borrower and property documentation

    •    Maintain complete, accurate, and lender-ready loan files

    •    Proactively follow up with borrowers to ensure timely document delivery



Underwriting & Deal Packaging

    •    Assist with underwriting analysis (DSCR, LTV, LTC, rents, rehab, exit strategy)

    •    Prepare professional loan summaries, sources & uses, and deal narratives

    •    Ensure all submissions meet lender guidelines and requirements



Lender Submissions & Capital Markets Coordination

    •    Submit loan packages to multiple lender partners on behalf of originators

    •    Track and compare loan terms, conditions, fees, and timelines

    •    Act as the primary point of contact with lenders during underwriting

    •    Manage lender questions, conditions, and follow-ups



Closing & Transaction Coordination

    •    Order appraisals and third-party reports

    •    Coordinate with title companies, attorneys, insurance providers, and lenders

    •    Track conditions and deadlines through closing

    •    Schedule closings and ensure smooth execution to funding



Systems & Process Management

    •    Update CRM and internal systems with accurate deal status

    •    Maintain internal checklists and pipelines

    •    Continuously improve internal processes and documentation workflows



?



What Success Looks Like in This Role

    •    Loan files are clean, complete, and submitted correctly the first time

    •    Lenders respond quickly due to high-quality submissions

    •    Closings happen on time with minimal friction

    •    Originators spend zero time on processing, underwriting, or admin work



?



Qualifications



Required

    •    2+ years experience in loan processing, underwriting, or real estate lending operations

    •    Experience with DSCR, bridge, fix-and-flip, or investment property loans

    •    Strong understanding of loan documentation and underwriting fundamentals

    •    Exceptional organization, follow-up, and attention to detail

    •    Ability to manage multiple deals simultaneously

    •    Comfortable working directly with lenders and borrowers



Preferred

    •    Experience submitting loans to multiple lender relationships

    •    Background in commercial or non-QM lending

    •    Experience working in a high-volume lending environment

    •    Familiarity with CRMs and loan tracking systems



?



Compensation & Growth

    •    Competitive base salary (based on experience)

    •    Performance-based bonuses tied to closings and execution quality

    •    Long-term growth opportunity as Alpha Capital Lending scales

    •    Potential to grow into Senior Processor or Underwriting Manager role



?



Why Join Alpha Capital Lending

    •    Remote role with clear expectations and accountability

    •    Fast-growing platform with strong deal flow

    •    Direct impact on company growth and scalability

    •    High-performance culture focused on execution and results



?



How to Apply



Submit your resume along with a brief explanation of your experience processing or underwriting real estate loans. Candidates with direct lender-submission experience will be prioritized. Please include a smiley face in the subject line of your application.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Primary Responsibilities

1. Project Control & Zoho Governance

Meeting Shadowing: Attend all internal, client, and sales meetings. Capture all action items and deadlines in real-time.



Task Translation: Convert the CEO’s verbal ideas and voice notes into structured project plans within Zoho Projects.



The "Monday Pulse": Run weekly audits of all active projects. Identify bottlenecks and hold Directors (and the CEO) accountable for overdue tasks.



Reporting: Generate weekly performance and KPI reports for the CEO to review business health at a glance.



2. Sales & CRM Management

Pipeline Hygiene: Manage Zoho CRM to ensure every lead has a clear "Next Step" and follow-up date.



Contract Administration: Draft and send contracts (via Zoho Sign) following verbal closes and manage the signature process.



Client Onboarding: Coordinate the transition from "Closed-Won" to "Project Kickoff," ensuring Directors are briefed and tasks are assigned.



3. Communications & PR Support

Drafting & Ghostwriting: Draft press releases, client correspondence, and internal announcements based on CEO bullet points.



Media Outreach: Manage media lists and handle the distribution and tracking of press releases.



Inbox & Slack Triage: Act as the first line of defense for the CEO’s communications, filtering for high-priority items and answering routine operational questions.



4. Strategic Calendar Defense

Time Batching: Organize the CEO’s calendar to maximize "Deep Work" time, grouping sales and consulting calls into specific blocks.



Briefings: Provide the CEO with daily "Briefing Notes" including context for upcoming meetings and status updates on pending deliverables.



Daily updates highlighting urgent tasks and prioritizing next day tasks



Required Qualifications

Expert Proficiency in Zoho Suite: Specifically Zoho Projects, Zoho CRM, and Zoho Sign.



Operations Mindset: You enjoy building systems and find "messy" environments satisfying to clean.



Assertiveness: You are comfortable "managing up" and holding a CEO accountable to their own deadlines.



Exceptional Communication: The ability to turn a 60-second frantic voice memo into a professional, multi-step project plan.



Remote Work Fluency: Expert use of Slack, Zoom, Loom, and password management tools (e.g., LastPass/1Password).



Reliability is critical in this role - EST hours



Key Performance Indicators (Success Metrics)

System Integrity: 100% of the CEO's verbal commitments are logged in Zoho within 2 hours of a meeting.



Reporting Consistency: Monday Morning Reports are delivered by 9:00 AM local time without fail.



Lead Capture: Zero sales leads sit in the CRM without an active "Next Action" date.



CEO Throughput: A measurable reduction in the CEO's time spent on administrative "checking in" vs. high-level consulting.



How to Apply

Please include a brief Loom video or cover letter detailing your experience managing a Zoho environment and how you have previously held an executive accountable.

title: Process & Tools Guide Author for Animator (Mobile)
description:
Engagement type: Project-based SME 

Focus: Write the animation process and tooling guide; no hands-on animation.



ROLE PURPOSE

Define and document the animation pipeline for gameplay and marketing clips (2D rigs, light 3D, engine integration). Produce SOPs, controller/state-machine templates, QC checklists, and training—not clips.



CORE OUTCOMES (WHAT YOU SHIP)

* Animation Pipeline Playbook: Block-in ? timing passes ? polish ? integration; inputs/outputs, acceptance criteria by clip type (idles/attacks/hits/UI/VFX loops/trailers), RACI.

* Rigging & Setup Standards: Spine/Rive/AE puppet frameworks, bone/slot naming, FBX/glTF export profiles.

* Engine Integration Templates: Unity Animator/Timeline templates; Unreal Animation Blueprints/Montages; event naming, curves, root-motion guidance.

* AI-Assisted Motion Guides: When to use AnimateDiff/Runway/Pika; stabilization/cleanup steps; frame-accurate QC; risk/ethics notes.

* Performance & Readability Benchmarks: Mobile frame-time targets, texture/draw-call constraints, hit-pause, camera shake, readability heuristics.

* Review & QA: Frame-accuracy checks, event sync, montage transitions, device matrix for regression testing.

* Trailer Export Guide: Ratios, codec ladders, loudness targets, captioning, lower-third templates.

* Enablement Pack: Slides + Loom walkthroughs, annotated samples, onboarding quiz; train-the-trainer session.

* Handover: Template controllers/state machines, sample scenes, QC scripts/checklists.



TOOLS INCLUDED (DOCUMENT & RECOMMENDED SETTINGS/PRESETS)

* Rigging/2D: Spine, Rive, After Effects (puppet pins); Blender/Maya for export.

* Engines: Unity (Animator, Timeline), Unreal (Anim Blueprints, Montages).

* AI Motion: AnimateDiff, Runway, Pika; stabilization/cleanup utilities.

* QA/Review: 
/ShotGrid; device-testing matrix & checklists.

* Docs: Notion/Confluence templates; sample projects.



ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA

* Templates drop into a clean engine project and compile; events/curves documented; sample clips pass checklists.

* Reduced integration defects; improved first-pass approval; stable frame-time under target budgets.



QUALIFICATIONS

* Proven authoring of animation/technical animation pipelines; strong documentation samples.

* Proficiency with Spine/Rive and Unity/Unreal integration patterns.

* Comfort evaluating AI-assisted motion and defining when to prefer manual polish.

title: Author for Process & Tools - AI Graphic Artist (AI-Driven, Game)
description:
Engagement type: Project-based SME 

Focus: Write the process and tooling guide; no hands-on asset creation.

Why: We have no in-house experts; you will be the go-to SME and author the playbook.



ROLE PURPOSE

Design, document, and hand over a repeatable, engine-ready art pipeline (2D/3D + AI-assist) for mobile/PC games. You produce SOPs, checklists, presets, and training materials—not art.



Core Outcomes (What you ship)

* End-to-end Art Playbook: Concept ? reference ? AI-assist ? cleanup ? engine export, with inputs/outputs, acceptance criteria, and RACI.

* Toolchain Map & Configs: Recommended apps, versions, presets, color spaces, file structures, naming, and version control conventions.

* Prompt & Settings Library: Reusable prompts, seeds, ControlNet graphs, negative prompts; model cards and reproducibility notes.

* Dataset & Licensing SOP: Source vetting, license tracking, likeness/style approvals, LoRA/embedding guidance, audit logs.

* Engine Integration Checklists: Unity/Unreal/Godot import presets (pivots/scale/materials/compression/atlases), validation steps.

* Optimization Standards: Texture budgets, compression ladders (ASTC/ETC), atlasing, LOD awareness, sRGB/linear guidance.

*Channel Export Guides: Store/marketing/TikTok/IG/YT ratios, codecs/bitrates, captioning/subtitles.

* Accessibility & Localization: Contrast targets, reduced-motion variants, typography & RTL notes.

* Enablement Pack: Slides + Loom walkthroughs, quick-reference one-pagers, onboarding quiz; train-the-trainer session.

* Handover: Versioned templates, style guides, prompt library (JSON/CSV), import presets, repo structure.



TOOLS INCLUDED (DOCUMENT & RECOMMENDED SETTINGS/PRESETS)

* 2D/Design: Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects; Figma.

* 3D (export prep): Blender or Maya (UVs, simple meshes).

* AI Art: Stable Diffusion + ComfyUI (ControlNet, LoRA), Midjourney, Runway; inpaint/outpaint utilities; seed/version tracking.

* Collab/Review: 
 or ShotGrid; Notion/Confluence for playbooks.

* Version Control: Perforce or Git (with LFS).

* Engines: Unity, Unreal, or Godot import presets.



ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA

* Clean-install reproducibility (tools + presets), documented license sources, zero-error sample imports.

* SOPs reduce rework and time-to-first-playable (target agreed at kickoff).

* All templates versioned and searchable; recorded walkthrough delivered.



QUALIFICATIONS

* Track record authoring art pipelines for games or real-time apps; strong documentation samples.

* Expertise with Adobe CC + AI art workflows (SD/ComfyUI, Midjourney, Runway) and engine-ready exports.

* Comfortable defining naming/structure, version control, and QA gates.

title: DevOps Manager
description:
Summary of Position:

Harvest 21 is a Christian non-profit startup tech company focused on helping gospel-focused missionaries connect with other Christians, build an ever-growing network of supporters, and increase and accelerate their funding through donor engagement and technology. We help connect people who are passionate about the gospel with missionaries, mission agencies, churches, and even colleges. We are a company focused on connection. 



As we prepare to scale our impact, we’re seeking a DevOps Manager to lead the buildout and optimization of our software infrastructure. You’ll architect and implement robust CI/CD pipelines, cloud infrastructure, and process automation that enables our platform to serve thousands of missionaries and their supporters. This is a rare opportunity to help shape the future of a growing faith-driven tech platform from the ground up.



Duties & Responsibilities:

• Architect and implement secure, scalable CI/CD pipelines for our platform

• Manage AWS-based infrastructure and environments

• Lead and coordinate deployments across multiple environments and releases

• Collaborate closely with other developers, quality assurance engineers, and the product manager

• Ensure continuous integration and automated testing across the development lifecycle

• Identify and eliminate bottlenecks in the development and release process

• Own DevOps KPIs and report on system performance, deployment success rates, and i
 response

• Enforce best practices in DevOps, infrastructure as code, and system reliability

• Assist in disaster recovery, data backup, and security configuration

• Guide technical tea
mbers in process improvement and infrastructure management

• Communicate effectively across the team and with leadership

• Manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced, mission-driven environment

• This position will lead a team to accomplish these responsibilities and may perform some of them as well



Requirements:

• This position requires 10+ years of experience in software development

• Strong communication skills (oral and written – English) and leadership skills

• Solid understanding of DevOps practices and tools (CI/CD, infrastructure as code)

• Hands-on experience with AWS services (EC2, RDS, S3, CloudFormation, etc.)

• Familiarity with Git workflows, Docker, React.js, Python, automated testing tools (e.g., Jest, Cypress), and integration with services such as Stripe, Wistia, SendGrid, and Twilio.

• Work experience with program management tools such as ClickUp or Jira (ClickUp preferred)

• Ability to mentor and lead a small engineering team

• Experience building and maintaining systems for high availability and reliability

• Strong problem-solving and organizational skills



Qualifications:

• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field with 10+ years of DevOps experience

    OR

• 15+ years of equivalent professional experience in DevOps and infrastructure management



Culture:

At Harvest 21, we are united by a passion for the gospel and a commitment to excellence. Our team is purpose-driven, innovative, and collaborative—striving to build tools that make it faster and easier for missionaries to make meaningful connections with supporters and donors, and to ultimately increase their ability to share the gospel. We work hard, pray often, and celebrate wins together as we pursue our vision of advancing the gospel through technology.

title: Payroll Specialist
description:
Company: Book Werkz

 Location: Remote

 Schedule & Availability:

Monday–Wednesday: 9:00 AM–5:00 PM CST

Thursday–Friday: 9:00 AM–5:00 PM CST if QuickBooks Online experience is present

Compensation: Starting at $8.50/hour 



About Book Werkz

Book Werkz is a boutique bookkeeping and financial services firm that partners with small businesses to deliver reliable, accurate, and proactive financial clarity. We work with service-based businesses across multiple industries and pride ourselves on precision, communication, and treating each client’s business as if it were our own.

Our team operates with a high standard of accountability, clear processes, and open communication. We value tea
mbers who are dependable, detail-oriented, and confident in their craft.



Position Overview

The Payroll Specialist is responsible for executing accurate, timely payroll processing across multiple client accounts and supporting payroll-related compliance and reporting. This role is highly execution-focused and requires proven payroll experience across multiple platforms.

This is not a training or entry-level role. Candidates must already be confident running payroll independently and managing multiple payroll schedules with minimal oversight.

The Payroll Specialist will work closely with the CEO and bookkeeping team to ensure payroll is processed accurately, on time, and in alignment with Book Werkz standards.



Purpose of the Role

Maintain compliance and consistency across payroll platforms

Reduce payroll-related risk, rework, and client escalations

Support continuity through documentation and cross-training readiness



Key Responsibilities

Process payroll accurately and on schedule for multiple client accounts

Manage payroll platforms including iSolved, ADP, Paylocity, and Gusto

Review payroll data for accuracy, including wages, deductions, benefits, and taxes

Handle payroll adjustments, corrections, and off-cycle payrolls as needed

Communicate directly with internal tea
mbers regarding payroll deadlines and requirements

Respond to payroll-related client inquiries in a professional and timely manner

Maintain payroll documentation and ensure records are complete and up to date

Support payroll audits, reconciliations, and compliance requests

Follow documented payroll workflows and contribute to ongoing process documentation

Participate in cross-training to ensure payroll continuity and coverage



Collaboration & Communication

You will collaborate with:

CEO (Hillary): For clarification, escalation, and alignment on payroll processes

Bookkeeping Team: To coordinate payroll data, deadlines, and client needs

Clients (as needed): For payroll-related questions, confirmations, or missing information

Communication tools include Slack, Canopy, and
. Clear, proactive communication is essential.



Expectations

High level of accuracy and attention to detail

Strong time management and ability to meet strict payroll deadlines

Clear and professional written communication

Comfort managing payroll for multiple clients simultaneously

Ability to follow established processes consistently

Willingness to document workflows and flag discrepancies proactively



Required Experience & Skills

Proven, hands-on payroll experience (not theoretical or assisted only)

Demonstrated experience using iSolved, ADP, Paylocity, and Gusto

Ability to manage payroll across multiple clients and schedules

Understanding of payroll compliance and best practices

QuickBooks Online experience strongly preferred

Experience working in a remote, deadline-driven environment



Systems & Tools We Use

Payroll Platforms: iSolved, ADP, Paylocity, Gusto

QuickBooks Online

Canopy (task and workflow management)

Slack (team communication)

Gmail

Zoom

Loom



Important Notes

This is not a “train-on-the-job” position

Candidates must come with the required payroll experience

Accuracy, reliability, and consistency are non-negotiable



How to Apply

Please
 your resume and a brief summary of your payroll experience (including platforms used and number of clients supported) to

title: Marketing Strategist
description:
Marketing Lead / Marketing Strategist

Location: Remote 

Hours: 20–30 hours/week 

Reports to: CEO, Book Werkz

Compensation: $800/month



About Book Werkz

Book Werkz is a boutique financial firm that goes beyond the numbers. We provide bookkeeping, tax strategy, and CFO-level advisory for small business owners who crave clarity, confidence, and control in their finances. We treat our clients’ businesses as if they were our own — with accuracy, integrity, and unwavering support.

We’re a growing company with a bold vision, strong values, and a commitment to helping entrepreneurs stay aligned, profitable, and empowered. As we expand our digital presence, we’re hiring a Marketing Lead to take the reins and build a strategic, consistent, and compelling online footprint.



Position Overview

We are looking for a strategic, creative, proactive Marketing Lead who can build and run our entire marketing ecosystem — from big-picture strategy to day-to-day content creation and publishing.

You will be responsible for:

Developing a cohesive, data-driven marketing strategy

Creating all digital content (blogs, newsletters, Instagram + LinkedIn posts)

Designing and implementing campaigns, funnels, and lead-generation initiatives

Monitoring analytics and optimizing for growth

Keeping all messaging aligned with our brand voice and values

If you are equal parts strategist and executor — and you love taking raw messaging and turning it into polished, compelling, high-performing marketing — this role is for you.



Key Responsibilities

1. Strategic Direction + Planning

Develop quarterly marketing plans and visibility strategies.

Design campaigns aligned with business goals (tax season, launches, visibility pushes).

Create 90-day and annual marketing roadmaps with clear priorities.

Audit current marketing efforts and identify performance gaps.

Ensure every marketing task aligns with revenue goals and brand positioning.

2. Offer + Funnel Strategy

Build awareness ? nurture ? conversion funnels.

Optimize customer journeys from social ? website ? lead magnet ?
 ? call ? sale.

Identify conversion leaks and implement solutions.

Create or oversee creation of lead magnets, opt-ins, and masterclass content.

Write or guide nurture sequences and promotional campaigns.



3. Messaging + Creative Direction

Maintain and evolve the brand’s messaging framework.

Ensure all content reflects Book Werkz’s tone, values, and differentiated positioning.

Turn strategy into weekly content ideas for blogs,
, and social channels.

Collaborate with the CEO for story-based and authority content.

Maintain quality and consistency across all marketing materials.

4. Data + Optimization

Track KPIs and interpret performance trends.

Prepare monthly analytics reports with actionable recommendations.

Adjust strategy to focus on high-ROI platforms and content types.

Use data to drive decisions about content,
, campaigns, and funnels.



5. Content Creation + Implementation

You will personally create and publish:

One weekly long-form blog (SEO optimized, 3,500–5,000 words).

One weekly
 newsletter using the brand template.

Five weekly posts on Instagram + LinkedIn (copy + visual direction).

Monthly reporting dashboards.

You will also:

Schedule content across all channels.

Maintain monthly content calendars and project timelines.

Ensure all content works together cohesively to drive visibility and conversions.

 

6. Innovation + Brand Growth

Identify PR opportunities, podcast placements, strategic collaborations.

Stay aware of industry trends and platform shifts.

Suggest new lead gen ideas, nurtures, or content formats.

Recommend new systems or tools that increase efficiency and reach.



Ideal Candidate Profile

You are the person for this role if you:

Are a self-starter who can take a concept and run with it.

Know how to blend strategy and execution seamlessly.

Understand small business, service-based industries, and financial services.

Have experience building content systems from scratch.

Love long-form writing and storytelling.

Can think like a CMO and act like a full-service content creator.

Thrive in a role where you own the marketing function end-to-end.

Bring fresh ideas and love staying ahead of marketing trends.

Are organized, proactive, collaborative, and committed to excellence.



Requirements

3–5+ years experience in marketing, strategy, or content creation

Strong writing skills (especially long-form & educational content)

Familiarity with SEO, funnels, and analytics

Experience with Canva or similar design tools

Knowledge of financial services or experience working with service-based entrepreneurs (preferred but not required)

Comfortable working closely with the CEO and integrating feedback

Highly organized with clean communication skills



Why Work With Book Werkz

A values-driven, supportive team culture

Creative autonomy with room for innovation

Opportunity to build the marketing foundation of a growing brand

Flexible remote work

Long-term growth opportunities



How to Apply

Submit the following to 

Your resume

Links to 2–3 relevant writing or content samples

A short statement answering:

“Why are you the right person to lead Book Werkz’s marketing?”

description:
Virtual Assistant Wanted – Bookkeeping + Social Media + Reporting

About Us

We’re not your average cleaning company. We’re a small but mighty crew of 16 hardworking, fun-loving tea
mbers based in the U.S., specializing in carpet cleaning, air duct cleaning, and house cleaning.



We keep homes fresh, families happy, and communities shining and we like to have a good time while doing it.

Now, we’re on the hunt for a Virtual Assistant with personality to keep us organized, help us shine on social media, and make sure our numbers add up. If you’re someone who works hard, laughs often, and wants to be part of a team that actually values you… keep reading 



What You’ll Do (and Rock At)

Bookkeeping – invoices, reconciliations, reports (QuickBooks or similar)

Excel/Google Sheets Magic – pulling reports, creating dashboards, tracking KPIs

Social Media – posting content, moderating our private
 group, chatting with people online

 Admin Support –
s, scheduling, and random “can you handle this?” tasks that keep us running smoothly



Who You Are

You love details (you spot typos before anyone else)

Numbers don’t scare you (QuickBooks + Excel are your friends)

Social media feels fun, not scary

You communicate well in English (writing + speaking)

You’re reliable, proactive, and have a positive attitude 

Bonus: You’re creative with Canva or content ideas!



Perks & Pay

100% Remote – work in PJs if you want

Competitive salary + room for growth

Fun team culture – we celebrate wins and support each other

Long-term stability (we want someone to grow with us!)



How to Apply (Show Us Your Fun Side!)

Use the subject line: VA-BOOKKEEPER SOCIAL



Answer these in writing:

Why are you uniquely qualified for this role?

Have you worked with QuickBooks and Excel?

Tell us about your social media or
 group experience.

Do you have a stable computer + internet?

When could you start?



Send us a FUN 2–3 minute video (Loom, Zoom, or phone):

Introduce yourself (don’t be shy!)



Tell us why you’d be awesome for this role

Share what excites you about joining a company like ours





Upload your video to Google Drive, Dropbox, or Loom (make sure it’s viewable) and include the link in your application.

If you’re organized, positive, and ready to join a team that values fun just as much as hard work — apply now!



Willing to pay more for the perfect person.
