title: Research & Outreach VA – US Public Sector Prospecting (Part- to Full-Time)
description:
About the client

US social-impact team working with public-sector programs. We’re mapping 49 states + 49 localities and then contacting each jurisdiction’s significant subrecipients. The core of this role is drafting, submitting, and tracking official public-records (Sunshine/FOIA) requests to obtain current subrecipient lists and program contacts, then doing follow-up outreach.



Scope

-File and manage public-records requests across 49 states + 49 localities

-Extract subrecipient organizations from responses; identify significant subrecipients; find/verify decision-maker contacts for each org; log everything with sources



What you’ll do

-Draft and submit formal public-records requests (Sunshine/FOIA/Public Records, as applicable) via
 or portals (e.g., NextRequest, GovQA/JustFOIA, Granicus), including fee-waiver language and narrowly tailored scopes (existing lists/reports)

-Track request numbers, statutory due dates, and correspondence; send timely follow-ups and handle clarifications/narrowing

-Receive, organize, and extract data from responses (PDFs, spreadsheets, dashboards); cite source URLs / provenance

-Build a clean list of significant subrecipients per jurisdiction (see definition below)

-For each significant org, find 1–2 relevant contacts (program lead/manager), verify
s, and log LinkedIn/source evidence

-Send respectful one-to-one intro
s to subrecipients; track replies and next actions in the CRM/Sheet

-Escalate to appeal templates or revised requests when records are denied or overly redacted (we’ll provide templates)



“Significant subrecipient” — working definition

-Treat an org as significant if any are true: (1) explicitly funded for naloxone/THN/harm reduction/overdose prevention activities; (2) listed funding ? meaningful program share (we’ll define per response); (3) county-wide or coalition lead; (4) hospital/EMS/university center leading overdose response. Always record why qualified.



Deliverables

-Requests Log: jurisdiction, office, request text, portal URL/ID, date submitted, acknowledgment, due date, status, correspondence, disposition, file links

-Organizations Sheet: subrecipients, program area, significance reason, source link

-Contacts Sheet: 1–2 decision-makers per significant org with verified
/phone + source link

-Comms Log: every outbound/reply/follow-up with next action & date



Quality bar & KPIs

-Coverage: File and confirm receipt for all 98 jurisdictions on a set schedule

-Throughput: 15–25 formal requests/week to start; ramp with templates/batching

-Traceability: 100% of requests have tracking ID/URL, statutory due date, and saved copies of all correspondence

-Document handling: 100% of responses parsed and filed with source/provenance; extracted org lists kept tidy (no dupes)

-Contacts: ? 1 verified decision-maker per significant org; ?95%
 verification rate; ?5% post-verification bounces

-Cadence: courteous follow-ups per law/portal guidance (log every touch); clarifications answered within 2 business days

-Compliance: Narrow scopes; request existing lists/reports; include fee-waiver; avoid “any and all communications” language



Must-haves

-3+ years US B2B research & outreach with strong written English

-Hands-on experience with public-records (FOIA/Sunshine) workflows: portals,
 submissions, narrowing/clarifications, tracking, and organizing releases

-Tool fluency: Google Sheets, a CRM (HubSpot/Freshsales), Hunter/Apollo, NeverBounce, LinkedIn; comfortable with portal ecosystems (NextRequest, GovQA/JustFOIA, Granicus)

-Meticulous documentation and version control



Nice-to-haves

-Public health or SLED/government vendor experience

-Light phone follow-ups when
/portals stall

-Basic PDF extraction/OCR comfort (Acrobat, tabula, etc.)



Schedule & pay

-20–40 hrs/week with 2–4 hrs overlap in America/Chicago

-Competitive hourly, paid trial, performance bonuses tied to coverage (requests filed/acknowledged), clean extractions, and verified contacts

-Long-term for the right fit



How to apply (subject required)

Subject: FOIA Prospecting VA – [Your Name]

Include:

-3 bullets on public-records projects you’ve run (your role, volume, outcomes)

-2 brief writing samples: a formal request and a clarification/narrowing reply

-A Loom ?3 min showing how you’d submit a request via a portal or
 and log it properly

-Hourly rate, weekly availability, and OnlineJobs ID Proof score



Ground rules

Individuals only (no agencies) • NDA before project specifics • One thread per jurisdiction (no multi-office blasts) • Every record needs a source link + verification note

title: Operations & KPI Manager (Project Management Focus)
description:
Role Purpose (Why This Role Exists)



We are looking for a highly organised, firm, and detail-driven Operations & KPI Manager to act as the backbone of execution across our group of hospitality, events, and property businesses.



This role exists to ensure:



Everyone knows what they are responsible for



KPIs are clear, measurable, and tracked



Tasks are completed on time and to standard



Performance issues are flagged early



Directors and senior managers are held accountable to commitments



This is not an admin role.

This is an authority-without-ego role.



Core Responsibilities

1?? KPI Ownership & Performance Management (Primary Responsibility)



Design, document, and maintain KPIs for every key role, including:



Directors



General Managers



Finance



Marketing



Operations



Events & Sales



Ensure all KPIs are:



Measurable



Time-bound



Directly linked to business outcomes (revenue, margin, efficiency, risk)



Track KPIs weekly and monthly



Produce clear performance dashboards



Flag:



Underperformance



Missed deadlines



Repeated execution failures



Escalate issues professionally but firmly



???? This person does not ignore excuses — only facts.



2?? Task & Role Clarity Across the Business



Create and maintain:



Job task lists for each role



Weekly / monthly responsibilities



Ownership matrices (who owns what)



Ensure no task is:



Duplicated



Forgotten



“Assumed” to belong to someone else



Regularly review and tighten roles as the business evolves



3?? Project Management & Execution Control



Own the project management system (e.g. 
, ClickUp, Asana)



Break down business priorities into:



Tasks



Owners



Deadlines



Dependencies



Track progress daily



Run weekly execution reviews



Ensure projects move from:

Idea ? Plan ? Execution ? Completion



No drifting. No half-finished initiatives.



4?? Director & Senior Leadership Accountability



This is critical.



Track director-level commitments and actions



Maintain a commitments log



Follow up on:



Agreed actions



Deadlines



Decisions



Escalate delays or inaction respectfully but clearly



Provide objective reporting — not softened narratives



You are expected to be comfortable pushing back, professionally.



5?? Reporting & Decision Support



Produce:



Weekly KPI summaries



Monthly performance reports



Risk & issue logs



Highlight:



What is on track



What is slipping



What requires immediate decision



Ensure leadership meetings are:



Prepared



Data-led



Action-focused



Required Experience & Skills

Essential



3+ years experience in:



Project Management



Operations Management



Performance / KPI tracking



Strong experience working with:



Senior stakeholders



Cross-functional teams



Excellent written English (firm, clear, professional)



High attention to detail and accuracy



Comfortable enforcing structure and deadlines



Confident using project management tools and dashboards



Strong Excel / Google Sheets capability



Personal Attributes (Non-Negotiable)



We are explicitly looking for someone who is:



Firm but fair



Calm under pressure



Highly organised



Not afraid of uncomfortable conversations



Not a “yes person”



Naturally structured and disciplined



Motivated by results and standards, not busyness



If you avoid confrontation or struggle to challenge senior people, this role is not suitable.



Working Style & Expectations



Full-time, remote



UK business hours overlap required



High autonomy, high responsibility



Performance measured on:



Execution quality



KPI accuracy



Follow-through



Business impact



This role will become one of the most trusted positions in the company.



KPIs for This Role (Example)



% of roles with clearly defined KPIs



On-time task completion rate across teams



Number of overdue actions >7 days



Accuracy of reports (zero tolerance for errors)



Improvement in team execution over time



Career Progression



This role can evolve into:



Head of Operations



Chief of Staff (Remote)



Group Performance Director (Remote)



We value long-term thinkers, not short-term freelancers.

title: Video Editor
description:
About Us

We are a fast-paced whiskey company based in the United States of America. We are looking for a creative and talented video editor who wants to be part of our journey and grow with us long-term. If you have a passion for storytelling through video and love bringing raw footage to life, we want to hear from you.



Key Responsibilities

- Edit long-form vlog content from raw footage to a polished final product

Trim, cut, and arrange footage to create engaging and cohesive narratives

Add music, sound effects, voiceovers, and audio mixing as needed

Incorporate graphics, text overlays, transitions, and color grading

Collaborate with the team to ensure the final content aligns with our brand and vision

Manage and organize video files and assets

Meet deadlines consistently while maintaining high-quality output





Requirements



Proven experience editing long-form video content, vlogs, or similar formats

Proficiency in video editing software such as Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, or DaVinci Resolve

Strong storytelling instincts — you know how to keep viewers engaged

Strong attention to detail, especially with pacing, audio, and visual consistency

Ability to take creative direction and implement feedback efficiently

Strong organizational skills for managing large video files and projects

Familiarity with AI video and editing tools is a big plus

Fluent in English, both written and verbal (a plus, not required)



What We Offer



A stable, long-term position with room to grow

Fully remote work

Creative freedom within brand guidelines

A collaborative and supportive team environment

The opportunity to be a key part of an exciting, growing company



Think you're the right fit? We'd love to see your work. Send us your portfolio and apply today!

tro Manila and nearby cities only.





Role Overview

We are looking for a dedicated Social Media Account Manager to join our growing agency. This role involves creating, growing, and managing multiple social media accounts across platforms including Instagram, TikTok, YouTube Shorts,
/Threads, and more. The ideal candidate will have strong technical skills, excellent English proficiency, and the ability to maintain consistent posting schedules across multiple accounts.

title: AI Video Tutorial Creator (Remote)
description:
I’m looking for cinematic how-to tutorials in this style:

???? 

(polished pacing, clear steps, cinematic edits and not raw screen recordings)



Topics: Tutorials for Hostinger, Runpod, DigitalOcean, WordPress, Higgsfield, SaaS tools, VPS/Docker setups, etc.

(Accounts + payment provided.)



Format: 16:9, 4K

Structure: Avatar Intro (15–20s) ? Tutorial (5–10 min) ? Avatar Outro (15–20s)



Workflow

 1. I share a Google Sheet with 3–4 clear sentences describing the SaaS + the exact outcome

(e.g. “Create a simple WordPress landing page. Install WordPress. Choose a theme. Build a one-page layout with a contact form.”)

 2. You turn those sentences into a full step-by-step video tutorial script.

 3. I review and approve the script.

 4. You create the voiceover (AI or your own voice for the paid trial).

 5. You create the avatar intro + outro with lip-sync.

 6. You build the tutorial visuals (screen capture + supporting visuals).

 7. You deliver the polished 16:9, 4K video + clean SRT via Google Drive.



Quality Bar

 • Paid trial: $40

 • Trial is paid only if quality is ~90% similar to the YouTube reference.



Ongoing

 • If it works: ~16 videos/month



Apply (required)

 1. Link to a how-to tutorial you created

(WordPress landing page, SaaS onboarding, software setup, provider doesn’t matter)

 2. Confirm you can record your own voiceover for the paid trial

 3. CV

title: Social Seller and Engager
description:
About the Role



We are a fast growing, high energy small business looking for Social Sellers and Engagers who love conversations, community, and helping people find the right products and programs.



This is not a passive posting job.

You will be actively online throughout your shift, responding to comments and messages, engaging in conversations, and guiding people toward the right next step.



Customer service matters to us. Response time matters to us. Human, friendly conversations matter to us.



Shift Coverage (USA and Philippines Time Listed Clearly)



We are hiring for multiple shifts. Each hire will work one consistent shift only.



Shift 1: US Day Coverage



USA Time (Eastern): 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM



Philippines Time (PHT): 10:00 PM to 6:00 AM



Shift 2: US Evening Coverage



USA Time (Eastern): 5:00 PM to 1:00 AM



Philippines Time (PHT): 6:00 AM to 2:00 PM



Shift 3: US Overnight Coverage



USA Time (Eastern): 1:00 AM to 9:00 AM



Philippines Time (PHT): 2:00 PM to 10:00 PM



Please apply only if you are comfortable working your selected shift consistently.



What You’ll Be Doing



Social Engagement and Selling



Respond to comments and messages across social media platforms using AgoraPulse



Engage in real time conversations via comments, DMs, and replies



Introduce products, programs, and events when people express interest



Keep conversations friendly, natural, and on brand



Response Time and Monitoring



Monitor and respond to messages quickly



Maintain fast response times (tracked and reviewed)



Prioritize open conversations across platforms



Customer Support and Follow Through



Assist customers through comments, DMs, WhatsApp, and internal handoffs



Work closely with the support team to resolve issues



Follow through until the customer’s question or concern is fully resolved



Team Communication



Communicate with your manager and team using Slack



Share updates, escalations, and follow ups clearly



Participate in daily coordination and feedback



AI Assisted Writing



Use AI tools to draft responses quickly



Keep responses human, conversational, and on brand



Adjust tone based on context and customer needs



What We’re Looking For



Excellent written English communication skills



Enjoys conversation and helping people



Experience with social media engagement, customer support, or social selling



Comfortable using tools like AgoraPulse, Slack, and WhatsApp



Confident using AI tools for writing assistance



Reliable, responsive, and organized



Team player who thrives in a fast paced environment



Able to remain active and engaged for the full duration of your shift



What Success Looks Like



Fast response times during your shift



High quality, friendly conversations



Customers feel heard, supported, and guided



Smooth collaboration with the team



Increased engagement and interest in products and events



Why Join Our Team:



Supportive and collaborative team



Clear expectations and daily feedback



Growing business with long term opportunities



Real impact on customer experience and revenue



How to Apply:



When applying, please include:



Which shift you are applying for



Your experience with social engagement or customer support



Your experience using AI tools for writing



Your experience with Slack or WhatsApp (if any)



But hold up!

If you love fast paced work, meaningful conversations, and being part of a growing team, this role is for you.



Looking forward to meeting you.

title: Content Writer (uses AI) Producer (Books, Events, Digital Assets)
description:
We’re an AI first company. This role is for a producer who uses AI daily to create, refine, and ship polished deliverables fast.



You will use AI tools to support:



Writing: outlines, drafts, rewrites, examples, prompts, variations



Editing: tightening, clarity passes, tone consistency, QA



Design support: image generation for book and workbook visuals, icons, diagrams, simple illustrations



Production: templates, formatting, and publishing ready files



You’ll turn raw inputs (notes, transcripts, voice memos, messy outlines) into finished products: short guides, workbooks, event packets, and other branded assets.



What You’ll Produce

Publishing



Short nonfiction guides and book manuscripts



Print ready interiors and ebook files (Amazon KDP compliant)



Prompts, checklists, worksheets, glossaries, resource pages



Metadata packages when needed (descriptions, keywords, categories)



Event and Business Assets



Workbooks, attendee guides, handouts, and templates



Slide friendly outlines, speaker notes, run of show docs



One pagers, program guides, sponsor packets, branded PDFs



AI generated visuals: simple diagrams, icons, illustrations, and cover concept comps



Key Responsibilities

1) AI Assisted Writing and Content Creation



Use AI to accelerate writing, expand ideas, and create structured teaching content



Convert transcripts into clean chapters, lessons, and step by step guides



Produce strong hooks, frameworks, examples, scripts, and action steps



Maintain a consistent voice and series style across deliverables



2) AI Assisted Editing and Quality Control



Use AI for editing passes but apply human judgment so content is not generic



Remove repetition, tighten language, improve clarity, and strengthen flow



Fact check core claims and flag anything that needs verification



Create quality checks so every deliverable meets standards before submission



3) AI Powered Visual Creation



Generate and refine visuals using AI image tools for use in books and event materials



Create simple diagrams, icons, charts, and illustrations that support learning



Maintain clean, professional design consistency



Deliver visuals in usable formats (PNG, SVG when possible, print safe resolution)



4) Layout, Formatting, and Production



Format print interiors for Amazon KDP (paperback and optional ebook)



Build workbook layouts with professional typography, spacing, and structure



Create reusable templates for faster production over time



Deliver production ready files: print PDF, editable source file, and export versions



5) Workflow Ownership



Manage a content calendar and production tracker



Hit deadlines without constant supervision



Maintain organized file naming, version control, and handoff notes



Required Experience



Strong writing ability for educational or how to style content



Demonstrated experience publishing and or producing books on Amazon KDP



Strong formatting skills for print and digital documents



Daily hands on use of AI tools for writing and production



Ability to create AI generated visuals suitable for business and publishing use



Self starter with strong follow through



Required Tools Competency



You must be proficient with AI tools such as:



ChatGPT or Claude for drafting and editing



An image generation tool for visuals (Midjourney, DALL E, Ideogram, Canva AI, or similar)



Basic design and layout tools (Canva, Adobe, Vellum, Atticus, Google Docs, Word styles)



Submission Requirements (Must Include)



AI Process Proof



A short screen recording or written walkthrough showing your AI workflow:



outline to draft to edit to final



and image creation for a simple visual



Include the prompts you used or a representative sample of them



Writing Samples



2 to 5 samples that show structure, clarity, and teaching ability



Published Proof



Links to at least 2 Amazon listings you contributed to



State your role for each: writing, editing, formatting, upload, listing, etc.



Formatting Samples



1 print interior PDF sample



1 workbook or branded PDF sample



Visual Samples



3 to 6 AI generated visuals you created for business use



Briefly explain what tool you used and the goal of each visual



Paid Test Task for Finalists



You’ll be given a short topic or transcript excerpt



Deliver:



a structured outline



3 to 5 formatted pages



1 to 2 AI generated visuals supporting the content



a quick prompt log showing how you used AI



Fast turnaround required

title: Social Media Rockstar: AI Content Creator & Video Editor
description:
Are You Obsessed with AI and Know How to Make Content Go Viral?

We are looking for a true Social Media Rockstar who lives and breathes Artificial Intelligence. If you spend your free time testing new AI tools, scrolling through AI news on
/X, and figuring out how to turn complex tech concepts into viral short-form videos, stop scrolling—you just found your dream job.



This isn't just about editing videos; it's about being on the bleeding edge of technology. We are an AI-First company, meaning we don't just talk about AI—we use it for everything. We expect you to do the same.



About Us: The AI-First Approach

We are a forward-thinking company operating strictly in the Artificial Intelligence niche. Our philosophy is simple: if an AI can help us do it better, faster, or more creatively, we use it. We are looking for a tea
mber who shares this mindset.



We will provide you with access to ANY AI tool you need to get the job done. Midjourney, RunwayML, ElevenLabs, ChatGPT Plus, Jasper—you name it. If it helps you create viral masterpieces, we’ll pay for it. Your toolkit will be limitless.



The Role: Viral AI Content Creator

You will be the architect of our social media presence on TikTok and Instagram Reels. Your mission is to take the latest developments in AI and turn them into engaging, high-energy, shareable content that stops the scroll.



What You Will Be Doing:

Creating Viral AI Content: Concepting, scripting, filming, and editing short-form video content specifically about Artificial Intelligence tools, news, and tutorials.

AI-Powered Workflow: Using AI tools to accelerate your creation process (e.g., using AI for scriptwriting, voiceovers, generative video, or image creation). Using AI is mandatory, not optional.

Trend Surfing: Identifying trending audio, formats, and AI news stories daily and adapting them immediately for our brand.

Advanced Video Editing: producing high-quality edits with dynamic captions, B-roll, transitions, and effects that retain viewer attention (CapCut, Premiere, or After Effects proficiency required).

Analytics & Optimization: Analyzing what works, why it went viral, and how to replicate that success.

Requirements: Do You Have What It Takes?

To be considered for this role, you must meet the following criteria:



Proven Viral Track Record: You must have a portfolio showing videos you created that have generated significant views and engagement. We want to see receipts.

AI Tool Mastery: You must already be proficient in using various AI tools. We aren't looking to teach you the basics; we want someone who can teach us new tricks.

Deep AI Knowledge: You understand the difference between LLMs and Diffusion models. You know what Midjourney v6 is. You actually care about this niche.

Expert Editing Skills: You know how to edit for retention. Fast cuts, engaging visuals, and perfect audio sync are second nature to you.

Platform Native: You understand the nuances of TikTok vs. Instagram Reels algorithms.

Why Join Us?

Unlimited AI Tool Budget: We provide paid access to the best AI tools on the market.

Creative Freedom: We hire smart people and let them do what they do best.

Remote Work: Work from the comfort of your home.

Growth Opportunity: Be part of the fastest-growing industry in the world.

How to Apply (Read Carefully)

To apply, please send a message with the subject line "AI SOCIAL MEDIA ROCKSTAR" and include the following:



Your Portfolio: Links to 3-5 specific TikToks or Reels you have created that performed well. (Do not send a generic drive folder without pointing out your best work).

Your Tech Stack: A bulleted list of the AI tools you have already mastered and use regularly.

AI Workflow Example: Briefly explain how you currently use AI in your content creation process (e.g., "I use ChatGPT for scripting, Midjourney for backgrounds, and Descript for editing").

A Short Video (Optional but recommended): A 30-second video introducing yourself and telling us why you love AI.

Applications that do not include the list of mastered AI tools will be ignored.



We look forward to building the future with you!

The Role

I run real estate investment, property/project management, and construction-related projects in the US. I need one proactive, all-around assistant who can handle many different tasks and grow with the business.



Daily/Weekly Tasks (you’ll be trained on everything):

Payroll and employee scheduling

Research zoning, permits, building codes, legal guidelines

Source and vet contractors (general contractors, plumbers, electricians, etc.)

Must-Have

Reliable internet + quiet workspace + working webcam

Available for at least 4–6 hours overlap with US Eastern time zone

Big Pluses (will start you higher and promote faster)

Experience in real estate, property management, or construction

QuickBooks, Google Workspace, Asana/Trello/ClickUp, Homebase

Knowledge of US building codes or permitting (right now focused on PA)

*Knowledge of AI and how to implement



How to Apply – Do ALL 3 steps or your application will be skipped

Record a 60–90 second Loom or phone video telling me:

Your name & where you are located

One complicated project or research task you’ve handled before

Why you want a role that grows from part-time to full-time

First line of your message/cover letter: “STARTING SALARY $325 – I accept the growth plan”



We move very fast and start interviews immediately

title: SEO & AI Search Optimization Specialist (AEO – Webflow Required)
description:
IMPORTANT – READ CAREFULLY



Read this entire post before applying. Applications that do not follow every instruction below will be automatically disqualified.



To confirm you read this fully, include the phrase:



Systems over chaos



as the first line of your application.



Applications missing this phrase will not be reviewed.



About The Role



I am hiring a mid-level SEO operator to lead our AI Search Optimization (AEO) execution using a platform called Searchable.



Searchable is built specifically for the AI search era. It tracks how brands appear inside ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, and Perplexity, and identifies content gaps preventing AI citation.



You will not need prior AI experience.

You will master our selected platform.



This role focuses on execution and iteration.



What You Will Do



• Research high-volume AI prompts in our industry

• Identify citation gaps and competitor visibility

• Generate AI-optimized articles inside Searchable

• Publish 2 structured articles per day on our Webflow blog

•Publish structured articles inside Webflow (or quickly adapt if coming from WordPress)

• Handle metadata, schema basics, and page formatting

• Embed YouTube videos properly

• Repurpose blog articles into structured LinkedIn posts and LinkedIn articles using established formatting frameworks

• Extract key insights from long-form content and adapt for authority positioning on LinkedIn

• Track AI citations and ranking data weekly

• Identify content gaps and propose execution priorities

• Provide structured daily Slack updates

• Join one weekly Zoom strategy call with the CEO



This is execution-heavy with structured reporting.



Clarifications Before You Apply



This role is focused on AI Engine Optimization (AEO). If you are skeptical of AI search or unwilling to adapt beyond traditional SEO, this role is not a fit.



We have already selected our tool. You will master Searchable rather than introduce alternatives.



You will handle light technical setup including schema and metadata. The primary focus remains content and optimization.



LinkedIn content repurposing will follow defined frameworks. This is structured execution, not creative copywriting.



We value adaptability and execution track record over deep niche specialization.





** Who This Is For **



This role is for someone who:



• Has 3–6+ years of SEO experience

• Has run projects independently

• Understands keyword research deeply

• Understands search intent clustering

• Has worked with Ahrefs, SEMrush, Surfer, or similar tools

• Understands on-page SEO and structured data basics

• Can convert structured blog content into professional LinkedIn posts without rewriting from scratch

• Understands formatting differences between blog, LinkedIn post, and LinkedIn article

• Has experience publishing inside a CMS (Webflow preferred, WordPress acceptable)

• Can repurpose long-form blog content into strong LinkedIn posts and LinkedIn articles

• Can execute consistently without supervision

• Wants long-term growth



English Proficiency – Advanced (Required)



You will be writing financial and investment-related content for sophisticated audiences.



Precision, clarity, and structured communication are critical.



If your writing requires heavy editing, this role is not a fit.





** This role is NOT for:



• Agencies

• Freelancers juggling multiple clients

• Side-hustlers

• Consultants

• Anyone resistant to AI search

• Anyone looking for short-term contracts



This is a full-time embedded role.



Compensation & Growth Structure



Starting salary: $1,000 - $1,200 USD per month depending on experience and demonstrated execution.



Structured quarterly pay increases based on performance and consistency.



Base salary is capped at $2,000 per month long term.



Annual performance bonus tied directly to net new revenue growth.



This structure is designed to reward loyalty, performance, and long-term contribution.



Long-Term Commitment



I am married to a Filipina and we run a foundation in Cebu. The Philippines is not just a hiring market for us. It is family and long-term commitment.



We are building for the long term and investing in people who grow with the company.



This is not a short-term experiment.





** Application Instructions **





Start your application with the phrase: Systems over chaos



Provide a Loom video explaining:



Your SEO experience



A ranking win you achieved



A time you had to learn a new tool and implement it successfully



Provide a 300–500 word writing sample explaining a financial concept clearly



At the end of your Loom video, state the number 17



Applications missing any of the above will not be reviewed.



If you prefer building structured systems that compound instead of guessing, this role may be a strong fit.

title: EXPERIENCED BOOKEEPER
Social Media Manager & Marketing Executive - Fitness Studio (Part-Time Trial)
description:

RISE Personal Training is a premium fitness studio in North Parramatta, Sydney, Australia. We offer personalized training programs and are currently running growth campaigns to acquire new clients for 2025.

POSITION: Part-Time (20 hours/week) - 1 Month Trial with potential for ongoing work

Rate: $6-8 USD/hour (negotiable based on experience)

Time Zone: Must have at least 4 hours overlap with AEST (Australian Eastern Standard Time)

YOUR ROLE:

You’ll execute our pre-planned marketing campaigns across social media and advertising platforms. All strategy, content ideas, and brand guidelines will be provided - you focus on implementation and optimization.

SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES:

Daily Tasks (Mon-Sat):

 ? Schedule and post content to Instagram,
, and Google Business Profile using approved content calendar

 ? Create graphics and visual content using Canva (templates provided)

 ? Monitor and respond to comments, DMs, and inquiries within 2 hours during business hours

Weekly Tasks:

 and Instagram ad campaigns (budget monitoring, A/B testing, audience adjustments)

 ? Update content calendar based on performance insights

 ? Create Instagram Stories and Reels from provided concepts

Campaign-Specific (January 2025):

 ? Manage lead generation funnel from ad click to inquiry follow-up

 ? Coordinate with studio owner on conversion calls and trial bookings

REQUIRED SKILLS:

? 2+ years social media management experience (fitness industry preferred)

? Proven experience running
/Instagram ads with measurable results

? Proficient in Canva, Meta Business Suite, and basic analytics

? Excellent written English (you’ll be responding to Australian clients)

? Experience with CRM systems or lead tracking

? Self-starter who can work independently with clear instructions

BONUS SKILLS:

 ? Google Ads experience

 ? Video editing (CapCut, Premiere, or similar)

 ?
 marketing platforms (Mailchimp, Klaviyo)

 ? Fitness/wellness industry knowledge

WHAT WE PROVIDE:

 ? Complete content calendar and campaign strategy

 ? Brand guidelines, templates, and approved imagery

 ? Ad copy and creative concepts

 ? Direct access to studio owner for questions

 ? Clear KPIs and success metrics

SUCCESS METRICS FOR TRIAL PERIOD:

 ? 50+ qualified leads generated

 ? Minimum 5% engagement rate on organic posts

 ? Cost per lead under $15 AUD on paid ads

 ? 95%+ response rate to inquiries within 2 hours

title: E-commerce Specialist
description:
Ecommerce Virtual Assistant – Amazon FBA/FBM & Shopify (Product & Brand Sourcing Focus)

________________________________________

Job Overview

We are seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Ecommerce Virtual Assistant to support and grow our Amazon and Shopify businesses. This role is heavily focused on product research, brand sourcing, and supplier outreach, along with ongoing catalog and account support.

This is a long-term position for someone who understands Amazon’s ecosystem, can independently source profitable products and brands, and is comfortable using advanced research tools.

________________________________________

Key Responsibilities

Product & Brand Sourcing (Primary Focus)

• Conduct product and brand research for Amazon and Shopify

• Identify profitable, low-risk products using data-driven analysis

• Source wholesale, online arbitrage, private-label, and brand partnership opportunities

• Research brand eligibility, distribution rights, and resale policies

• Build and maintain a brand & supplier lead list

• Perform competitor analysis and pricing research

• Analyze demand, competition, Buy Box trends, and sales velocity

________________________________________

Amazon Account Support

• Support Amazon FBA & FBM operations

• Assist with product listings (creation, optimization, and maintenance)

• Track inventory levels and restock needs

• Analyze Keepa charts for pricing and sales rank history

• Support prep, shipment creation, and ASIN research

________________________________________

Shopify Support

• Assist with product uploads and catalog organization

• Research and upload winning products

• Coordinate basic order processing and fulfillment support

• Update product descriptions, pricing, and images

• Maintain accurate product data

________________________________________

Administrative & Reporting Tasks

• Maintain spreadsheets and dashboards (Google Sheets / Excel)

• Document sourcing criteria, SOPs, and workflows

• Provide weekly performance and sourcing reports

• Communicate findings clearly and proactively

________________________________________

Required Skills & Experience

Amazon & Ecommerce Experience

• Proven experience as an Amazon Virtual Assistant

• Strong understanding of:

o Amazon FBA & FBM

o Sales Rank, Buy Box, fees, ROI, and profit margins

o Amazon policies and restricted brands

• Experience supporting Shopify stores

________________________________________

Required Tools (Must Have Experience)

• SmartScout (brand & competitor research)

• Keepa (price history, sales rank analysis)

• SellerAmp (SAS) or Tactical Arbitrage

• Amazon Seller Central

• Google Workspace (Sheets, Docs, Drive)

• Basic spreadsheet analysis (profit calculations, ROI)

Qualifications

• 1–3+ years experience supporting Amazon or ecommerce businesses

• Strong analytical and research skills

• Highly organized and detail-oriented

• Ability to work independently and follow SOPs

• Excellent written and oral English communication skills

• Reliable internet connection and availability

title: Virtual Executive Assistant (sales & marketing)
description:
About the Role



I’m looking for a highly organized, proactive, and assertive Virtual Assistant to act as my right hand. I’m a big-picture, fast-moving idea guy leading sales and marketing for a growing construction company. I need someone who can bring structure, clarity, and execution to the chaos.



This is not a passive task-taker role. I need someone who can manage me, keep me focused, organize my ideas, and turn plans into action. If you thrive on structure, systems, and ownership, this role will fit you well.



You’ll be deeply involved in marketing execution, CRM management, content coordination, and operational follow-through. You will help keep projects, people, and priorities moving forward.



Core Responsibilities

Executive Support & Organization

Organize ideas, notes, voice memos, and conversations into clear tasks and action plans

Manage task boards (Trello / GHL / Notion if needed) and keep projects on track

Hold me accountable to deadlines, priorities, and commitments

Prepare agendas, summaries, and follow-ups for meetings

Keep things from falling through the cracks



GoHighLevel (VERY IMPORTANT)

Build and manage GHL workflows, pipelines, automations, triggers, and tags

Manage forms, calendars, SMS/email campaigns, and follow-up sequences

Troubleshoot issues and optimize automations for speed and clarity

Maintain clean CRM data and reporting

Coordinate integrations (Zapier, Stripe, forms, booking tools, etc.)



Marketing & Advertising Support

Assist with Google Ads setup, monitoring, and optimization

Support
/Instagram ad workflows and funnel execution

Upload, schedule, and manage social media posts

Help build landing pages, funnels, and lead capture flows

Coordinate
 campaigns and basic copy edits



Graphics & Content

Create basic graphics using Canva (ads, social posts, internal docs, presentations)

Resize and adapt graphics for multiple platforms

Assist with video uploads, descriptions, thumbnails, and organization

Maintain brand consistency across platforms



Operations & Follow-Through

Track marketing KPIs and campaign performance

Coordinate with vendors, tea
mbers, and contractors

Document SOPs and improve systems over time

Keep shared drives, folders, and assets organized



Required Skills & Experience

Advanced GoHighLevel experience (non-negotiable)

Extremely organized and detail-oriented

Assertive and confident communicator who can push back when needed

Strong task and project management skills

Canva proficiency

Experience with Google Ads and basic ad reporting

Familiar with social media scheduling tools



Comfortable working with fast-moving leadership and evolving priorities

Excellent written and spoken English

Personality & Work Style Fit

You love structure, systems, and checklists

You don’t wait to be told what to do



You can say “this isn’t the priority right now” and mean it

You enjoy turning messy ideas into clear plans

You’re calm under pressure and solution-focused

You take ownership and pride in execution



Nice to Have (Big Plus)

Experience working with construction, home services, or local businesses

Knowledge of SEO or local marketing

Experience managing calendars, bookings, and follow-ups

Familiarity with Trello, Notion, Slack, or similar tools



How to Apply



Please include:

A short introduction about yourself

Your experience with GoHighLevel (be specific)

Examples of automations, funnels, or workflows you’ve built

Your Canva and marketing experience

Your internet speed and availability

title: Virtual Assistant
description:
Paid Trial Framework – Virtual Assistant (CRM & Follow-Up)

Trial Objective

Evaluate the applicant’s ability to execute follow-up calls, maintain CRM accuracy, communicate professionally, and

operate independently with minimal supervision.

Trial Structure

• Duration: 7 days

• Hours: 10–15 total hours

• Pay: Hourly paid trial

• Status: Trial engagement with no guarantee of long-term role

Day 0 – Setup & Alignment (Live Video Call)

• Review expectations and KPIs

• Walk through call scripts and CRM workflow

• Confirm schedule and communication cadence

• Set daily reporting requirements

Trial Responsibilities

Follow-Up Calls

• Make outbound calls using provided scripts

• Update lead status accurately in the CRM

• Schedule callbacks or appointments as directed

CRM Management

• Maintain clean, organized CRM records

• Add clear notes after every interaction

• Identify duplicates or incomplete records

Daily Reporting

• Calls made

• Contacts reached

• Appointments or callbacks scheduled

• CRM updates completed

• Issues or questions

Evaluation Criteria

Pass: Meets call volume expectations, keeps CRM clean, communicates clearly, reliable and proactive.

Extend: Shows potential but needs minor coaching.

Fail: Missed hours, poor CRM hygiene, weak communication, or avoidance of calls.

Decision Point

At the end of the trial, a short live video review will determine whether the applicant is hired, extended, or released

based on performance.
